Review: All in all, from a gameplay standpoint it's one of the best SP FPS games ever, and a clear improvement over Doom 2016 in all of the ways that matter most. There's really not much else like this in the modern market. In an age in which arena shooters and movement based shooters are dying and the market is overwhelmingly shifting towards slower, less intense genres like tactical shooters and Battle Royales, it's nice to know that a game like this can still be made and find success. I'll get sappy for a second and say this: Thank you, id Software. You're the only AAA developer that still cares about the things I value in a shooter.
Simply the best FPS ever made. I literally have nothing to add. Music's amazing too, of course.
Great game demons shoot at you. You shoot them back with pew pew and rip the guts.
They are rage, brutal, without mercy. But you. You will be worse. Rip and tear, until it is done.
Doom as usual getting better every year. What it was good now with Eternal is even better, extremely violent, basically all the demons from Hell trying to kill you no matter what all sorts of demons.

The game is beautiful bloody, gore, the main gameplay is long and wonderful!It has 1 DLC The Ancient Gods which is separated in 2 parts, Part 1 you'll play this year and the second half you'll get it in 2021.

DOOM Eternal is the BEST thing that happened with industry and anyone who says different is just a low skill "Call of Duty" boy with arms growing out of the 5-th spot. Its really funny to read some reviews on Steam cause all I see is: "colourfull LGBT interface" and "too hard to play on the hardest difficulty", which again convinces me that people like sh*t and would rather prefer a piece of untested, unotimized and glitchy code (like "Cyberpuke 2077").Devs did best imrovements that one could imagine. Eternal is superfast - dash is probably the most incredible thing that a shooter of this lvl actually needed (also monkeybars and trampolines). Add to this an awesome shooting strategy (chainsaw for ammo, glorykill - health, flamebelch - armor) and freaking SICK sound by Mick Gordon - Eternal has EVERYTHING a true fan of shooters need.Best shooter of all time, to my modest opinion.
If "Smooth as butter" were made into a game. ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ crazy what they pulled off here.

DOOM Eternal is an amazing game that takes everything from DOOM 2016 and improves it, even adding new features that only approve the experience. Let's start off by saying I loved DOOM 2016, It was very fast paced, had amazing gunplay and the glory kills were so awesome. Now for me DOOM Eternal is just like DOOM 2016 but everything has been improved. The graphics have of course been improved, but the visuals have also drastically changed. The background of each level is so unique and cool, for example in the first level with that huge monster in the background, every level has a unique feel to it. The demon models have also been improved and the glory kills are as cool as ever, and super graphic and I love that! Also that soundtrack, my god that soundtrack is SO GOOD!! One of the best soundtracks ever made for a video game for sure, that really compliments the gameplay well, it really makes you feel so badass and when that heavy metal drops you feel invincible. The gameplay is what makes or breaks a DOOM game, and DOOM 2016 really nailed the gunplay and then DOOM Eternal walks in and of course improves upon it. The guns are so fun to use and they all have a purpose. I always felt that the pistol from DOOM 2016 was so useless but I can't think of a single weapon in DOOM Eternal that was useless or bad. The game also runs so smoothly, it's amazing with how fast paced the game is it still ran so smoothly, I don't think I experienced one major frame drop. That's also one thing to keep in mind, this game is very and I mean very fast paced, you need to be on your toes for pretty much the entire game if you're playing on higher difficulties. This is not a normal FPS where you camp somewhere and try to get headshots. In DOOM you face your enemy head on, get right in their face, because that's how you stay alive, health drops from enemies. Even the platforming which was my least favorite part of DOOM 2016 has been improved and is actually fun. The gameplay is absolutely fantastic and I never felt bored once, which is an amazing achievement because even some of my favorite games can have boring moments. The story of DOOM games has never been the focal point, however I'm happy to report that despite this, DOOM Eternal brings a pretty enjoyable story that really commends the chaos of the gameplay. The story is just as crazy as the gameplay at points, which creates very enjoyable moments. There's not more I can say about the story without spoiling it so I'm going to leave it here. Overall, DOOM Eternal is one of my favorite games of 2020 and might actually also be one of my favorite games of all time, and that's not an exaggeration. The graphics, visuals, soundtrack, story and most importantly gameplay with heavy emphasis on the combat are all really great. I honestly don't have anything "bad" to say about the game, there might be some grudges but that's not enough to ruin the experience or even altar it. This is what I would call a perfect FPS. I've never been a huge fan of FPS games but DOOM just reinvents the genre. 10/10

Review: Doom Eternal has to be one of the most interesting First Person Shooters that I have played in a long time. There is so much about this game that really worked for me, with the secrets, the weapons, and just how fun the areas are to explore. The game is a blast to play from start to finish and I just wanted more of it. In my opinion, Doom Eternal is much better than Doom 2016 because everything here is more enjoyable as an experience.

This game truly is amazing, most of the negative reviews are from people who don't like this games flow(what i do understand because it is a bit more advanced than in the earlier doom games. this game may be a bit expensive(especially if you want the dlc's with it too) and requires a strong pc. but for the price you pay it is a great game. and this will probably be the peak of what the doom franchise will become. i will never get tired of the feeling of immortality that this game gives you when you begin the get used to the combat, and even though you feel so powerful and immortal the dev's have also made it so the game keeps difficult and asks for your attention. definitely a masterpiece of a game. i hope microsoft will continue to put as much effort in the next doom games as bethesda and id software have put in this one. i definitely recommend trying this game out for yourself.

Absolutely amazing game, with fun gameplay. As an absolute completionist, at least in DOOM games, I have sinked about 10 hours in one session in, and made it to the "Super Gore Nest" 100% completed. I extremely look forward to playing again because theres just so much to find and the shooter aspect of it is absolutely flawless. At some sections you get stuck for a couple of minutes but eventually you adapt, learn the enemy positions and overcome the hardest part of any level, and thats the most satisfying part of the game in my eyes. Best FPS shooter out there. Very little hand holding and harder difficulties are (for the most part) properly balanced. 10/10 would rip and tear again

This game took everything Doom 2016 had and multiplied it by x10. The Gunplay, The Enemies, Speaking of the enemies, i LOVE the classic look of them. i would've absolutely loved it even more if the original Baron Of Hell Design came back, but the fireborn baron was okay too :)Favorite Demon hands down is the Tyrant. Favorite Gun, is the super shotgun, its very meaty and sleek, and i love the meathook. favorite level probably has to be Final Sin. it feels great to play, and there are absolutely no slowdowns unlike Doom 2016. (ahem, Vega Central Processing) I Recommend it. and remember kids, the Marauder isnt hard.

Doom Eternal is one of those games that bring back the old retro shooter combat but in a newer way. It really is one of the best first person shooters on the market if not the best due to the pacing, the combat, the pickups. and the movement. Doom Eternal's entire focus is on the feel of the combat not the look of the combat, the gun sounds the executions are examples of this.The puzzles do not bother me because they don't last long, and at some point there needs to be a mix up anyway.Doom Eternal is just pure adrenaline fueled, blood soaked carnage that I don't think anyone is going to forget anytime soon.
Combat is like a complex dance, there is no other game where the flow of combat feels so satisfying to play. After fighting its fun to explore maps full of secrets hidden throughout!

Nearly every weapon feels like it has a significant role, a stark contrast to Doom 2016's promotion of 2 weapon playstyles. Ammo counts have been massively reduced, pushing the player towards intelligent use of their loadout. Overall, the way I would describe this difference is that Doom 2016 treats its weapons as a set of toys, in which any can be used at any time without too much consequence. Doom Eternal treats them as tools, and you have to use them well to achieve success.

Excellent first person shooting game with great design and shooting experience.Also the game have a good background while player to collect the story paper to know about that,Rock style music is pretty fit the game when the fight start. Review of ‘ Doom Eternal  ’ Graphic: 8.5 Music: 9 Narrative:8 Gameplay: 9 Score: 9.0
DOOM Eternal is an outstanding title with one of the best shooting I have experienced in gaming, It is a superb title with almost no flaws and adds diverse layers to an established genre.

In DOOM Eternal enemies have weak points that can be exploited to either make them easier to kill or disable a capacity in them, such as long-range weaponry. The attention to detail here is astounding, as you keep searching for these during combat and start to learn their weaknesses. Targeting a weak point is the difference between killing a demon with few bullets or an entire magazine! It is satisfactory, too, as you get to hear a "bing" sound every time you hit a weak point.

Don't listen to all the fools complaining about there being no ammo, you have a chainsaw that recharges itself and when used replenishes around half of your ammo. Rip and tear and, most importantly, chainsaw until it's done.
Its Doom 2016 but better. Better movement and more strategy. Enemies also have weakpoints which is cool.
Compared to the 2016 version, this game is overall better and a worthy successor,
Great game cerebral badass combat and levels.  intensity of Quake married with Doom's enemy roster and its violent, cathartic attitude.

When DOOM came out in 2016, I was shocked of how good it was. When DOOM Eternal came out in 2020, I was shocked of how better is than DOOM (2016). This should say something.

Anyways gotta go melt my face with adrenaline, brain works twice as fast now and real life is way too slow.

Visceral, brutal, fast-paced and challenging, Doom Eternal can seem daunting to someone not used to fast-paced first person shooters. But don't let that put you off - the game does a fantastic job of raising your skill ceiling as you progress, and enemies that might seem impossible on your first few attempts become near cannon-fodder as you master their weaknesses and understand the right weapon combos to apply. Doom Eternal is also one of the very few games I have experienced that produces a state of flow - where after a while you find yourself almost not thinking about the game, just reacting on instinct as you mow down enemy after enemy, never once staying still. At a certain point, something "clicks" and you become one with the game, and what was previously an endless stream of quick decisions in the heat of combat becomes something akin to a blood-soaked dance. The satisfaction of beating a seemingly impossible arena after several attempts is almost euphoric. Overall, Doom Eternal is one of the best games in recent memory, and the best FPS in its category hands down. A tribute to the original Doom with the addition of second-to-second tactics like never before. Get it, and Git Gud.

In an age where every piece of media seems to be cannibalizing my childhood in an attempt to sell my own nostalgia back to me, Doom is a breath of fresh air. I love everything about this game; the pace, the lore, the gore, the mechanical skill, but most importantly, this game is so perfectly designed. It teaches you how to play it, gently pushing you into the fun zone - when you die, it isn't because the game is artificially hard, it's because you made a mistake, and you know exactly what that mistake was. To me, this is a perfect game.
Better than 2016 Doom. Story added more depth to it and world felt more immersive than 2016 Doom.
Very fast paced first person shooter that gets even faster the more you progress so far I've played 11 hours and I'm having a great time with it I can only hope it gets better from here.

Fun game. There is a lot to do while exploring the levels it features, and its gameplay is always filled with adrenaline and the exhibition of how good you can be while playing it. I had a great time with it as I went from being scare of demons to punching them out of existence!
I highly recommend this game cuz you'll love to kill those demons with a bunch of different weapons and just kill all of them! no mercy allowed playing Doom or you're dead!
This is, simply, the best FPS there is right now. Feels like an infuriatingly hard yet extremely fun amusement park.

I think this game is really, really good. The only issue I have with it is that there gap in difficulty from ultra-violence to nightmare is a bit too steep. On ultra-violence I beat most encounters without dying or in a few tries at best, however on nightmare I die a lot, and it takes me many tries to beat the same encounters i did with relative ease on ultra-violence. Aside from this i have nothing negative to say about the game.

Maravilloso, super frenético y adictivo, anima a volver a jugar la campaña y seguir mejorando. Su multijugador quizá sea la parte que quede cojeando, pero su punto fuerte que es la campaña es genial, ademas de que se profundiza en la narrativa del protagonista para explicarnos algo mas de su historia.

Okay, Denuvo's gone now. This game is safe to download and play. Original review:It is unacceptable to include Anti-Cheat software with Kernel-level access to your operating system in a video game. It's even worse to add it a few months after release without warning. Bethesda should not be able to get away with this. To clarify: Kernel-level access essentially means complete access to your operating system. Anti-cheat software should not need this level of access. Ever. I recommend that you stay far away from this game until Denuvo Anti-Cheat is removed.

Новый DOOM вышел довольно отличной игрой. Сейчас я распишу сразу плюсы и минусы. + В игре хорошая музыка ( - есть некоторые моменты где она не подходит к обстановке), -+ графон (в DOOM 2016 была намного реалистичней графон, в 2020 он более мультяшный), + продолжительность,  + хардкор, + разнообразие мобов, - слишком медленное добивание врага, которое замедляет геймплей, а ты хочешь рубить демонов под хорошый музон не останавливаясь (хотя есть перк на ускорение, но это надо аж тратить 1 слот на это), + разнообразие оружия и их модификации, - блевотный интерфейс (хоть его можно и изменить, но он все равно остаеться вырви-глазным). Самый жирный плюс игры - это её оптимизация, за все время игра ни разу не вылетила или как-то либо подлагнула или начала фризить. Насчет сюжета ничего не могу сказать, он хороший и неплохой.

Doom Eternal is a kinetic first person shooter that shows just how fun a video game can be. A Solid 9/10, and was very close to a 10 for me, but, for all the praise, it has flaws.GameplayThe gameplay is simple, with the Doom Slayer reacting in the way you expect and all times, every mechanic is simple: do this, and get an output. Yet the chaotic fast paced shooting quickly becomes complex and methodical. Every simple idea gets compounded one, after another, after another, each is explained but it takes the entire campaign to truly understand the mechanics that are given to you. The game is brilliantly paced. Abilities you learned at earlier levels you find yourself using more and more with other abilities later in game, finding synergies amongst your equipment. The game gives exponentially more options, making each combat encounter having thousands to millions of ways to approach. Whether going for a weak point on a big enemy, or ridding a entire area of smaller ones, the gameplay keeps the interactions between you and demons interesting with the game giving you so many ways to approach, you truly adapt to the game and learn it through and through.DesignThe Design of the game is made to be fast,. The faster you are the less likely you are you get trapped or hit. This incentivisation of quick reaction gameplay keeps the player on their toes. The genius decision by the Devs to give every enemy you encounter a certain weakness makes switching your arsenal frequent and engaging. The gameplay keeps itself fresh as you constantly have to change your approach from demon to demon. The designs of the different enemies are distinct, and with how fast you move, a glance and you know what is over in that direction. Every enemy is engaging, with all of them having attacks which you can take advantage of, and each one being fun to engage with in combat. (except for one, we will get there)LoreFor having no story, the game has surprising amounts of lore, which can be accessed at any time through the pause menu. The amount of lore you have depends on where you are in the game. I found this system enhanced the experience, and made the game an interesting story experience as well as a gameplay one which doesn’t intrude on repeat play-thrus, which I feel is the perfect balance between the two concepts.Multiplayer: The multiplayer, After the feedback from the first game (Doom (2016)) that the death match mechanics did not match the original game, the developers created one, if not the most creative multiplayer experiences to date. It’s a 1 V 2, with the one being the Doom Slayer himself. The other two being two of the tougher demons, which can spawn underlines, which effectively make an ever adapting assault against the doom slayer in a quick matched arena battle. The multiplayer does have a few glitches to do with the demons being pushed out of the map when spawning, but shortly after they are transported back to their spawn, this can be jarring, but isn't game breaking.FlawsThe game does come with previously mentioned bugs. I ran into a soft lock, as well as some overly hard to get to collectibles, but other then that, the biggest flaw comes in the form of the enemy which stops the game in its tracks every time they appear, causing the player to stand still and simply wait for them to attack, this is The Marauder.Marauder: Unlike all of the other demons, this one can not be killed normally. Whenever it is shot it will resist any damage by pulling up a shield, the marauder can not be faked out or tricked, they will never miss a block. If you get too aggressive and get to close the Marauder attacks instantaneously. If you are too far away they throw projectiles and adds, And the middle ground seems to fluctuate wildly. (which is the only time the Marauder will be able to be hit) The only time you can attack is then the Marauder does their axe attack, which draws the entire game to a halt because it’s random if the marauder is going to. The Marauder is the most annoying part of the game, and is by far the most flawed. (The funny thing is, Marauders are playable in multiplayer, and are fixed. They don’t have shields, and their best defense is movement, meaning you have to predict where they are going to be, which in turn, keeps the Marauder engaging to fight unlike in the actual game.)OverAll I enjoyed my time with  immensely, it’s a strong 9/10 , with the down moments being frustrating, but the highs being so energetic and befitting for one of the best games of the year.

Once you get into it, it's actually better than the 2016 version overall. The first 90 minutes I was left thinking that'd they'd made a mistake with the ammo attrition, but thankfully it gets a lot better as you more weapons. At first, I thought the platforming is sometimes a bit much, but as you get into it and comfortable, you start to love it. both games had that to some degree. If you don't like first person platforming this is NOT the game for you. Do yourself a favour and turn off the environment screen shake as it's obnoxious when climbing walls. The ammo counts are a bit too low in early game, resulting in too much survival based combat with the chainsaw and glory kills being required mandatory tasks rather than fun things you could do as and when you chose to. I also don't like how you can't now just equip the chainsaw and run around with it. Yes, it didn't really serve any gameplay purpose to do that over this new system, but it still just felt badass. However once you realise the chainsaw auto-regens it makes this a lot more palatable as you don't need to constantly hunt for fuel and you can actually use it far more often m/ The UI is a downgrade though - the lime green / yellow art style doesn't suit the game and looks a bit cheap. The art style for the UI in the first game was so much better, and that can't be overstated. The font choices they have used are really awful. Audio is improved from the first one though, where the sound effects previously weren't always that good and there were some questionable EQ. The music mix is also improved, it's just as epic but a less fatiguing mix. The default mix does put the music way too loud though, but this can be adjusted. The game plays and runs superbly well though and the visuals are amazing - if you liked the first one, then you'll probably like this one, just give yourself an hour to get the first sections out the way as they are not the most inspiring.

Exactly the evolution I expected from developers. Not at all disappointed.I did not play the DOOM 2016 on release date, I actually waited for a very long time, bought in on sale and played on a PS4. I liked the gameplay so much that I basically stopped, turned on my PC and played it there with Steam Family Sharing (my brother is a huge DOOM fan). I must have played that game for at least 40 to 60 hours.DOOM Eternal for me was a must play on release date. I was hyped to see what they can come up on a gameplay perspective to already improve the very addicting cycle of the previous one.GAMEPLAYThis category was heavily improved. The demons are separated in the codex into sections, you have the common demons that are basically cannon fodder, you use them to get either health from Glory Kills or Ammo with the Chainsaw.YOU NEED THE CHAINSAW. Ammo is no joke, you are constantly using your entire arsenal, and with the need to replenish ammo in the middle of a fight.You have more equipment, a Frost Grenade, a Frag Grenade and a Flamethrower all mounted up on your shoulder in a Predator-like add on to the suit.Heavy Demons now have weak points, that require precision in the middle of a crowded fight. For example, the Mancubus has two flamethrowers you need to snipe out in order to reduce his threat. So, you can remove each weapon and then focus on other demons, or maybe just focus on him entirely, is your choice.You have a Meat Hook with the Super Shotgun, you can DASH, Double jump, Vault on yellow pipes. The amount of mid air options they added is actually very good. You are a lot more mobile this time around.If you sum up all of these improvements, not only the game feels different than the 2016 one, but is improved in every way, the weak points require you to think in the middle of a fight how to cripple a heavy demon and then get back on the move, and when you move, the levels are designed so you always have an escape route, you just need to be creative and never stand still.Oh, the SWORD. Period.GRAPHICSNew Engine looks great, I think the biggest improvement is that you can see the damage you are doing to every demon, pieces of flesh fly out of their bodies when you shoot them, you leave exposed bone and tissue. The blood looks better.And in general there are some levels that make you say “Wow this looks very good” there is even a level at the end, that a door opens and I literally thought “Amazing” and the AI that is with you the entire trip says something “I know right, looks amazing”. Great job there.STORYThis is the first DOOM game where I actually cared about the Story, not only that, you no longer have to rely absolutely on the CODEX to learn about the world. There is carefully crafted story, you can follow up no matter what. Sure, there are some things and flashbacks to real DOOM fans out there. But in general, is a good story, you get to see unfold. The bosses and priests all have great voice acting. And it made me want to check the codex very often to improve the information.By the time you are in the last couple of missions, you WANT to know more, you WANT to see more flashbacks and understand the way this world works. The explanations on Argent Energy, Hell and Earth, they are all very interesting.SOUND / MUSICI played with a 7.1 Headset all the time, and the sound is spotless. You can listen every little thing that happens, from demons getting obliterated, to the chain in the Meat Hook. Even the little flame and embers of your flamethrower.The music is exactly what you are expecting if you are a fan of the Heavy Metal DOOM 2016. Boy you will be pleased here. Is so satisfying to hear the tunes while you are killing demons, and the careful way the tunes fade out once you managed to kill them all and get out of danger.OVERALLThis game is a 9/10 for me. I do not use a perfect score because I think there are some improvements in pacing. For the first two thirds of the game you fell the progress, but by the last 3 missions the levels are basically designed to throw you every upgrade and consumable you missed. I played on a 100% exploration run and my suit was pretty much upgraded by when I was about 70% of the campaign, and I am sad to say that there are more upgrades on the map, than the ones you need to be 100%. I would have liked a more calculated experience. If you want a 100% suit and weapon upgrades, you need to do 100% combat and exploration on every level.

Review: This is a very biased review of course, but this is my favorite game ever made. I will happily explain why, and having going back to playing Doom 2016 for an hour today, it is actually weird how many negative things I notice that I haven't before about the game. So far, I've doubled my playtime in Eternal (122 hours at the moment) compared to 62 over the past 4 years in 2016. Now: what makes the game good, in my opinion, and what are my responses to the criticisms? Gorgeous art direction. If you go back and replay Doom 2016, take a look at nearly every area in the entirety of that game. It looks identical to Doom 3, for all of the **** that people give that game. Doom Eternal expands on the ideas of the OG games, opting for epic landscapes and portrayals that I've always wanted out of Doom 2: Hell On Earth as a young kid. Without spoiling anything, within the 14 levels you never go to the same place twice. I don't think this'll count as spoilers, so I'll include the list: Hell On Earth with city landscapes and various architecture and cool **** for story reasons I won't say, we go to the Sentinel homeworld with the gorgeous trees and medieval castles, go to the general pits of Hell, where the consumption of Earth's architecture has been rooted. You go to the icy northern parts of Earth with various architecture from a faction, you go to the more barren mountainous and foggy very industrial complex hosting a major enemy, you go to the "Super Gore Nest" (give it a Google), you go the heart of the resistance and other story bits, as well as major enemy, you go to Phobos' UAC sci-fi complex with the BFG 10k, you go to the outer destroyed surface of mars and various floaty bits left behind, you go to the hellish corrupted core (with some sick **** setpieces man), you go to the more regal portions of the Sentinel world, you go to the absolutely horrid factory deposits of hell and such a banger **** song, and "Urdak" (a unique heaven thing, it's pretty cool). Enemy variety, of course, is superb. Now, this isn't 2016; you can't kill everything with the double barrel shotgun like a wild goose. This game is hard. It's actually quite similar to chess (I know, super cliche analogy), but if you don't learn the mechanics it'll kick your ass.

The game is really fun. The main negative parts for this game I see is the platforming, ammo, and multiplayer.First off, platforming isn't difficult neither is it plentiful. The only level with a lot of platforming is Urdak, and even in that level 80% is run and gun shooting.Now onto ammo. Maximum ammo amounts in this game are low, yes (maximum 60 shells in Doom 2016 and 24 shells in this game), but you can easily chainsaw a fodder demon to get your ammo up. So I don't really understand those reviews.Now onto multiplayer. As of the time of writing, the only multiplayer mode is Battlemode. Not sure if the developers will release any other modes, but that's beside the point. Battlemode is probably the only slightly bad part of this game. I had fun in it for about ~10 hours, then it got repetitive and boring. The main issue with the game's multiplayer is the lack of modes. One mode just isn't enough.Overall it's a really good fps game, as good or possibly better than rival games like Halo. Highly recommend buying if you are into metal music and fast-paced games, full of action and gore.

The best fps today, its mechanics is almost perfect since the dash and the tubes that allow you to hang yourself, also the artificial intelligence that is more aggressive and that forces you to move from one side to the other is incredible and make the gameplay It is much more aggressive and frantic than the previous doom (2016), its music is totally incredible in each situation you hear it at each level, the story is not very well done but it is fine, since in a game like doom, the story It's not that important. If you are not sure of buying the game, there is no other way, but to spoil the story by watching other people's gameplays, since apparently there are people who bought the game without knowing what was going to come in the game or what They knew and that's why they complain that `` It was not what I expected '' and other absurd things like that, when in the quake-con and E3 they showed in gameplays that the dash and the tubes to hang you, among other things, were already implemented in the game . It is one thing to say that you do not like mechanics and your opinion is well respected, but another thing to say the game is horrible just because you do not like it or because yes, that is to be mediocre.

ID took an absolutely incredible game, (DOOM 2016) and somehow made it better in every way. The map design is amazing. the arenas are fun and allow lots of mobility so you can jump, dash, and swing while crushing demons. And the parts of the game where you're not fighting are beautiful and filled with Easter eggs and secrets. The combat and resource management is prefect. Each weapon has a propose and can be used to get a huge advantage over some demons. The chainsaw allows you to always have enough ammo as long as you play the right way without letting you abuse the chaingun or plasma rifle as well as making you more aware of where your shots go. Visually this game is also amazing. More cartooney than 2016 in some ways but the sky boxes are some of the best I've seen and Nekravol and Urdak were so fun to look at. The enemies in this game are awesome. The fodder allow you to regain health and ammo but can still get some solid hits in if you're distracted by a heavy demon. A lot of people hate the Marauder but he's one of the funnest enemies to fight. You have to keep your eyes on him at all times but you also have to make sure you're not being distracted. The soundtrack is dope as **** and I actually liked some of the non metal like the music in Urdak. The multiplayer is ehh. Not for me. But I did'n't buy a DOOM game for the multiplayer. Although I do think an arena shooter would be a good addition. All in all an incredible game that I love just as much if not more that 2016 ans the original DOOM's. probably best played on Nightmare if you can handle it. Very mu7ch looking forward to the DLC's.

So, this game does not look like DOOM 2016, but this game is just awesome. It got a lot of new features to diversify your game experience. We got picturesque views,  different locations that were missed in DOOM 2016. The setting looks like an old DOOM was upgraded in 2020. Also, we got new weapons,  new demons, a lot of bosses and mini-bosses, upgrades for them, a lot of new collectibles, and "side quests". Also, we got quite a good plot that founded on the bible.  The gameplay is different, we got parkour, puzzles, and certainly fights that look awesome. Fights became faster, we got a lot of ways to kill the demons.In conclusion, I want to say that this game is cool, and maybe this is the best shooter of the new decade, but you should play in it like a new chapter but not a sequel.

DOOM Eternal is a great sequel to 20016's DOOM and one of the best games i have played so far!!! I constantly compare DOOM eternal to films like Evil Dead 2 and Hostel part 2 in the way that they are all sequels but at the same time acts like soft reboots by changing some elements like the tone or genre.This time around DOOM Eternal focus more into telling a story that for being honest it is actually descent and the game manage to balance both gameplay and story, something that DOOM 3 couldn't properly manage.As the previous game, DOOM eternal features the same frenetic fast paced action and combat and it adds a couple of new features like dash, a flame thrower and a grenade that can be switched to an ice grenade. Glorious kills makes a comeback as well the chainsaw.The level design was made with the intention to add multiple ways to engage the enemy and with the goal to encourage the player to explore every corner in search of ester eggs and hidden secrets like toys, tracks from the soundtrack and cheat codes and other features that can help you upgrading your suit for better abilities.The game features a new mechanic which is the "permadeath" it is obvious that if you die you'll be punished to start from the beginning, that's why exploring the levels is crucial to find extra lifes that will keep you going trough the game cuz you'll going to need them... the game gets harder and harder the more you progress.Now let's move to the negative point of the game which for me it's only one... platforming sections!!! those are unnecessary and annoying, why did ID Software add this?In my whole time playing DOOM i only encounter one crash that got easily fixed by only lowering one specific setting... something that has the word "pool" on it.Moving to the performance, i've heard that is a really demanding game overall, sadly i cannot say that as i didn't test it on other rigs. For me the game ran pretty well with a solid framerate using the ultra nightmare settings on a GTX 1080 Ti, and i got amazed that my pc ran pretty cold, considering that i have a pretty mediocre cooling system, maybe the game is well optimized? it can be.The visuals does not disappoint, the game  has some really cool lighting and particle effects, animations are fluent and the detail on the enemy wounded flesh looks nasty and bloody, really impressive what the new Id Tech 7 can achieve now.Let's see what the future holds for DOOM.

There is still a problem with narrow rooms, but they are in the whole game very few therefore it is not oh really big minus

ESPAÑOL: Doom Eternal es uno de los mejores FPS que podrás probar. Es rápido, desafiante, visceral y  con un nivel de detalle increible. En este juego no vas usar la superescopeta para absolutamente todo como un loco... no... este juego, como en los antiguos DOOM, se trata de pensar, ser rápido y utilizar bien tus recursos. DOOM Eternal busca que domines su forma de combate, que te hará cambiar de armas todo el tiempo dependiendo del demonio que aparezca y la situación. Sin darte cuenta actuarás de forma instintiva para poder salvar tu pellejo utilizando las armas adecuadas en un momento jodido. En ese momento, estas dominando la danza de DOOM. Junto a su increíble Gameplay, incluye una increíble campaña con unos niveles diseñados casi a la perfección junto a secciones de plataformas satisfactorias, y que expande el lore y la historia de doom como nunca antes, pero para los que solo quieren disparar, todo lo que incluye a la historia puede ser salteado, ya que algo secundario que el jugador elige abarcar o no, y se agradece. El multiplayer es probablemente la parte mas floja de este juego, ya que no tenemos mas a los modos de juego anteriores o al SnapMap, sino que tenemos al "BATTLEMODE", un modo en donde 1 Slayer y 2 Demonios (los 3 controlados por jugadores) pelean en diferentes rounds. Siento que este modo de juego no mantendrá vivo como para que la gente siga activa jugando, menos aun  cuando las únicas recompensas son XP para cosmeticos en una serie a lo Fortnite. EDIT: No he mencionado cosas de la campaña como las mejoras del traje, armas, etc, pero definitivamente hace que la progresión del juego sea igual de buena que la de la dificultad. En conclusión: DOOM ETERNAL de seguro se irá a los GOTY, como mejor juego o al menos como mejor OST, porque su gameplay es la evolución de la franquicia de Id Software, y sin dudas es 10 veces mejor que Doom 2016, que ahora al volver a ese juego, se queda atrás y parece un juego "simple", comparado a esto. Su multi es un poco decepcionante, y espero que cosas como SnapMap vuelvan al cast. No le doy el 10 por lo del Multi, pero probablemente tendría un 9,8 o 9,5 si no fuera porque Metacritic no me deja poner mas que 9. Saludos y compren este juego YA.

This game is almost a perfect FPS campaign, also I'd say that if you are a metalhead you HAVE to play this, even if you're not interested in games at all, this is an actual metal simulator! But jokes aside: from what I've seen, most complaints people have toward this game are: platforming, more linear levels, than in the previous installment and Marauders, so let me address those: If you really hate platforming, then you won't like it here, but imo it is as good, as it can get in an FPS game, that is not focusing on platforming per se, it provides breaks from the break-neck pace of the fighting sections and I kind of like it, it certainly don't ruin anything. As for the level design I must admit, that some of the levels are basically a straight line in their general structure, but there's so much stuff to do and discover throughout them, that they really don't feel much linear, when you play them and they are also waaay bigger then in 2016's. Lastly the infamous Marauders. If you don't know what I'm talking about, then basically there's this new enemy type that is kind of a unofficial boss and he requires you to dramatically change your approach for the time he's around, but really it's not that bad, as some people say, I've seen videos where people playing on a controller stunlock this dude to death, so git gud I guess. :D I'm not going to break down each and every new mechanic and tool and how it affects the game loop, I'll just say that there's a lot of new stuff, but it's all really smartly designed, everything has it's purpose and you really need to use all your tools and weapons this time around if you want to get through this game, as it's way harder then the previous one. Fortunately the devs did a great job in explaining how and why each element of the gameplay is important, like chainsawing for ammo, flame belching for armor and so on, so no one should get lost in this. Graphics are amazing, weapon and monster sounds are as metal, as the music (and omg the MUSIC, it deserves it's own review, really), general design of locations and everything else is out of this world and almost trippy ridiculous at times, but in a good sense. This installment is pretty story-heavy compared to the last one, and it has quite a few 3rd person cutscenes, some people liked the miinimalistic direction of D2016 better, but I don't mind the approach here, it all comes together nicely, especially if you read the codex along the way, which I recommend you do. Also the Battlemode, which obviously is not the focus of the game is pretty fun for couple of hours, once you get used to it, it's a nice addition. I really can't recommend this game enough, and I'm only giving it a 9, instead of 10, because of some minor visual bugs and the fact that sometimes, when you get out of a glory kill animation you can find yourself already surrounded by the enemies, which can kill you almost instantly, if you're on nightmare difficulty, which feels to me like a cheap death, this really shows how aggressive the AI is in this one. Basically, if you're an FPS fan of any sort you should try this game! And remember scores and reviews are temporary, but DOOM is ETERNAL. m/

Doom Eternal was a fantastic experience from start to finish. Starting with the things I disliked, forcing people to use a Bethesda.net account isn't great (I didn't personally care too much but it should be a choice to have online turned off). The platforming got a bit stale but I really enjoyed it overall. The story (although not necessary for a Doom title in my opinion.) felt really boring and it felt like I was being forced  to read the codex's to understand what was going on. But you can play this game and have a great time without story. Lastly, the online, the experience felt shallow and unbalanced, and it could use some new modes. Onto the things I liked. I really loved the new cartoon-ish nature of the new art style, but it didn't take me out of the experience. The new glory kills were gory and really badass. The game felt challenging which is a nice change from 2016 (which I loved)  where you could just use the super shotgun the whole game.  The game forced you to learn how to use new weapons and manage health and ammo strategically. The world was great to look at with beautiful set pieces. The game felt smooth and well optimized which is rare for a Bethesda title! Lastly, the Mick Gordon soundtrack was great, each track felt unique and made ripping and tearing fell so much more satisfying. Overall this game is worth the money! It offers tons of content and replay value with challenging special game-modes.
Was really fun to play from beginning to end! took some time to adjust to stuff; like the smaller ammo count and platforming. But overall, it was worth the delay!

If im honest this is probably the most fun fps I have played in a long time. I did not play Doom 2016 but after watching a few videos about this game I bought it and after playing it I did not regret that decision. I have not finished the game at the time of writing this but at this point in time I can still recommend this game to anyone that likes fast pace game play with nicely done platforming elements and beautiful gore. 10/10 even after running into some minor bugs.

Lemme just open this up by say that anyone who posts a negative review, or updates their game to a negative review, over the recent patch with Denuvo, is a **** idiot. That is NOT on this game, that is on Bethesda. Go to their social media and complain to them there. All you're doing by review bombing is **** all over the work of Hugo Martin and Id Software. Now for the review. It ain't perfect, but it comes close, and is a damn good follow up to 2016. The levels are structured greatly, and feel like larger versions of classic doom levels, chock ful of secrets. The collectibles are nice, which, combined with the platforming, makes it feel like Id trying their hand at a FPS version of Banjo Kazooie. Controls feel nice and tight. Onto the bad stuff. I might be in the minority, but I loved SnapMap in 2016. It's absence here makes Eternal feel a little bit smaller. I won't say there isn't replay value, because there is, but it can feel hollow after a while. Also, whoever made the decision to surround the center of my screen in red when I'm at low health, can you not? It makes it very hard to see in the somewhat darkened areas of the game. Otherwise though, I'm excited to see what the future holds for this game.
Way better than what i expected. This one actually has some sort of meaning, not just mindless shooting. 7.7 is way too low score for this.

Aright so imagine DOOM 2016 but they added fun platforming to give you a break from the constant action, more strategy that requires you use every weapon for specefic enemies so that your mind is never bored of just using the same gun all the time, Imagine a bigger world filled with even more lore for the DOOM franchise and a longer campaign that will be around 22 hours long.You really cant go wrong here this is personally the best fps ive played in a very long time I would without a doubt give this game a 9.5/10

First! - The story is what doom needed, nothing that will slow down the experience.Second! - Oh my! the graphics are amazing, Doom 2016 graphics we're already amazing.Third! - Killing those demons is the most satisfying ever, ripping the demons eyes out is sooo! much fun.Forth - Jumping like a monkey is ALOT of fun.Verdict : 10.0

I think I understand the negative huffing about this game - mostly because it is very different and requires a shift or perspective to enjoy. This might already ruffle people who just wanted MORE of DOOM'16 which was quite a blast. But Doom Eternal isn't a straightforward filling of the same ordeal, just bigger and nicer looking. It's a different beast. It's more... tactical. In Previous Game you could just sport Super Shotgun and literally never change your weapon. You could maybe sometimes smash that BFG button, but that's about it. ETERNAL allows this, but it warns you heavily, that this is a very hard approach and not a recommended one, since enemies now varies in which weapon and tactic is well suited for taking them down. It can be irritating, because it feels like the game forces you to play in the exact way the designers want you to. It feel a bit hand-holdy. It feel forced. AND YET, if you stop resisting, if you give in and accept their systems, the game is still unyieldingly fun and engaging. It just clicks at certain point. You will freeze a clump of mooks, put them alight with flamethrower, blast them with a few rockets and collect all that juice and armor, saving one mook for a chainsaw pinata for ammo. It becomes so fluid, so tense because of the ONSLAUGHT of demons matched only by their ferocity. You need to be faster. You need to make correct decision. You are given plenty of tools to tackle a problem, and you will discover that you can utilize various tactics still. Charge the heat blast for the plasma when dealing damage, taking that Hunter shield down when using the blast for heavy Crowd Control as it staggers and does big damage too... Dash to the side, switch to the Shotgun, blast some harassing heavy. Jump away, rocket launcher to punish that Pain Elemental in mid air with lock on rockets. Land with your heavy cannon ready with scope to chink off weapons of that mancubus... It's a beautiful dance, and for it, I really enjoyed the game.

PROS:+Amazing gameplay+Amazing soundtrack+Amazing exploration+great graphics+Crazy fun+lots of variety in both weapons and enemies CONS:-You're thrown inside a vague and cryptic story while the game focus on being multiplayer-oriented, given the leveling and reward system that has been set in place. So one could say the story is a little OFF, but nothing much.

Doom Eternal je dalším skvělým zástupcem stejnojmenné série, která je za mě nejlepší first person shooter na PC a každý by jej měl okusit. Vynikající audio, grafika vyhnána do extrému a optimalizace celé hry na jedničku. Suprová hratelnost zaručená značkou ID, trocha sentimentu i nostalgie mile překvapuje celým průběhem hry. Démoni a další démoni k zabíjení! Doom je čistá řežba a dlouho zůstane na vrcholu akčních her.Na konec musím jen vypíchanou slabší multiplayer, velmi málo herních módů což je škoda, uvidíme zda něco kluci přidají,... a v celé hře chybí destrukce skla. Na to sklo stále čekám,,, kdy už budu moci prohodit démona vitrínou, kdy?

It is a different game than Doom 2016 was, that's for sure.The platforming caught me off guard and it took me quite some time to get along. I've died many more times by falling than by being killed by demons, yet now I actually enjoy it. It is fun, after all. There are many secret areas that show on your automap, yet actually getting to them isn't always easy. It's not impossible either, tho!I was disappointed by the low ammo storage (even when fully upgraded!) but after some time learnt how to deal with it (chainsaw is the obvious answer, along with using all of your arsenal.That's getting us to my main complaint - it doesn't work so well with the necessity to use specific weapons against specific demons. It kinda destroys Doomguy's creativity. And the story & lore I really love! I've read most of the codex entries and watched most of the YouTube theories videos. I can only hope it will expand with the upcoming DLCs.It is true the game is somewhat dumbed down and the "legal" in-game cheats weren't necessary, TBH... But it's up to you, after all, nobody forces you to use them.The campaign was a little too short for me my liking, but leet's hope the DLCs will cover that as well.I don't care at all about multiplayer, so not rating that. Overall, I liked it and I'm glad it wasn't a simple copy of 2016, which many people would like more, as it seems.
Awesome!!  Jogo é incrível. Melhor ainda que o antecessor. Novas mecânicas ótima otimização e gameplay fenomenal

Eternal is a great game, but you should come into it with the mindset that this is not the same game as Doom 2016. It's much harder and heavily rewards mastery of its mechanics, offering new challenges that expand on those found in the last entry. There's many new features and tools given to you that at first can seem overwhelming, but use them correctly and you'll find yourself performing a beautiful ballet of demon genocide. Combine that with the great art direction and yet another amazing soundtrack from Mick Gordon and it's no surprise that this is one of the most intense and rewarding FPS games I've ever played.
Fantastic Game, Very fun, Metal as ****. Go out and buy this game. No need to say anymore

What can I say about Doom Eternal?  It’s a very worthy sequel to the 2016 title with even more fast-paced, guns a' blazin', demon slayin’ gameplay with some neat platforming thrown in the mix.  If you are a fan of the previous title (or Doom in general), then this is a must buy. Although there are now some more story elements and platforming involved, the gameplay remains the bread and butter.  I implore anyone to play this on the harder difficulties (at the very least on Ultra Violence) because it will force you to learn all the tools at your disposal, your enemies’ weaknesses, and really make you think what weapon to use for each situation and what enemies you want to take out first, which makes every fight an intense and thrilling one.  You might come out of each battle just barely alive, but it’s incredibly fun and rewarding when you come out on top.  Best of all, it does a fantastic job of making you feel like this unrelenting force; it’s pure bliss.  The game does a great job of breaking up each fight with a little bit of story, some really fluid and fun platforming, and of course, exploration to find collectibles and upgrades.  The story is no way intrusive, you can dive into the lore as much as you want or get right into the action.  The story is there to serve one purpose, and that is to show just how much of a badass the Doom Slayer is. My only critique is the aesthetics of the menus and HUD.  It’s a lot more colorful and vibrant this time around, but I prefer Doom 2016’s menus.  I didn’t mind it and was never distracting at any point, but it’s just something to take note of. Doom Eternal is just an awesome game.  You can clearly see how much passion went into making this.  Everything from the graphics, music, gameplay, story and everything else is just so well done and on point.  Do yourself a favor, and pick this one up!

A great game if you are cooped up in quarantine. Not so hard as to push people away, but challenging enough to make winning and pulling off things like combos rewarding. It could have calmed down with the cutscenes and cleaned the story more but the actual ‘game’ part is great.

This game is a masterpiece. Looks awesome. The action is awesome. It is very nostalgic with many references from the 90s games and the game itself is a tribute to the game that made FPS be what it is today. So much that you can actually play it in Doom Eternal, though it is hidden. The lore is cool, but I dont think they should with that night sentinel medieval thing too much. I think they should stick with the futuristic space marine with big badass guns thing vs demons and all sorts of unholy evil creatures stuff. The ambience, immersion, and tension is better with DOOM 2016. Doom Eternal also made me feel tense whe  playing the first playthrough, but not because of huge immersion and dark things happening there, but because i knew this game was harder and the many ways it could just screw me throwing multiple enemies with new and daring mechanics all at once. It was a thrill because i knew it is chalenging ad tha would require much from me. But this game still does a great job, though with a different aproach to that. Too many mechanics should overwhelm some people, but i think the core audience just loves it. Particularly the dash I use all the time because im required to in order to dominate the combat, but i dont like it. Makes it feel like playing Tracer from Overwatch, which has a totally different feel to every Doom game. I dislike that and would like to play Doom just with that awesome classic really fast pacing Doomguy's regular walk has. Also having monkeybars around every corner further breaks immersion and doesnt feel like it's something that belongs there. The action is good, but it doesnt feel right. Battlemode i found a bit sucky. I usually just play it to complete events and thats it. DOOM 2016 had a much better multiplayer. I reckon they didnt follow the same model so people would maybe go to Quake Champions for that. There a few bugs, most of them seems to be visual. Skins dont work very properly. If u wanna make ur skins work right for aome reason u gotta switch off the weapon skins. They have a really good variety of skins both at the present but also upcoming for a game that doesnt monetise that. Anyways best action I ever had the pleasure of playing. Best FPS I ever played along with Doom 2016. Both this and DOOM 2016 each with a different feel, although most of it is the same.
The game is a blast to play. bouncing around and blasting demons and watching them explode is satisfying. The music is just great. there in my eyes is not much better then this game.

This is a great game. Doom 2016 felt exactly like doom but with modern graphics, which means the game design was 20 years old, and it really showed. You lacked mobility, everything was muddy, and sometimes you had to walk around the whole map in cicrcles. This game is everything a modern Doom should be, and feels as if the series got regular entries throughout the years and got better every time. There are much more weapons than last time, and each of them has a usecase. The art and sound direction are insane (the Makyr chapter is one of the most mesmerizing levels I've seen in a shooter, only being beaten by Zen in Black Mesa). I'd say the quality here is on par or even better than Titanfall 2. I'm judging it for the singleplayer only, I have no interest in playing the multiplayter. I get that people are angry because of some anticheat update, but it's certainly not a 0/10 because of that update. Just unreasonably angry boycotting imo.

Absolute masterpiece in summary. Doom Eternal is the perfect sequel to Doom (2016) my only astronomically small nit-picky problem is that they didn't use BFG Division in the soundtrack as much.Keep up the amazing work ID, you never fail to surprise me every new release.
Es buen juego, con una historia mas profunda que relata los origenes y las motivaciones del doom slayer.

Pedazo de shooter!!.. frenético como ningún otro me recuerda un poco al Shadow Warriors 2 en su jugabilidad me encanta la agresividad desmesurada, la ira de doomguy y el frenetismo del juego ID software se supo reinventar... es la revoluciona de los juegos en toda regla te sientes como todo un castigador de demonios y mas si lo juegas a la máxima dificultad El Sountrack en algunas pistas se nota que están tocadas por el  propio Mick Gordon otras no tantoaun me sigue pareciendo mas épico el ost del 2016 aunque tampoco es un trabajo mediocre ni mucho menos de este ost saco un par de canciones que me encantaron no hagan caso de el montón de haters que hay puntuando el juego con baja calificación es gente débil, Amargada, lenta y frustrada que quedo viviendo en el pasado acostumbrada a jugar juegos mas de estarse quieto mientras disparas y les quedo grande el manejo y la cantidad de  frenetismo necesario para este titulo ya que en el anterior aunque te movías para no morir al lado del Eternal se queda en pañales solo digo una cosa JUEGUENLO POR USTEDES MISMOS y saquen sus propias conclusiones.

Un excelente juego con gran manejabilidad y que se disfruta mucho a cada momento, unos gráficos increíbles y que no es apto para mucha gente gatillo fácil, porque no solo es disparar sino pensar rápido y moverte mucho, osea, saber cómo atacar, me encanta este juego, sin duda uno de los mejores del año.

Doom Eternal is the best game in the series, with fresh and original new game mechanics, an intriguing yet ignorable story, some of the best combat in any FPS ever, loads of challenges and new demons, as well as tons of replay ability. It even manages to introduce a fun and interesting multiplayer game called battle mode, however the multiplayer needs more diversity in terms of game play. Story: Like every other game in the DOOM Franchise, Eternal’s story is ignorable and most likely won’t effect your gameplay. However, players interested in looking into the lore will be MORE than satisfied, with jaw dropping plot twists (which I wouldn’t dare spoil) and interesting background and history on every location and entity in the game, as well as the histories of the sentinels, demons, and the earth itself. Although the lore isn’t worked into the game as well as it could be, but it’s a DOOM game. You didn’t come for the story and ID Software knows that. Gameplay: ID software has ruined the gameplay of DOOM (2016) for me... because they improved upon it in every single way. The gunplay is tight and precise, the weapons are explosive and satisfying, and the gore has been turned up from 10/10 to 12/10, with brand new unique glory kills for bosses and enemies. Every encounter with enemies feels like a puzzle as you quickly strategize your next move running through break neck speed. Levels: DOOM 2016’s campaign began to grow stale and repetitive in the third act, however you’ll see nothing like that in DOOM Eternal, as every level feels fresh and unique from the plains of hell itself, to the corrupted Earth, as well as the home worlds of the sentinels, and the maykrs. Being pact with dozens of fantastic secrets such as floppy disc’s with classic soundtracks from ID Games. However the final level of the game: “Final Sin” lacks on the Creative Side, it MORE than makes up for it with the fantastic final boss. Enemies and Bosses: The enemies are diverse and unique, broken down into four classes. Each enemy brings a unique challenge (excluding fodder enemies) that you must account for in the arena like battles.As for the bosses, the bosses are unique and challenging. To put it simply they “teach you how to play DOOM correctly.” As each boss brutally examines you on everything you’ve learned up to that  point in the game. Each of the five bosses manage to keep the gameplay fresh to the very end, with the monstrous final boss being an “epic battle of biblical proportions”. Rewards: DOOM Eternal is incredibly rewarding, giving players skins, weapon power ups, cheat codes, and classic music for exploring and completing the game. Eternal also introduces a leveling up progression system that awards you xp based on your performance, completion, and exploration in the campaign and multiplayer that gives you access to titles, profile pics, backgrounds and victory poses as well as additional creative weapons/player skins. Most importantly though is that completion and exploration of the game awards you a copy of Classic Doom and Doom II (I’ll explain in the next paragraph) Replay-ability: After you’ve finished the campaign enjoy playing the game on higher difficulties as well as the intense and challenging “extra life mode” which puts an old school twist in a modern shooter, as well as the merciless and unholy “Ultra Nightmare” mode that’ll send you through hell and back. Players can also grind through the level progression system to get all level up perks and rewards. If you’ve found enough secrets you can also return to the hub world, the "Fortress of Doom" after completing the final level you're awarded a classic model MS DOS computer that contains a full port of THE Classic Doom and Doom II. That’s right, you get to play Doom in DOOM as reward for exploring and completing the game. Multiplayer: The multiplayer is the weakest part of the game. However that’s not to say it’s bad, it’s a creative, fun, and original multiplayer game mode... and at the moment the ONLY multiplayer game mode in Doom Eternal. Eternal introduces the new Battlemode that sees you and two other players duke it out in an arena, one plays as the DOOM Slayer himself, as the other two take control of a heavy class demon as they engage in an epic battle to slay the Slayer. Although battle mode is a good multiplayer mode, getting classical multiplayer modes such as death match will definitely be necessary to keep fans playing Eternal. Conclusion: 9.75/10 (Rounded up to 10/10) DOOM Eternal is not just one of the best shooters in years, but one of the best shooters of ALL TIME. Including an original and epic campaign, new mechanics, an original multiplayer mode, loads of replay-ability, and it’s overall just a fantastic time. As soon as that opening cutscene rolls, the only thing you’re going to want to do is... RIP and TEAR... until it is done.

DOOM Eternal es sin lugar a dudas un golpe de efecto en el año 2020, se ha publicado sin retrasos, a pesar del COVID-19, un juego que viene a divertirnos en una época tan dura. El juego mejora absolutamente en todo con respecto al anterior, escenarios, profundidad, personalización, gráficos y motor gráfico, dinamismo, variedad de enemigos, nuevas mecánicas, y un largo etcétera. Sinceramente el review boombing que está recibiendo me parece penoso, yo le otorgado el 10 de nota porque creo que merece eso y más, si al DOOM (2016) le di un 9, éste debería de tener un 12. Pero siempre ocurre que a los aficionados les cueta aceptar los cambios y quieren la misma fórmula una y otra vez, pero sobre Bethesda hay que decir que ha ido con todo, ha apostado muy fuerte y les ha salido un juego magnifico, que creo que en realidad le gusta a los fans que son realistas y al nuevo público que se están interesando por la saga DOOM en general. Lo recomiendo al 100%, antes de juzgar recomiendo jugarlo, porque la trama se desarrolla escalonadamente y el climax evidentemente está en el final.

Это просто лучший шутер десятилетия. Проходил игру с огромным удовольствием. Бешеный темп боя, огромная масса оружия и разных врагов. Возможность разместить оружие по центру экрана. Просто шикарно. 10/10

The sequel it actually deserves. Platforming was easy, but there more a lot of it which I don't mind. Combat is really intense and butt clenching in each of its own terms. Storytelling was greatly understandable (esp in codex) and it really doesn't take the game away. The only thing that I find kinda sad was that you could kinda see who the Doom Slayer is at this point. I wanted him to be a big mystery of a superhuman. Now for all these people that complain that so many has changed in Doom Eternal. It was for the betterment of it. Mainly because its a sequel meant for more varieties to happen. The devs were right, they doubled down as many things could happen compared to 2016. I don't see myself going back to 2016 for the gist of it as well. Its like improvement is being bad for you doomers who can't even get good in this game. People rant about the AMMO, in all honesty there are many scattered ammos around arenas, even the respawning fodders of which you could chainsaw. "The chainsaw became a reload weapon." Since when has it not? You have to use the chainsaw effieciently during your battles. Not when all your weapon ammos are depleted. Hence it refuels quickly. Don't get your arse stuck up when everythings low because you've got the mentality of only using it on occasions. 2016 basically has too many ammo that you just constantly use one weapon most of the time, aka super shotgun. Doom Eternal teaches you to use the each of your weapons which makes your gameplay more fluid than ever. I can't believe you guys just can''t handle what weapon is necessary for each and every demon. If you properly use your ammo resources, then you'll still have a lot in the end of the combat. The MARAUDERS are there to show off your skills if you can take this demon down instantly. Shooting him brainlessly punishes you to die. This demon basically controls the arena where the others won't, thats why hes so unique. The mf is basically your demonized reflection. "BuT dOoM is SuPpOseD tO be a FaSt pAcE gAMe" Yeah if you actually learn how to beat the Marauder, you'd beat him in less than 20sec tops. Hell, prolly even 10. Here's a tip, stay mid-range from him and super shotgun or ballista him when hes near. Don't shoot his shield for crying out loud. The wolf only comes out when you do it. That''s why you never shoot brainlessly. Level Designs are too complex? Excuse me but I remembered 2016 to be too dull and repetitive considering its just full on red. Its also tight in many combat areas where theres no free flow to roam around in. Even if the platform is like Mario, I would never doubt you that you couldn't finish them. They're easy to bypass and understandable. Atmosphere felt in place as well considering each level designs are very different from one another. Punching does nothing? Blood punch basically destroys most of the enemies in Eternal. Maybe you people forget that theres such a thing as that one. If you people can't comprehend the amount of throwables at your hand, then you're not thinking through and through on your gameplay, no wonder why you love 2016 so much. Its not even required for you to use them, considering you control what you play, but its necessary to use these to help your combat. For the story, I have no saying of it considering I like it, but many do, I do not know why but its everyones perspective. I guess people really want realistically looking games, how does cartoonish graphics make the game look more ugly? Even Doom 2016 was easy to beat to why I kinda got bored to it. Nightmare you say? that doesn't spice things too much even that one was okay to deal with. Doom Eternal's difficulty is rewarding and great. Even if i lost, Ive had extra lives in my hands and it rewards you into becoming an actual Slayer. In all honesty I think the people who whine are the ones who can't see themselves playing hardcore action skilled fps games at all. These people can't handle quick thinking and just blatantly relies on going all on no mind process shooting. Go back to call of duty if that's what you're after if you want simple repetitive game mechanics. Its you who has a problem with the game, not the game itself.
Best game I've ever played. Brutal, glorious combat. Rewarding exploration, intriguing cinematics & lore, fun movement, and a damn good time. The negative reviews are from crybabies.

TL;DR : DOOM ETERNAL is brilliant and you should play it, NOW. (but first, look up some gameplay, and don't come there to complain about the platforming). This game is an absolute masterpiece.It has everything the previous games have, improves on many aspects, and might be the best shooter i've ever played, period. Pros :- The mobility! What lacked in speed in DOOM 2016 and in verticality in DOOM and DOOM2 is now perfectly implemented with the use of double jumps, double dash, monkey bars, wall climbing and THAT BLOODY MEAT HOOK!!! (aka the best grappling hook that a game has ever given me) - The level design is amazing! It feels so much less linear than in the previous opus in the series, and the fact that it's not in cramped industrial facilities makes roaming these incredibly huge maps an absolute delight. Some people may prefer the more futuristico-realistic setting of the 2016 DOOM, but I think it's much better to see more of the worlds. - The weapons have all been overhauled, both visually and from a sound/feeling standpoint (with two exceptions, i'll be back to that later). No more pistol. All doom games had this useless pistol, but now it's been replaced by a shotgun. This is a true Brutal-Doom fan's dream. The useless mods (rotating minigun barrel, shock bomb, scoped rifle, and triple-shot shotgun) have either been replaced or enhanced (full-auto shotgun, ice bomb as an equipment, the scoped rifle is now a sniper rifle, etc.). Even though I prefered some previous designs and weapons (the minigun, and the Gauss cannon instead of the Ballista), all weapons feel fantastic and are now unique. - The music is bloody amazing. It's like listening to a metal album while playing the metal album. Everything in the music is so polished, it's just incredible. Some may say that there are fewer memorable tracks, but that's because the combats are so much more intense you literally can't afford to pay attention to other things. - Speaking of combat, the combat in DOOM 2016 was brilliant, but you didn't need to micro-manage your ammo and health as much as in the original games. In Eternal, the combat feels like ballet. Heavy metal ballet. With big guns.The combat in 2016 also lacked mobility and it was especially slowed down by the fact that there was a maximum amount of demons in a single room at a given time (12, iirc). In Eternal, it's rare to find fewer than 12 demons in your close vicinity, and... - ...Since the bestiary is now double, or even triple the size of the previous game's, the variety in demons pushes the pacing up to 9000. - IT TOOK THEM 25 YEARS, BUT THEY FINALLY MADE A CYBERDEMON 3D MODEL THAT IS FAITHFUL TO THE ORIGINAL! And it's not even a boss! They made it a regular enemy! Speaking of that, all the bosses are in fact first encounters of normal enemies! And that's great because it spices up the combat so much! - This whole section is a mild spoiler, so don't read it if you're concerned about being spoiled.The Marauder : some hate it, I personally think it's the best enemy in the game. Imagine being in a stressful fight, and then a Marauder comes: you now have to think strategically and plan which demon to kill first, whilst paying attention to the Marauder's moves. It spices up the combat and most importantly, it teaches you a different way to play the game.Playing like in doom 2016 won't do you any good, because if you want to be efficient against the bigger enemies in Eternal, you NEED to be in constant movement, and you NEED to know and master the quick-switching. And before you meet the Marauder, you don't know any of that. It's brilliant. - The story is great and you can finally skip the cutscenes! (most of them, anyway). And now there's lore! And they even managed to connect pretty much all doom games! - Nightmare mode doesn't *just" deal extra damage, it actually speeds up the game, makes the enemies more aggressive, and makes lesser demons spawn more. That's the best overhaul to the difficulty system that i've ever seen in a game. Cons:- Okay, some of the platforming is a bit unneccessary. Especially in the second level, or the Doom Hunter base. - The game is much more arcady, and that might be unpleasant to some (ie, the loud "pop" noise when you headshot a demon, or the glowy pickups, or the floating guns. I'm not a huge fan of these, as I prefered 2016's more "cinematic/realistic" approach. But i guess it's more faithful to the original games. Eh. - The BFG and another super-weapon that I won't name shares the same ammo, and the same weapon wheel slot. The issue is that you don't pickup BFG ammo in early maps, and it's very scarce in the late game, so you don't get to play with the super-weapons as much as you could in the previous titles in the series. What a shame. - Batllemode with friends won't work on the Bethesda.net version, because there is no friends list in that **** launcher. F* you, Bethesda.

I thought that Doom 2016 was perfect, fast paced, brutal, awesome soundtrack, challenging, and i just expected Doom Eternal to be the same. We are so lucky that it isn't. It's so much more! Some people said "If i wanted to play platform games, i would play Mario". Don't be that person and then you will have lots of fun and challenge, mainly in the higher difficulties, which i recommend. Sometimes it feels heavy and too intense, these times don't be ashamed to take a break, i needed sometimes. Some times i thought that i would not be able to pass certain demon or area, but i think that the creators made something similar to the Dark Souls idea, you need to learn the patterns of the enemies and know your weapons, have no mercy, use everything that you have, and you will be rewarded. Doom Eternal is absolutely one of the best games i've ever played, one of my favorite, like Doom 2016, it's a hell of a evolution of the Doom Formula and i can't wait for the next!

A must play for all DOOM fans, and FPS enthusiasts! I have played Doom 64, and Doom 2016. This is by far the BEST. It has more to do than most DOOM "purists" may like. It has puzzles in between fights which slows the pacing down (didn't Doom 2016 also have puzzles too? If i remember correctly there were some puzzles in 2016), and the fact that you use the chainsaw for ammo, the punches for health, and a flame ability for armor, creates a very deep and rewarding experience (easy to play/hard to master). Sure, you may have to slow down and THINK a little about your next move, but it allows the game to be very rich and rewarding as you adjust and get better. The multiplayer (Battlemode) is addicting and fun, and more replayable than it already is. I just highly recommend beating/getting good at the campaign before jumping in. It can be intense with all of the currently quarantined pros online. Also, where is the horde mode? Please give us a horde mode!

Да,казуальнее,да радужное,да немного изменили геймплей,да я прошёл за 10 часов,но эти 10 часов я провёл в кайфе и удовольствии ведь это попрежнему дум который все так любят и ценят. Да,там есть головоломки что по идеи не вписывается в такой жанр,но это лишь передышка перед другим боем в котором ты получишь только лишь наслаждание. Лично мне нравится новый геймплей ведь добавили фишки которых не хватало в "Doom 2016" по типу криогранат что дало новые возможности,а если улучшить то незаменимая вещь. И ещё хочется добавить лёгкий троллинг меньшинств когда представитель ОАК говорила "Помните слово "Демоны" могу оскорбить наших гостей,так что называйте их "альтернативно живыми".
