They perfected the game-loop, Doom has finally reach its final form .Now it has shooting, slaying, mobility, resource management and weak point system. Facking dank.
Deze game is gewoon zo goed dat het mijn plezier van veel andere fps heeft gedood.Ik ben een grote fan van fps waar mobiliteit alles is, en Doom Eternal on nightmare is precies dat.
Um dos melhores fps de 2020Quando eu estava jogando este jogo, eu me sentia um matador de deus ou algo assimOs recursos visuais também são ótimos e fantásticos
I grew a beard and chest hair thanks to this game. 666/10 Would Rip & Tear again.
Game grabs you by the nuts and is wild as f but kind of short. Still recommend going to play the dlc next.

Fast Paced, Fun, Ultra fast, High FPS, Awesome weapons, ice/fire grenades, intense, heart pumping, adrenaline rush etc are the words that I'd like to describe Doom Eternal as. Level Design: Level Design is pretty good. There's enough level variation  (Earth vs Mars for example) for a 20 hours gameplay. Though level design isn't the reason why someone should pick up Doom Eternal. Combat: Combat is where Doom Eternal shines. The fast paced combat is so good that I can literally play it again and feel the same adrenaline rush again. The combat sparked few opinions about 2016 vs Doom Eternal but I personally haven't played Doom 2016. Without 2016 in context, I found the combat to be super fun. Bosses: This is where I'm taking off a point for Doom Eternal. As much fun as Marauder boss fight is, the last few boss fights felt boring and repetitive and honestly didn't feel like doom eternal fights at all.

You can discover secrets in the stages and some collectibles help you improve your suit and stuff.I honestly don't want this game to end.The game introduces you new boss demons in certain missions,then those demons can spawn normally in demon stages mid-game.(If you are new to shooters don't choose normal difficulty. 666/10 A must-have game for shooter fans.
De game geeft je in feite het gevoel dat een god alles scheurt en scheurt. Geweldig spel
Fulfill your desires to cleanse Earth of the Demonic Forces of Evil. RIP AND TEAR TILL IT IS DONE!!!
¡Vamos, el legendario DOOM ha vuelto! ¡Se ve muy bien, toca muy bien y suena mejor que nunca! El mejor juego de Eternity, si sabes a qué me refiero.

Землетрясение в игровом мире - это эта игра, эта игра всегда вызывала у меня волнение и частоту сердечных сокращений, единственный раз, когда я использовал ее для игр-шутеров, - это серия игр DOOM, изюминка игры - это (Ночь, Один, Гарнитура, Громче) приготовьтесь погрузиться в темноту

Лучший шутер от первого лица, в который я играл со времен оригинальной F.E.A.R. На самом деле, он мне может понравиться даже больше из-за ценности воспроизведения, которую я чувствую, что получу от этой игры.
Disfruté el juego. Los acertijos son lo suficientemente intrincados y desafiantes como para mantenerte interesado durante todo el juego.
Deze game is waanzinnig, de snelheid is waanzinnig !!!! Aanbevolen, laat alles vallen wat je doet en ga doom spelen!

Same as Doom 2016 but without the flaws the previous 2016 installment had. The campaign is simply perfect yet a bit disappointing when it comes to boss fights. The final boss didn't feel threatening at all and I had no issues beating it. The soundtrack fits the ambiance and pace of the game so incredibly well. Time flies when I play this game and the immersion is complete, I highly recommend this game, even at full price.
eindama zahar aleadhab alqadim fi eam 2016 , sudimat min madaa ruetih. hdha aleadhab aljadid 'afdal.

Very great game. One of my caveats with DOOM 2016 was the level design. After a while, walking down one corridor after another gets tedious. The wonder of being on Mars didn’t last long either. Therefore, I was pleased to see that Eternal is the exact opposite. You will explore multiple planets and realms, both familiar and new ones. I was often surprised by the exquisite visual direction, which paints a diabolical picture of the game’s mildly horrifying locations.

Doom Eternal on joitain parhaita pelattavuuksia, joita olen kokenut ampujassa melko pitkään. Noutamasi aseet ovat kaikki hauskoja käyttää; Minulla ei ole koskaan ollut hetkeä, jolloin minusta tuntuisi aseen olevan hyödytön. Combat Shotgun oli upea käyttää pelin myöhemmissä osissa Weapon Modin ansiosta, jossa yksi laukaus muuttaa sen tahmeaksi pommiksi, joka aiheuttaa hyvän osan vahingoista. On olemassa myös muita käytettäviä aseita, kuten Plasma Gun, Chaingun ja Heavy Cannon vain muutamia mainitakseni. Kaikki nämä aseet edellyttävät ammuksia, ja voit löytää niitä kaikilta tasoilta, mutta voit myös hankkia ammuksia tappamalla demoneja moottorisahalla. Siinä on yhteensä kolme latausta, ja se lataa itsensä yhtä käyttökertaa varten. Jos haluat käyttää sitä enemmän, sinun on päästävä ulos ja löydettävä kaasua.

Wie Doom 2016, jedoch ohne die Mängel, die die vorherige Ausgabe 2016 hatte. Die Kampagne ist einfach perfekt, aber ein bisschen enttäuschend, wenn es um Bosskämpfe geht. Der Endgegner fühlte sich überhaupt nicht bedrohlich und ich hatte keine Probleme, ihn zu schlagen. Der Soundtrack passt so unglaublich gut zum Ambiente und Tempo des Spiels. Die Zeit vergeht wie im Fluge, wenn ich dieses Spiel spiele und das Eintauchen abgeschlossen ist. Ich kann dieses Spiel nur zum vollen Preis empfehlen.

This game did it man. The beginning is a bit rough but once you get past that bit it's so enjoyable beginning to the end. I love this game so much and I can't recommend not enough to anybody who loves these high adrenaline games. 10/10

Everything I loved about the first game carries over here and all the new added features were great additions such as the flamethrower, blood punch, dash, and especially the grapple. The level design also is improved here and the added mobility is great. The story wasn't all that special but the added lore was cool. I also enjoyed the new enemies and all how much variety there were to them and that there was some more strategy involved in defeating them. I also found the locations to be more memorable in this game.
Action, Cutscenes, Artstyle, Soundtrack, everything is so perfect about this game.
Super fun and music is dope. Love the combat and how deep it is. Easily favorite 3AM gaming session.
By far, one of the best FPS games I've ever played, since the OG days of the OG Doom. A beyond masterful addition to any Doom fans collection!
What I love about this game is its gameplay is pretty much perfect and crushes most AAA in game design.

Every Demon has a weak point, so not only that you would have to use the right tools for the right enemy, but you would have to also consider playing smart, all of that makes for intelligent, challenging, and enjoyable game.

Great game amazing combat. Exploration is now more rewarding than it ever was, collectibles are viewable in your fortress, Vinyl records that you found hidden are also playable there too, alongside other new and smart ideas and features that are introduced in the fortress which serves as a hub.

Side by side, the music, and combat, the fast movement system, the different types of demons that require different ways of attacks and approaches, all of that come together to make one of the most fun and challenging games I think I ever played, I loved DOOM 4 but DOOM ETERNAL is everything I loved in DOOM 2016 and more.

ok take Doom 2016, give it steroids, make it ♥♥♥♥ a demon, wait for the demon to give birth, raise the child with a crapton of steroids, bully the child until it's at least 20 years of age, make it snap, give him a gun and a chainsaw, then send him to school while blasting pumped up kicks on a boombox duct-taped to his forehead. That's you in the game.
Game is nuts and insane. Best Shooter I've played in while with excellent soundtrack.
A fast-paced, chaotic action shooter with a wealth of content and a long campaign.
Best game I've played last year. Dam awesome and what a joy to play. Movement and combat soo smooth.

Blows Doom 2016 out of the water in every way. Combat is a lot more cerebral and the AI is very challenging. You actually have to solve a combat puzzle in Eternal instead of just spamming the super shotty or gauss cannon to fight everything like in 2016.

As a sequel, Eternal delivers on many fronts. From the diversified visuals along with the environments they represent, to the nuances and mechanics of the combat system being *greatly* expanded. Eternal is as rewarding and complex as you make it.

The gameplay is amazing and well known to be amazing. Doom has always been a combat first type of game. If the game isn't fun to play, then what's the point, right? And although the gameplay is the star of the show, the story beneath it all is friggin brilliant and well written. I love how most of the narrative is told through the codexes in 2016 and Eternal.

Extremely fast paced. The most intense shooter on the market.Fantastic enemies, awesome soundtrack, fun game design.Keep moving, keep switching weapons and keep glory killing and chainsawing people for health and ammo.Play on a difficulty that challenges you.
Best non-open world single-player game in my opinion, and easily top 3 single-player.

This game is absolutely phenomenal. By all means, you should play it. The people who say that your creativity is limited in this game because of the weak-point system are just wrong, definitely try it for yourself. Don't listen to the people who say that you HAVE to play it on Nightmare, they're just wrong, play it at whatever level makes you feel like the ultimate demon slayer
This is for sure the best FPS I've played in my life, it's beautiful, the songs are a perfect match, weapons are fun etc..
Once a player learns the rules of the game, once he understands the interplay between weapons, abilities, and enemies Doom Eternal becomes vastly more enjoyable than Doom 2016.

It is so much more complex, dynamic, fast, and filled with adrenaline that in harder arenas you feel like an action movie hero despite - and even because of - the fact that you're usually one mistake away from death.
My favorite game of all time this game is the closest thing you can get to crystal meth.
Really amazing game but all it needs is more master levels and mod support.
This game is a true masterpiece. The best shooter I've played in my whole life.

It's the culmination of 25 years of FPS games. Intense, fun, and brutally difficult in parts. You'll die a lot but it never feels unfair and retrying is always enjoyable. If you like FPS games you probably already own this. If you're new to FPS games you should get DOOM 2016 first as DOOM Eternal is the sequel.
Amazing game. Never has game make you feel like such a badass like this game.

One of the best first person shooters ever. Feels like StarCraft 2 as an FPS game. So much to manage and worry about. Simply perfect gameplay constantly. The campaign is a perfect way to learn all the weapons, movements, strategies, abilities, and more.
Amazing game. Reminds of God of war 3, Quake and Doom 2. Top tier arena shooter.
A great FPS that provides a good challenge and keeps you on your toes. You will need to play the way that the game wants you to play though.
Hugo Martin helped me to see. My eyes have been opened. Let this game help you to see. Rip and tear... until it is done.

If you like fast-paced FPS shooters from hell, then there is nothing faster or more intense than this that I know of. The best game in the DOOM series yet. Although DOOM 2016 is still awesome, DOOM Eternal is one step ahead. Action non-stop, mixed with some small puzzles and collectibles. Highly recommended!
Easily one of the best FPS of all time. I don't know how they made it even better than Doom 2016. You get a chain saw and a hook harpoon attached to your double-barrel shotgun.
Doom (2016) ramped up to 1000. Better, mechanically deeper and harder. Endlessly fun.
Beating the game on nightmare difficulty took about 20 hours and it was really fun and challenging.
What fantastic game man. Amazing combat, levels, music and story is pretty wacky and fun.

Jogo incrivelmente divertido. Já joguei todos os jogos DOOM e este é de longe o melhor (em termos de diversão). O que quero dizer com isso é que o jogo NÃO se leva a sério às vezes. Ao contrário dos jogos Wolfenstein mais recentes, DOOM Eternal faz isso BEM. O exagero sobre tudo isso realmente contribui para a experiência geral do DOOM e a história, embora apressada, é MUITO divertida e interessante. Claro, você não está jogando DOOM para a história.

Die Waffen sind alle ziemlich normale DOOM-Waffen, aber sie fühlen sich so ... gut in diesem Spiel an, dass dieser Teil schwer zu erklären ist.

DOOM Eternal is a more challenging game compared to 2016 DOOM. This game has far more engaging fights, a lot of action, moving, dodging, weapon & character customization. The story is decent (tho you most likely won't play this game for it's story), graphics are good, level design is detailed and often looks breathtaking, demon and character models are well done (demons look more damaged and bloody as you deal damage to them) and audio is great too. You may be overwhelmed from the beginning by a lot of demons and various game mechanics and die at least a few times, but you push thru frustration you will improve, learn game mechanics, demon weaknesses etc and enjoy the game a lot more. I recommend this game for anyone who likes fast paced challenging shooters and of course to all DOOM series fans.

Definitely has made it up to one of my favorite games of all time. Once you play eternal there is no going back to DOOM 2016. Doom Eternal is what every action game's combat strives to be. Doom 2016 was great and introduced many new ideas that worked well, but what Eternal did was take these ideas and further flesh them out to create something incredible. They saw that the main idea of the game was to never stop moving so they made you faster and gave you more ways to traverse i.e. monkey bars, dash, and a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ grapple hook on your shotgun. This can even be seen in the dlc (especially part 2). They saw that people liked the crucible blade but didn't like the fact that you have to wait for a pickup to use it. For me, it became more of a a rarity so I didn't end up using it much unless I knew that there was a pickup by me. But the devs looked at this and created the Sentinel hammer which recharges whenever you perform 2 glory kills or pickup a refill. As well as many different enemy ideas that focus on much more specific weaknesses such as only being vulnerable to a specific attachment on your shotgun. Though I've never really liked enemy's where you have to wait it out for them to attack just to expose their weak point and doom has a few that could use a little more of an offensive approach (I don't have too much trouble with marauder but that's just because he's very defensive and tries to attack as much as possible). Lastly one of my favorite additions that they add into the ancient gods is swinging from your grapple hook in the platforming sections. The base game had some pretty good platforming but the grapple hook really added some new spice to further flesh it out (I just wish they used it in some of the battles). Doom Eternal's combat is fast, refreshing, and something completely new that I would recommend to anyone who is looking for a great shooter filled with many incredible moments and well made dlc.
i liked doom 2016 a lot but this game makes that game look like slow boring piece of trash lol.

I love this game, it is strategic and fun. Violence is a massive part of this game and it is awesome. The game can be difficult on the higher difficulty's and can pose a real challenge or you can play it on a lower difficulty and just enjoy it.

Much better than 2016. I felt Doom 2016 was kind of mediocre and overrated. You could beat the game on hardest difficulty spamming supershotgun and it got very repetitive by the middle section. The levels got bland and samey. This game is massive improvement especially gameplay wise in every single way. The levels are great and varied. Combat is deeper, more tactical and allows for more varied playstyles which is 2016 contrary to the many morons who claim this game is restrictive. Ammo is not an issue once you start upgrading ammo, weapon switch, and upgrade Praetor Suit Explosive Piñatas and Thicker Skin. This game is a masterpiece.
Way better than Doom 2016. I felt this was an improvement pretty much across the board.

Easily a FPS MASTERPIECE This game played on Nightmare and especially on Ultra-Nightmare is the Dark Souls of First Person Shooters (FPS) . Doom 2016 was a nice introduction but Eternal (DE) is evolution. I played through Doom 2016 once and it was cool but for me it had no replay value. Eternal is something different. This is a Metal Concert, the definition of adrenalin fueled gameplay and you are constantly in the mosh pit! Levels like Nekravol, holy **** This is what I expect when I hear DOOM, You fighting Hell and Demons fearing YOU - just great stuff and the game looks gorgeous at all times and runs extremely smooth! The story is completely optional but after having so much fun playing the game, I wanted to know the story behind it all and it is fascinating; it feels like a biblical comic - creative stuff!And the music... just perfect! Mick Gordon delivered once again! It is punishing and brutally hard. You have to learn how to fight all these different demons in different constellations and in a way which suits YOU!You have to view the game as a sort of a live action combat puzzle, you cannot just use one weapon and get through every level - especially not on higher difficulty.On Nightmare it is really frustrating at times, but there is always a way to 'Git Gud' as in Dark Souls or Sekiro.This game is made to be mastered. To get better.This is not a game which you play through once and you seen it all, done it all - no. I actually wish that they made the game more like Sekiro - only one difficulty: NIGHTMARE, and well Ultra-Nightmare for the elite players. This way the message would have been clear for everyone - this is a skill based FPS, not some cookie cutter walk through the park experience (which honestly everything below nightmare is, once you've played on it). It is no exaggeration if I say: If you can play Doom on Nightmare, you are ready for all other FPS games.It's like the ring to rule them all. Going back to games like CoD feels almost boring. The dynamic and multitasking aspect which DE offers is unmatched.Freeze 'em, burn 'em, shot 'em, nade 'em, and use the right weapon with the the right attachment to kill 'em. Manage your chainsaw loads and grenades; what runes do you like the most, when to switch them up? What suit points to use first? Did you master the weapon switching yet? Can't progress at a slayer gate? Go on Youtube, look how the Pro's doing it. Be **** amazed, 'cause seriously high-level Doom Eternal is a league of its own. And no, you don't have to shot all those weakpoints, you could just shotgun/ballista or heavy cannon/rocket your enemy's in the chest or ice bomb and use the chain gun or any other weapon combination you have in your arsenal and you LIKE. The possibilities and combinations are almost endless. Almost every week players find a new way to kill the marauder. Platforming is part of the equation, that way you learn how to maneuver in those big arenas. But yeah, sometimes it is definitely annoying.The only negative aspect I can think of is, when DE is not working properly: 'no target', no blood punch registration and bugs here and there but this is rarely an big issue, but still worth noting. What is lacking for me to give it a 10/10 is the lack of training tools to master various demons and fights like they implemented various training scenarios for the player to learn chainsaw, ice bomb etc.The demon prison aka the 'Ripatorium' could have been a way more useful tool if you could go in there and customize your fight aka decide for yourself against which demon you want to fight and learn how to beat them more efficiently and learn their attacks in an isolated environment.This is a thing which still bothers me, even after hundreds of hours of playing, that I still don't quiet understand how much damage I get from various attacks from different demons. And you have almost no chance to learn that in a big arena fight if several demons are attacking you at the same time.A Load Checkpoint system or quick save system would have been great, to train various instances without having to replay the whole level or to use 3rd party software to train for Ultra Nightmare. At this point I feel like all people who wanted essentially a Doom 16 v2 are done with their grieving and real FPS connaisseurs are more and more understanding the greatness DE offers. And finally, the community and devs. The communication is just fantastic! A really healthy community with such a caring game director - Hugo Martin - you love to see that and I honestly never seen such communication with any other AAA title.  And mind you, I am pretty late to the party. My personal rating: 9/10
Best game in the entire series by far, and this comes from a hardcore old school Doom fan.
Pros:

column1: -You only use violence to interact with your environment

Review: This is a brilliant game about three things: moving fast, killing demons, and metal. It does these three things so ludicrously well that it is impossible not to recommend. Plenty of thinkpieces have discussed at length why exactly this game is so good on such a purely visceral level, so I'll leave it to them to give you the details. Suffice to say, this isn't to be missed.

Rarely do we get to see a AAA title where every aspect of the game in centered around one single element, in this case, combat. Art direction, sound design, story, movement, level design... everything here is built to create the best FPS experience possible, and DOOM delivers. This is definitely one of the best FPS campaigns in recent years.

Great graphics, excellent story, awesome gameplay and pretty good optimization. Almost everything is really well done in the game and there is nothing bad in it. I would recommend this masterpiece to everyone.

All in all, from a gameplay standpoint it's one of the best SP FPS games ever, and a clear improvement over Doom 2016 in all of the ways that matter most. There's really not much else like this in the modern market. In an age in which arena shooters and movement based shooters are dying and the market is overwhelmingly shifting towards slower, less intense genres like tactical shooters and Battle Royales, it's nice to know that a game like this can still be made and find success. I'll get sappy for a second and say this: Thank you, id Software. You're the only AAA developer that still cares about the things I value in a shooter.

Doom Eternal is a masterpiece of a game, with significant improvements that makes it vastly more enjoyable than Doom 2016. New mechanics introduce new gameplay opportunities and increased movement, while the demons of Hell increase in strength, numbers, and ferocity.

Quick Pros and Cons List ProsAdditional mechanics, allowing for more options in combat and faster movement, further increasing the intensity of Doom’s refined gameplay.A brand new album of music from Mick Gordon that is the same high quality from Doom 2016An improved, well optimized engine with better graphicsGood variety of areas in the campaign, ranging from Earth, Hell, and otherworldly dimensions ConsI ran into a few bugs, including one game breaking one with invincible demons.

Simply put, the greatest first person shooter ever made and a must play for fans of the genre and the Doom series. Very few games feature enemy and weapon lineups where each and every tool at your disposal has a huge strength and weakness from situation to situation.
Was für ein Spiel. Als Fan von Old-School-Shootern ist dieses Spiel ein Hauch frischer Luft.
I can't recommend this game hard enough, but one thing is for sure, it's too good to be real.

Is it fun? HELL ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ YEAH!

column1: Is it better than the original? Yes and No.

Review: Pros:+ Environments are breathtakingly badass. [Seriously if hell looks like this then sign me the ♥♥♥♥ up!]+ Fast travel makes collectables more bearable. [It's unlocked for the current level, but only for the current session, so if you finish the level you'll have to get back to the end of the level before you can fast travel again every time. It's a cool but flawed system that collectable hungry games should implement.]+ Looks and runs flawlessly. [No issues here, id Software sure knows how to make great engines.]+ More challenging than Doom (2016). [It has a much higher skill ceiling than 2016, mostly because of the way the game is designed.]+ OST [Certified banger.] Con/Pro:+/- The way the game is designed it almost forces you to play a certain way. [You want to main 2-3 weapons like in Doom (2016)? Well too bad! You're going to have to use everything in your arsenal.]

Okay so the only problem is this is the first game I played that will give me a headache. Not because it's frustrating- but because it feels like I'm on a roller coaster. Except, instead of ups, downs & loops, it's constantly flying through the air, shooting meat off of Demons and ripping their bodies open.

The game is intense, and one of the few that deserves a title "Action Packed". On easier difficulties, you can play at a more relaxed (playing Doom to relax?) pace, but when the difficulties are higher, it's on.

The graphics are beautiful, the game runs so smooth despite being so fast-paced. The music is beautifully orchestrated with the events happening on scene. For sure, the game is a power trip, and it feels good.

The story is fine and interesting, but you don't really play Doom for the lore. My only complaint is I actually don't like the multiplayer from Eternal, I prefer 2016's style. I may be in the minority there, but I would recommend this game for its single-player experience only. Its multiplayer is more of a cute knock-off, to me.

Најбољи фпс у последњих 10 година који не жртвује ништа да би био пријатан и задовољан. Доом Етернал је ремек-дело, има добру музику, добру борбу и изненађујуће добру Доом причу која нема Цитизен Кане-а, али је веома забавна. Обично вреди цене, али је неопходно купити приликом продаје.

Quake'in, Doom'un düşmanca kadrosu ile şiddetli, yatıştırıcı tavrıyla evlenen ham beyin yoğunluğu. Bu oyundan zevk almak, belirli bir zihin çerçevesi, kendinize meydan okumak ve anın sıcağında düşünmek için belirli bir isteklilik gerektirir. Ancak, kendi şartlarınızda karşılaşırsanız son derece ödüllendiricidir. Neredeyse her silah, Doom 2016'nın 2 silahlı oynanış tarzının tanıtımının tam aksine, önemli bir role sahip olduğunu hissediyor. Oyuncuyu ekipmanlarını akıllıca kullanmaya iten cephane sayıları büyük ölçüde azaltıldı. Genel olarak, bu farkı tanımlama şeklim, Doom 2016'nın silahlarını herhangi bir zamanda çok fazla sonuç olmadan kullanılabilecek bir oyuncak seti olarak ele almasıdır. Doom Eternal onları bir araç olarak görüyor ve başarıya ulaşmak için onları iyi kullanmalısın.

Not only does DOOM Eternal have an amazing combat system and AI, it also mixes certain elements of puzzle solving alongside gut-wrenching, adrenaline fueled combat that will surely eradicate any stress that you have and leave you craving for more blood and guts.

The music plays a big part too, the combat music can even make you wanting to 1v1 with the Sun ! It sets the mood to this game brilliantly.I think the brilliant gameplay coupled with outstanding graphics and innovative story makes it a clear legendary game.

Ikke bare har DOOM Eternal et fantastisk kampsystem og AI, det blander også visse elementer i puslespillløsninger sammen med tarmknusende, adrenalindrevet kamp som helt sikkert vil utrydde alt stress du har og etterlater deg lyst på mer blod og tarm.

Ово није игра. Не. Ово је епика. Прича о човеку који је превише врашки љут да би умро. Играо сам Доом 2016 и сада, уласком у Доом Етернал, био сам узбуђен и знао сам да ћу доживети ремек дело, али вау, ова игра је поезија. Амбијент, музика ове игре, начин дизајнирања мапе, ток борбе, све је само чисто блаженство које треба доживети. Ова игра вреди сваког пенија. Једина лоша ствар ове игре је та што имају могућност да утишају музику, хахаха. Све шале осим ове игре су историјске.

Doom Eternal building upon the gameplay and level design of 2016. The deeper and more challenging gameplay can be tough to grasp at first but it the payoff is one of the best shooters of the last 10 years.

Игра основана на игровом процессе и дизайне уровней предыдущих игр. Поначалу может быть трудно понять более глубокий и сложный игровой процесс, но в итоге получился один из лучших шутеров за последние пять лет.

Buy it. It's an instant classic and one of the greatest FPS games of all time. Worth every penny. Goes to show how good a game can be when it's made by people who love it, respect it, understand it, and most importantly, PLAY IT. Only issues is we need mods.

Amazing game. Using different weapons/mods carries real benefits this time around because certain enemies are easier to take down with certain weapons. For example, cacodemons are tanky to most weapons, but are weak to the sticky bomb and ballista.

The arsenal as been balanced down to the wire, both by weapon tweaks, mods and external factors like the Chainsaw being less of a cheese KO for tough baddies and more of an ammo factory that can be used for an invulnerable state. Glory kills are more varied now, you have more options for tackling various foes, enemies are more aggressive, both old and new. I could go on for days about Eternal, but really just wanted to put a good word in for it.

First of all, let me just start by saying the soundtrack on this game is AMAZING. The Best Soundtrack Award is there for a reason. An absolute blast from start to finish and one of the most polished games I've ever played. Visually stunning environments and animations. Immaculate pacing with just the right amount of puzzles/story/lore interspersed between sessions of heart-pounding action that is only enhanced by excellent use of the soundtrack. Challenging enough for every level to be an adrenaline-filled rush but not so difficult as to be frustrating. Same goes for the collectibles, bonus levels, etc — everything is compelling without being intrusive. I was also amazed at how well they managed to capture the spirit of the original DOOM games I played as a kid in a modern format. (For example, I never would have thought that in 2021 I'd be playing a shooter with no reload keybind, but somehow it just works.) Did I mention the game has a great soundtrack? The genre and thematic approach isn't for everyone, but even as someone as someone who typically prefers games with a lot more depth than DOOM has (story-driven RPGs, strategy games, stealth action-adventure, etc) I still loved it it from start to finish. It's easy to pick up and put down at a moment's notice whether you have 30 minutes or 4 hours to blast through hordes of demons. In a time filled with buggy, unfinished, forever-in-early-release, oversold and under-delivered games, it's refreshing to see one so refined and filled to the brim with attention to detail. Overall, an exquisitely crafted game and worth your hard-earned dollar even at full price.

A lot has already been said on why this game is masterpiece of an action game. This post is for new players and debunking the garbage negative reviews and lies on this site. I've never seen a game have such weak and poor takes against it like Doom Eternal. 1. Hating on this game for having a more cartoony artstyle really? Doom was never a serious series until Doom 64 and Doom 3. The enemy designs and art style is paying homage to Doom 2 you stupid morons. 2. Second is the muh low ammo. Yes in the start of the you have a low ammo count. The game is trying to teach you to be more cautious about burning ammo like a brain dead moron and is nudging you to basic weapon switching. The game also is guiding you to target weakpoints of enemies. None of this is mandatory its just the game teaching you this stuff in the start of the game hoping that you learn these lessons later in the game. You can still beat this game on Nightmare spamming 2 of the same guns later on but the start of the game really tries discourage players from doing that because that is objectively a boring stupid way to play. You can also brute weapon switch against enemies and never need to target weakpoints because of the insane damage output you can give to enemies. The game has very high skill gap which is a sign of very well designed combat system something you don't see in most games. Once you upgrade ammo, Praetor Suit points in Explosive Piñatas(get ammo from explosive barrels) and Thicker Skin(damage resistance from barrels) this game floods the player with ammo. So this complaint is obviously from people who never actually played much of this game. Also one Chainsaw pip will always regenerate and levels will always have ammo or fodder zombies around. 3. The game forces me to play one way. This is a lie. This game actually has soo many different weapon mod combos and playstyles its actually crazy. Doom youtubers like Under the Mayo still is finding new weapon mod combos 1 year after the games launch. 4. Muh platforming and puzzles. Doom 1 and Doom 2 had platforming and puzzles. Admittedly these games had simple forms of platforms and puzzles due to nature of them being not real 3D games. It wasn't until Quake 1 did id implement vertical platforming. John Cormack and John Romero would have 100% made a level like Nekravol if they had the tech to do it in the 90s. I also don't get it. So do you morons really think walking in a boring corridor for 5 mins is better than more complex jumping puzzles? The platforming is honestly really easy and breeze. The fact that there a people that struggled with it is sad. The purpose of it was to give players a break from the combat(which there is a lot of in this game), allow for more complex level design, and to sharpen the players air maneuverability skills for the large arenas in the game.

DOOM Eternal makes DOOM 2016 seem like a game for toddlers. It's faster, harder and better. There are however complaints which I find overdramatic and strange: "This is not DOOM 2016", "No ammo for anything" or "Game restricts how you play". There are hints of truth in every complaint of course, but only if you do not look at the whole picture.

Gameplay could not have been better. I have always hated playing shooters on harder difficulties, because that would warrant abandoning your balls for the sake of taking cover every second. Here, it is more organic with the movement system of dashing, jumping sprinting around the arena. Every weapon matters and moreso after unlocking certain mods.as enemies require you to use specific ones to take advantage of their weak spots. I do not understand why this is a bad thing for some people.

It's the raw cerebral intensity of Quake married with Doom's enemy roster and its violent, cathartic attitude. Enjoying this game requires a certain frame of mind, a certain willingness to push yourself and to think in the heat of the moment. But it's extremely rewarding if you meet it on its own terms.

Positives:+ Incredibly detailed and satisfyingly challenging levels filled with fast-paced shooting, gore and some platforming.+ Beautiful graphics outlining the pretty, gory and sometimes ugly world of Doom. Demons feel as real as they ever have in the latest installment of the series.+ PC optimization is remarkable - the game runs well on a vast range of hardware and even on weaker machines looks and plays surprisingly solid, once again id software does an applausable job.+ Amazing soundtrack to accompany you through the whole campaign.+ A nicely challenging video game, rare thing to say for a lot of 2020 titles. Negatives:- The game has loads of weapons and modifications for each of them. That would be overwhelming to most people I imagine, learning all of them is quite the task, so during my playthrough I used only a handful of them, which work with my playstyle.- Battlemode does not sound that interesting to me, sure you have other players with you, but the amount of demons you get during the campaign would be quite enough. That said I have not actually played it, as the campaign is what matters to me.- The "story" is more serious, so to speak, in this one, which doesn't appeal to me and I would imagine it won't appeal to others too. Doom has always been gameplay, AKA slay everything in your way and have as much fun as possible type of game for me.
Holycrap this game is amazing. This is the best single player FPS and that I've played in years.
What is Doom Eternal? Short answer. Pure unadulterated badass demon slaying action!
A well executed spin on the shooter genre, that aims to teach both new comers and veterans a different and unique way of approaching encounters, not only in this game, but all FPS out there.

It excels at everything the 2016 Doom introduced and pushes that to a highly more adrenaline fuel rush than anything you've experienced before. It's faster, it's bigger and it's more Doom. It's a true blast to play!

There is far more to unravel in Eternal than just "here is gun, make demons go boom". The game requires strategy and reflexes. When you hear that heavy metal music, it's time to fight like hell with both brains and brawn.

At first glance you might think the combat is chaotic and all over the place, and truthfully that is how it's going to feel at first because you are just starting to learn "The Doom Dance". Allow me to explain. The combat in Eternal is a rhythm of satisfying executed weapon swapping, dashing, jumping and kills that puts the player in a coordinated mindset to always be on the move, shooting and managing ammo, health and armour. And this dance will be learned and understood the more you play. Don't let yourself be discouraged. You will get the hang of the visceral nature of Doom Eternal. It may at first feel the game is forcing you into a certain play style, it's actually teaching you to better manage and control the situations you are faced with.

This masterpiece of violence is going to be all you're thinking of when you are finally ready to use every tactic you've learned along the way. It's a grand spectacle of fantastic audiovisual communication to the player. The idea that no matter how much you replay it, the game challenges you to invest the time and experiment and use different methods of clearing each arena, proving how well the new formula works where you want to perfect these mechanics because they reward the player and feel accomplished for their effort. Very good game design on all fronts, and the soundtrack is fire!

Un giro bien ejecutado en el género de disparos, que tiene como objetivo enseñar tanto a los recién llegados como a los veteranos una forma diferente y única de abordar los encuentros, no solo en este juego, sino en todos los FPS. Sobresale en todo lo que presentó el Doom 2016 y te impulsa a una descarga de adrenalina mucho mayor que cualquier otra que hayas experimentado antes. Es más rápido, más grande y más Doom.

Walka w Eternal to rytm satysfakcjonującej wymiany broni, skoków, skoków i zabójstw, który wprowadza gracza w skoordynowany sposób myślenia, aby zawsze być w ruchu, strzelać i zarządzać amunicją, zdrowiem i zbroją. Im więcej grasz, tym więcej się uczysz i rozumiesz, jak tańczyć. Nie zniechęcaj się. Dowiesz się o instynktownej naturze Doom Eternal. Na początku gra może wydawać się, że jesteś zmuszony do przyjęcia określonego stylu gry, w rzeczywistości uczy cię lepszego zarządzania i kontrolowania sytuacji, z którymi się spotykasz.

There are pros and cons with Doom Eternal. I really enjoy the story arc of Doom eternal and the map design is well done. The missions challenge the player to come back and continue to gain more skill as well as to explore the levels. I also enjoyed the challenge of the Ancient Gods Part 1 expansion pack. However, When I played the Ancient Gods Part 2, It was not as challenging as I had hoped. Especially the final mission and boss fight. I was expecting much more of a challenge for what the objective was. I encourage the team at Bethesda to increase the difficulty of the second campaign expansion.

Doom eternal is the best shooter I've ever played. It forces you to think, but also gives room for a lot of creativity once you learn how to use your tools. each level is beautiful and the shooting feels amazing. I really recommend it for people who love skill based shooters. I also suggest coming in with an open mind. Doom Eternal isn't just some random old first person shooter you see publishers funding month after month. It isn't some modern military shooter. It's a puzzle game - nay, a rhythm game disguised as an FPS. That rhythm being a quite literal chainsaw metal soundtrack carried by the game's immaculate level design. The enemy design is the strongest I've ever seen in a game. Each one offering something completely different and unique opportunities to destroy them. Every arena is a glorified flowchart where you're assessing your ammo, health, and armor reserves at every given moment. Not to mention the dozens of demons that are always in your face, ready to be shot at. Doom Eternal is a masterclass of modern video game design and the best non-VR FPS to have ever been made.
Do I really need an explanation as for why I recommend this game? What has not been said about this amazing game.

I have no reservations saying this is one of the tightest, most meticulously engineered, most fun, gorgeous, replayable FPS games ever made. The resource-management system is top notch, the battles exciting, the environments gorgeous and varied, the mechanics all relevant and well-balanced, the lore terrible but who cares, and the boss fights decent, but then again, nothing is perfect. The challenge, especially is very gratifying. You should play this game 15-20 times through.

Doom Eternal is nothing short of a masterpiece. The graphics are amazing, the story is captivating, and the difficulty is still staggering, even on easy mode. Really makes you marvel at how the Doom video game series has evolved.
Amazing graphics and great game play throughout. Challenging but in the best way, very engaging!

Its Great, At first I could not handle the chain gun + flamethrower + grenade + dash + supershotgun hook at the same time and quick weapon switching but this changed with some time. The arachnotron (spidey thing) was a challenge one of the first big enemies, 20 hours in and I crush it. Same thing with the maurauder as soon as you learn how to bait his vulnerability state/attack move he becomes easy and then when you learn how to quick weapon switch he is done. His wolf will be no issue after your aim and timing is dialed in. I really enjoy the collectibles. You can get a suit upgrade which shows you the locations of them. This negates the need for a tedious Youtube Video or not if you can't solve the puzzle. The parkours are hard at first small deviations from the required movement lead to failure but latter your timing is right and you will swing like tarzan. These pakours also help later in combat. They learn you how to move correctly and how to don't miss a ledge. It is great to overcome these hard challenges.

DOOM (2016) was a game that took the “old” formula of FPS games and reinvented it for a new era. DOOM Eternal takes all of what DOOM did, and builds on it – for better and for worse. The core combat is excellent – you are encouraged to be constantly mobile, with a broad variety of enemies rewarding you for taking a variety of different approaches and using different tools in your arsenal. You are encouraged to both fight at a distance, to fight at midrange, and to fight up close by various different enemy types, which helps to mix up combat encounters and keep them fresh and interesting. You have a chainsaw and a flamethrower, the former of which lets you instant-kill enemies for more ammo and some health and the latter of which gives you armor, as well as your glory kills – badly injured enemies start flashing, and you can rush in and do a special kill on them for a bunch of extra health (and if they’re on fire, armor as well). But at the same time, many enemies can do a lot of damage up close, so you are rewarded for moving in, taking out some foes, then moving back out again, using cover to absorb ranged attacks, before moving to a new position to lay down more damage. You also have a pair of grenades – a frag grenade that does damage, and a freeze grenade that freezes enemies in a large area – along with a “blood punch”, another upgraded melee attack that you get by glory killing enemies, resulting in a powerful attack that can severely injure or kill demons and give you a bunch of health drops. In the endgame, you also get a sword, that instantly cuts any non-boss demon in half (and even some miniboss demons), though it has severely limited ammunition. It can all be a bit much to keep track of sometimes, but it ends up rewarding the player for mixing up their gameplay, and not just falling into the trap of doing the same thing over and over again. You have eight weapons, each of which has two alternate fire modes, and almost all of them are very useful against particular foes, rewarding players for using all their weapons – something I really like seeing. The eighth weapon, the BFG, has a second “mode” that is actually a separate weapon in the same slot, both of which use the BFG ammo – a rare drop, but it makes sense, as the BFG can wipe out most enemies in a single shot, while the other weapon can lay down heavy damage very rapidly as well. The only downside of the combat system is that the higher difficulty levels mostly function by making the enemies more bullet spongey and making you take more damage. While not the end of the world, it can make enemies a little on the annoyingly damage soaky side in Ultra-violence mode, the second highest difficulty level, and you can die pretty fast. That said, the combat is pretty well-balanced even on that mode, and I made it through the entire campaign without changing the difficulty level or using the optional temporary powerup sentinel armor, which serves as a means of helping players who get stuck. Still, there were some encounters (particularly optional ones) that killed me repeatedly, and some of the bosses were a bit frustrating. Indeed, the second to last boss was a low point of the game – while cool visually, the boss primarily functioned by making the ground do damage. While “stay out of the bad” is a classic boss tactic, it is less fun in a FPS, where you have a restricted field of view – doubly so given that the boss flew overhead, so the “bad” was not visible from your FOV on the ground while shooting up at her. However, apart from a few niggles, the combat was pretty good. The same cannot be said about the rest of it. The game has a story, but the story is confusing, as it does not pick up where DOOM 2016 left off, but some time later. Moreover, it just isn’t very good – the DOOM Slayer is not much of a character, having no dialogue, and mostly just seeming rather angry. Other characters talk AT you, but it isn’t very interesting. Moreover, what plot IS there isn’t particularly interesting even apart from the main character – it feels a bit generic fantasy, which is doubly weird given it is a sci-fi setting. The DOOM Slayer brushing off the story in the first game was funny, but it didn’t work nearly as well here, because they were more intimately involved with the goings on, the plot being more important but also more confusing and mediocre. It is even more awkward considering one of the levels is pretty much entirely story content, and while it finally makes the story make more sense, it doesn’t actually make the story GOOD. As a result, I’m left feeling like this was a pretty good game, but it was far from perfect. It improved on DOOM (2016) in a number of ways, but also took a step backwards in others.

I believe there are two types of games: those that strive to send a message, and those that simply aim to entertain the player. DOOM Eternal belongs to the latter group; not that there’s anything wrong with it - quite the contrary. Because it excels at it.

This game frantic relentlessness is often exactly what I'm looking for in a modern FPS. Juggling resources and living every second on the edge of death is a great way to unwind and few other games require quite the same undivided, hysterical concentration. It has got hardcore metal music, intricate/asymmetric map design and gruesomely cathartic glory kills is as exhilarating as ever, in necessarily short bursts. This is the only PURE FPS that will nail you to the screen with every moment.

Playing it delivers the same cathartic craze the original Doom and Doom II did in the early '90s: overwhelmed by the horrors around every turn, but empowered with an impressive collection of weapons at the ready. But the new Doom is louder and faster than the old model. Its battles ask more of you, and its heavy-metal soundtrack causes your body to quiver from turbulent surges of adrenaline. From the outset two things are made immediately clear: you were born to kill demons, and you'll do anything it takes.

But Eternal you kill demons (Which I think is very appropriate) and not people! Why would you want to kill good hardworking individuals that have wives and kids? When you could be killing satan's evil demons! Overall I would highly recommend this game to any Christian parents who are looking for games for their kids.

This game frantic relentlessness is often exactly what I'm looking for in a modern FPS. Juggling resources and living every second on the edge of death is a great way to unwind and few other games require quite the same undivided, hysterical concentration. It has got hardcore metal music, intricate/asymmetric map design and gruesomely cathartic glory kills is as exhilarating as ever, in necessarily short bursts. This is the only PURE FPS that will nail you to the screen with every moment.

It's the raw cerebral intensity of Quake married with Doom's enemy roster and its violent, cathartic attitude. Enjoying this game requires a certain frame of mind, a certain willingness to push yourself and to think in the heat of the moment. But it's extremely rewarding if you meet it on its own terms. Nearly every weapon feels like it has a significant role, a stark contrast to Doom 2016's promotion of 2 weapon playstyles. Ammo counts have been massively reduced, pushing the player towards intelligent use of their loadout. Overall, the way I would describe this difference is that Doom 2016 treats its weapons as a set of toys, in which any can be used at any time without too much consequence. Doom Eternal treats them as tools, and you have to use them well to achieve success.

Epic game with hyper-intense gameplay loop of constant movement, weapon swapping, and decision making. It makes you feel like a demon-slaying god when you finally overcome. It's extremely engaging to the point that I keep coming back even after like 4 playthroughs.

The Doom Slayer is more mobile in every possible way and the combat is even more fast paced. Enemies are smarter, more aggressive and more varied across the board. New abilities like the blood punch, flame belch and ice grenade have been added, and provide even more tactical depth.
A nice calm game where you go for a walk with your pet shotgun and say hi to the locals in a correct manner.

Overall Doom Eternal is simply everything I dreamed it would be, which is really saying something these days. ID Software should be PROUD of this masterpiece and I can't thank them enough for continuing on this series.

Yes, there are some definite differences between Eternal and 2016, but nearly all of them are for the better. Combat is even more visceral, and while it may at first feel the game is forcing you into a certain play style, it's ACTUALLY giving you more control on how to manage resources. You have to play smarter, but you can also remedy any situation far easier than in 2016. Need armor? Cook em. Health? Stab em. Ammo? Saw em. It's so straight forward but very satisfying at the same time. And after experimenting a bit with weapon loadouts, you DO NOT have to use sticky bombs or zoomed rifle shots to disable demon weak points. It is preferable because it's much faster, but I was able to disable their points with different weapons or completely ignore them entirely, by overwhelming them with firepower.

Doom Eternal is a masterpiece. id software (ID) has stuck to the same 27 year old formula that PC gamers fell in love with on MS DOS, and continue to improve on it with additional game mechanics, an upgraded engine, and new demons of Hell to slaughter while listening to excellent heavy metal music.

Tasty, but not quite what I expected.

[DOOM Eternal: Fast and Furious] DOOM Eternal is a role model for all shooters that aspire to create an engaging and challenging experience for gamers. As a side note, it is important to mention that difficulty settings play a crucial role in the game because their adequacy to your gaming skills determines whether you would have a positive or a negative impression from the walkthrough. Conversely, the story is not the strongest part of the game; no, let me put it differently - the lore is quite rich and thought-through, but the game lacks in the ability to present this lore to the player in the appropriate manner. Be that as it may, DOOM Eternal is perfect in what it was designed for, that is - shooting and killing hellish creatures, both from the shooting perspective per se and its platforming entourage. For performing the demon executions, the protagonist a.k.a. the Doom Slayer has a plethora of different “devices”, ranging from shotgun and rifle to rocket launcher and ballista. Some say it is even possible to get the iconic BFG (however, unfortunately, I did not manage to obtain it). The platforming, in its turn, is not overwhelming but convenient and fun, thus presents itself as a cool addition to the main mechanics rather than as an obsolete burden. As a result, the seamless combination of the shooting and platforming helps to create a captivating gaming experience, not letting the player get bored. Nonetheless, for such an amazing “degustation” of the game, the choice of the game difficulty is paramount. Should you set your settings too high - and you risk ending up bogged up in repetitive grinding to get the necessary improvements without which it is pretty damn reckless to move on. Or, there is a possibility that one battle arena or some boss would prove unbeatable on the highest difficulty settings (dear speedrunners, not everyone is as talented as you are); hence, the frustration might even prevent an overachieving player from actually finishing the game. On the other hand, the easiest difficulty level is, well, too easy. Namely, there is never a shortage of ammunition, health and armor, and extra lives continue to pile up because a hard enough challenge never occurs. In this scenario, the possibility of leaving the game unfinished is also quite high because where there is no challenge, there is no excitement. In brief, I would recommend opting for the difficulty settings somewhere between the two extremes. A blot on the landscape - the story presentation. In my opinion, this aspect of the game is pretty weak. I mean, the cutscenes and short dialogues only present the story to the player on a need-to-know basis, like “here is your enemy, kill it”. This situation is pretty ironic because the game lore itself is worth looking into but is hidden under a large massive of text in the “codex” page. Yes, I know, DOOM is not an RPG with a divaricated dialogue system and a possibility of making important choices that influence the course and the ending of the game. And yes, maybe too much story would distract the player from holding on to what the game was initially designed for, that is slaying “alternatively alive” monsters. I just think a little more context would be in order. In any case, DOOM Eternal is a solid piece of gaming art, one of the best in its genre and, with the right approach, could deliver a cornucopia of emotions, ranging from anger and sort of “ambitious powerlessness” to exhilaration and happiness after clearing another stage. Even without knowing exactly why you need to do all of this stuff. 9 out of 10

DOOM Eternal é a prova da destreza de tiro em primeira pessoa da id Software. Ele mantém o que fez DOOM 2016 um jogo tão amado, enquanto também corrige seus problemas; a variedade de níveis é maior e a jogabilidade é agradável até o final - ao contrário de 2016, que se tornou repetitivo nas horas finais. A seleção esmagadora de sistemas de atualização e seções de parkour incongruentes não são solicitadas e são um pouco estranhas, mas adicionam sabor à mistura e não prejudicam sua experiência. Se você gosta de jogos de tiro em primeira pessoa, DOOM Eternal é uma compra obrigatória.

Doom Eternal ist brutal, rücksichtslos, unbarmherzig und bedingungslos brillant. Ich hatte nicht erwartet, dass das Spiel so gut wird, und es hat mich von Anfang an umgehauen. Die Musik, der Kampf, die Geschichte und die Überlieferungen fallen zusammen, um ein Meisterwerk eines Spiels zu schaffen.

DOOM (2016) brought the series back to life, so I waited for what the sequel to DOOM would introduce us to, this time with the subtitle Eternal. In short, DOOM Eternal improves everything from 2016. Right from the beginning, we have a view of our hero, who puts on a mask and doesn't keep us waiting too long and throws us right into the action. After all, this is supposed to be the case, and as I mentioned in the review of the previous part, DOOM, in my opinion, has never been so much about the story and it was mainly an event. Friends ... how to describe it. The action is here ... PHENOMENAL! In the previous game, I slightly complained that it could have been even faster and I got exactly what I wanted and even more! Weapons of luxury, as in the previous game, we just got a new toy in the form of Crubical. Ladies and gentlemen. Mowing these demons was indescribable. In addition to this news, there are others and one, oooh. The one thing ... that completely changes the game and that's DASH! Dash will give you the opportunity to move much faster and so the whole event is even faster, faster and even BRUTAL! We have added new animations in the game, and believe me, that's a different cut. How creative the developers were and what possibilities we massacre the Ememak. In short, the new glory killy is an ABSOLUTE gem, and imagine that the HELL SOUNDTRACK is playing into it. Overall, you feel unstoppable. The player feels that he simply has incredible power, or at least I perceived it that way. It is also worth mentioning the boss fights, which were already luxurious in the previous part at the time, but are several times better here. Locations have also undergone a change. Are we no longer only in hell, but also on Earth, in winter biomes, or even in heaven or where the hell are we? I admit that I don't know myself, but it doesn't matter, because I would just use spoilers unnecessarily and I don't want that. It is possible to spoiler here, because there is again a story, which this time is not harmful and in my opinion is much better than the one from the previous part. The developers simply found a kind of sweet spot dosing action and cut-scenes. Of course, there are also improvements. One of the novelties that players don't praise about the game twice is the jumping passages. Personally, I didn't mind, but for some it was a matter of slowing down the action and unnecessarily stretching the game. I personally disagree. The action here is unbelievable and has such a pace that it just won't let you breathe. So I could somehow calm down all the adrenaline in these parts, where you just jump. Well, I think I praised the game so much, so it's probably no surprise that I think it's a perfect FPS and an excellent game, which I recommend to both DOOM series fans and FPS fans in general.
DOOM Eternal improves upon just about everything that the first game set in motion.

i usually like to post joke reviews but this game is to good for that there's so much depth to the combat, the movement is great, the guns feel fantastic, the environments look fantastic, and it is very very well optimized. on my GTX 1650 it runs at 80-120 FPS on high settings and 120-144 on low settings not to mention the game still looks great at low settings. The platforming is pretty decent it's not amazing platforming but it's simple enough to never interrupt the pacing, it actually helps the pacing by working together with the exploration in between fights to give you something to do in between arenas rather than just walking. great game don't listen to the games journalists who claim it's boring. Limitations inherent to game's rules (being it stricter ammo limit and bigger emphasise on cooldown-based abilities and mobility) actually promote creativity and technical skill of using different tools and weapons - if you don't believe me, compare videos of how the game was played at release and how it's played now, how less popular mods and weapons caught second wind when players start experimenting with them. Honestly despite being more punishing Doom Eternal has much more variety in combat than 2016. But it all takes learning and getting used to, player has to suffer for some time to overcome the entrance barrier and get into a mindset and skillset where the game becomes incredibly fun and some people just don't want to put time into the game to get there, which is completely their right.

I love the HELL out of this game. There are some aspects of the Doom immediately prior to this that I love. The simplicity. However, I feel that Doom Eternal is in general a much more challenging game. The action in this game never ends, and the music is fantastic. The visceral deaths feel so good in this game, and there are so many ways to kill your enemies. Weapon modifiers are well thought out and most of them are practical. Doesn't feel like your wasting your time upgrading your gear, and on top of that the game has weekly challenges keeps you coming back along with cheats that you can add to the game to change the pace of things. It's worth it. If it's on sale please buy it, you won't regret it.

PROS- Another absolute banger. The base game has some really amazing tracks and even though the DLC music was composed by different people it all fits into the gameplay like no other. - The enemies. Every enemy has a place and a reason to exist on the chess board. Some are incredibly punishing like a carcass up close. Others are just fodder meant for ammo or armour. But they all fit beautifully into the Doom dance. Even the Marauder. Just watch Under The Mayo's video about him if you're unable to confidently figure out a way to get through him. He's nowhere near as bad as others have made him out to be. - The shooting. Every weapon is fun to shoot, responsive and impactful. Enemies are pulled apart with the new gore system and no weapon feels underwhelming or useless. - The controls. Doom guy controls wonderfully (especially when you get the rune to control yourself in mid air better) and zipping around the arena with your dash, swinging off poles and meathooking yourself into the air is incredible. The sense of speed never feels like too much. - The combat. On Nightmare the enemies are relentless. This is where the Doom dance shines. You will likely have to get used to quick switching weapons, constantly flame belching, ice bombing and glory killing to stay alive. In 2016 moving in 1 direction wouldn't result in much of a punishment. In Eternal you have to be moving in all directions to properly avoid being hit and I love it all the more for that. Using your chainsaw as an ammo refill was a neat little addition that I personally grew to love a lot along with the flame belch for armour refills. - The visuals. This game looks even better than 2016. The vistas are incredibly, textures are higher, enemies are designed to look more closely like their original sprites and the detail on them in terms of textures and animations is top notch. - The performance. No game performs like Doom does whilst looking this good. I've never had frame drops from too much happening on screen nor have I ever encountered slow downs from too many enemies spawning in at once. Truly remarkable how well this game runs. Playing this on ultra, at 144hz at 3440x1440 is amazing. CONS- The story unfolds in a very expository manner. Entire concepts that doom guy would already know about are spoken directly to the player instead of being shown or leaving that information to a codex for those who care to read about it. - The crashing. I have had several crashes throughout my time and have never been able to figure out why. At 1 stage I played about 16 hours without an issue (my first playthrough). Then I had about 4 different crashes over about 10 hours of gametime. Just recently I've been practicing some Ultra Nightmare runs and it hasn't crashed once. Its been very inconsistent. - As of 16 MAR 21 you will likely encounter issues with the bloodpunch and chainsaw. The bloodpunch will sometimes not activate at all or you'll have an enemy highlighted orange for a glory kill but you'll blood punch it instead. With the chainsaw you could be closer than you actually need to be but have the game not register the attack and flash "no target" or you'll get the same message flash up if you try using it against a demon thats in the middle of some animations. The latter instance is inconsistent in of itself though as I've managed to chainsaw many imps whilst they were leaping between platforms. - Ground attacks from certain enemies have a tendency to activate infinite tracking at times. I've had some attacks fall short as I dashed backwards. Others rounded corners and somehow followed me into the air. It doesn't happen often but its frustrating when it does. - Conclusion: An amazing fps/action game

Okay so after finishing the game 2 times,First on Please don't hurt me and second on Ultra-Violence It is time for a review! Should you buy this? Yes, overall it is Doom.Price might be a little bit high but it gets decent on sales. Okay let's get to the point! PC Requirements: Decent (At least 3gb GPU and a decent CPU) Graphics: Graphics are nice! Comparing Lowest and Highest graphics they look similarlike a difference between 2 graphic options next to each other in an order. What actually changes islighting quality, reflections etc. (which can be up to 6,7gb vram starting from 2.7gb vram) Sound design: All I can say is BEST MUSICS and Most seducing death, slaying, demon (and more) sounds Bugs, Glitches: There might be some that people encountered before but I finished the game peacefullyin my both 2 gameplays. Load times: it is not instant load, but it is nice. Story: They tried to do something, good cinematics and plenty of opportunities to see the Doomguy. How long? 25 hours Gameplay: it is nice and Fun beside some anger issues sometimes for some levels, but you must be moretactical instead for just shooting around like you have to first destroy guns of demons, make cacodemons eatbombs or use specific weapons on specific demons. Always have an eye on how many ammos you have, you will have to use the chainsaw so many times that you can't even imagine, now little demons are a source of ammo to use yourchainsaw on. About the fighting arenas, they are nice mostly, besides some odd wall placements letting you being surrounded and die (only a few designs like that). About some cons now: (weapons to be used: Super Shotgun, Ballista, Bomb) Marauders, the new enemies. They are hard if you are too far they use their super shotgunor send a wave with their axe made of argent enery, if you are too close they might wield their axe on you. Keep middle range dont attack in random times, they might use the instant-wielding shield and you will lose time reloading your super-shotgun giving you a death risk, so always attack when he is about to attack. If you are low on ammo/health, be rapid go chainsaw/glory kill or bloodpunch some little demon and get back to the fight. (you are not always encountering them but they are tough) Doom Hunters, they are dangerous until you destroy they rocket down there in the legs part. This rocket gives them a Plasma Shield and increases strength. After you destroy the rocket with Shotgun's minigun mod, rocket launcher or minigun(any tough weapon) he is now very weak and you can chill! So that's all for my review, it is overall a very nice DOOM experience like always. I give it a 10/10

Maar onthou, ek was in die vroeë negentigerjare by Doom op 'n 486-rekenaar. Dit is Doom Evolved. Dit is wat dit veronderstel is om na byna 30 jaar te wees. Oltre a questo, non avevo altri problemi tecnici di alcuna importanza. È stato divertente, divertente da interpretare e la storia era abbastanza buona da mantenere il mio interesse fino alla fine.

It reinvents what a run and gun game can be. It's not just shooting your way through hordes of easy enemies, you're actively figuring out which weapons work against which enemies the best, to create a flow, or murderous dance.
Boss fights continually play off of your expectation and habits, with each of them conditioning you into certain playstyles, then using those exact habits against you. Brilliant design.

This is the fps of genre, you better listen to this you p*ssy. DOOM Eternal is my another favorite single-player fps, and i'm in love replaying this over 4 times already. DOOM Eternal take place after DOOM 2016 ending (I'm not going to spoiled it, go see for yourself and play DOOM 2016 what is happening at the ending) over 66% has been consumed by the demons. DOOM Guy and VEGA going to work their way and Rip and Tear. The intro is already a badass. The game go straight right in to the action. No more bullsh*t pistol. Pistol is ruining the pacing on DOOM 2016. In DOOM Eternal, you start with the Shotgun right away and go for 1, 2, 3 shot at the Zombies faces. And then, there is the chainsaw. Chainsaw has a ability to drop shotgun ammo, heavy ammo, cells ammo, and rocket ammo. I don't know why people are complain about ammo because of the shotgun clip size was originally for 20-30-40-50-60 max from DOOM 2016. DOOM Eternal's shotgun clip size will give you 16-18-20-22-24. In my opinion, id Software did a good job balancing the game and not to give this game more repetitive. It was a good changes. I don't want to hear you guys give a sh*t about an ammo changes! Press C for ammo bi*ch! Character model has been overhaul for the Classic DOOM looking. example for Soldier have bright orange eyes and dye green hair. Cacodemon blood was originally from red blood to blue blood. New and return of the enemy from DOOM 2016 : Lost Soul, Hell Knight, Baron of Hell, Mancubus, Cyber-Mancubus, Imp, Soldier, Cacodemon, Pinky, Spectre, Cyberdemon (was renamed for Tyrent), Cueball, Prowler (from the multiplayer of DOOM 2016 and now he was from the actual the first time in single-player)  and Revenant . The return of the demon: Archvile, Pain Elemental and Arachnotorn. BUT WAIT I'M NOT DONE YET! There is new demon in this game. Carcass, Gargoyle, Whiplash, Dread Knight, Mecha Zombies and Mayker Drone. We are on to boss fight you encounter: Doom Hunter, Gladiator, Khan Mayker and the gigantic Icon of Sin. I forgot something I'm I? Oh yeah. Marauder, this is the only enemy can hurt the pacing if you are new to DOOM Eternal. He can dash, summon a wolf. deploying his shield for his arm, throwing axes, and shotgun if you stand to close. For real, he can kick your a**. He is tough and annoying. Expert DOOM Eternal player like me. You have to keep Marauder at mid range until eyes flash green so you can deal damage to him. Marauder can even block your shot, I mean like block everything, he also dash way if you throw a grenade and ice bomb (

Basically what a game should be. It takes the foundation of doom '16 and builds up on it with more movement, more demons and more everything. Though sometimes it feels a bit "too" much, for what it wants to be, but i would be nitpicking at that point. Id Software have really shown  what it means to make a game that takes a few mechanics and fleshs them out as much as they can, with concentrated, thought-out levels. Maybe a bit too much platforming. Fantastic presentation with an insane soundtrack. The story basically puts you through 14 hours of endless, gory, wonderful, never-ending action. So if you like fun and fast shooters this ones the best in years.

Brief summary of the games combat. Dash jump meathook onto cacodemon. Let go to fly in air supershotgun than switch to ballista for two shot combo kill switch precision bolt to headshot hell solider while still in air. Back on ground dash like madman to dodge incoming fire meathook again onto relevant. Let go of the hook to fly in air precision bolt, supershotgun, flame fire and than ballista to kill it seconds. Back on ground again freeze barron of hell with ice bomb. Blood punch, flame it, switch to full auto shotty attachment, baron of hell unfreezes but heavily damaged dash quickly to chainsaw nearest fodder demon, meathook onto baron of hell and let go to fly in air. Precision bolt rocket combo and finish it off with chaingun. This game is a masterpiece.

Review: Has some of the best combat in the entire action genre. Constantly moving non stop action makes you feel like you are on a rampage. Doom eternal does not pull any punches either the game is difficult especially near the end but the difficulty curve is also sloped in a way you naturally get better so that you are ready for those killer parts at the end. The only thing holding it back is the game will often slow down in between combat encounters, parts that could be taken out entirely and the game be better and the final boss feels gimmicky.

So much better than Doom (2016), this one at least tries to be fun. All my favorite demons are back and some new one looks pretty cool. If i could choose, this would win Game of the Year award, not that it matters, but anything is better than Last of Us Part II.
