[NO SPOILERS] DOOM Eternal is an instant new classic. The developers focused on everything that made DOOM (2016) so great and took them to a whole new level, removing what did not work. Guns and progression are more balanced. Gun mods are remade and more fun to use. Hell levels can look more cartoony, fiery, and uninspired if compared with those from 2016, sure - I miss the brown, bloody and creepy look of Kadingir Sanctum, Titan's Realm and Necropolis - but the maps are now much larger and work better with the new rhythm, which thanks to the more limited ammo and new flamethrower and chainsaw system, is even more fast-paced. DOOM (2016) almost feels like a sandbox game right now. The new-introduced dashing mechanic works really well, and the platforming is just at the right amount, making your movement across the large open arenas feel like dancing with the devil, almost literally. It sets up a new FPS sub-genre at its own. For a lack of a simpler term, it is a retro-arena-rhythmic-frenetic-survival-metal-first-person-shooter. You won't be able to blink for the most part of the game. You won't be able to simply shoot at demons whenever you want and using whichever gun you want ignoring the ammo and health counters. Disobey those rules and then you are lost. If you want to take it easy, just play the previous game, it's fine. This game is made for those who want to feel like they REALLY are DOOM.

Esperaba con muchísimo hype DOOM ETERNAL y la verdad yo considero que la espera valió cada maldito segundo, el juego es muchísimo mas frenético que su precuela, la historia es buena, pero no esperes un guion súper epico, porque no lo es, a pesar de que dijeron que el juego duraba lo doble que DOOM 2016 puedo confirmar que no es así, de hecho dura un poco menos, pero esto se compensa con una mayor cantidad de secretos, una rejugabilidad buenísima, un battlepass y un multiplayer que está 2/3 Si tengo que ponerle un pero al juego sería que una vez acabado el juego no se libera la munición de la BFG en todos los niveles como SI sucedía en DOOM 2016 y el Crisol también lo usaremos MUUUY pocas veces

Quite simply one of the best fps games ever made. This sequel is not afraid to push the envelope and evolve the gameplay but it does so while remaining respectful of the original. Combat now feels like a clockwork machine polished to perfection, run, jump, shoot, stab, jump, run, shoot, chainsaw, stab, grenade, jump, flamethrower, bloodpunch, jump, run, stab, it all blends together seamlessly and once it clicks, you find yourself at the centre of a beautiful whirlwind of ultra-violent destruction. The enemies are more threatening, the arenas are more dangerous, everything is bigger, better and faster than 2016. Several classic designs are also back for several monsters, weapons and items.The game isn't perfect, the early levels especially are not particularly fun as your health and ammo are severely limited and you don't have all your tools yet. But if you get past that, this is an incredible game and and an amazing experience. This game is most definitely a hard 10.

과거 팬들에 대한 감사와 자신들(제작자)들이 어릴때부터 해온 둠이란 아이피에 대한 경의가 잘 표현된 수작입니다. 과거 게이머들이 수평2D에서 싸움이었다면 둠 이터널은 수평 수직 3D 베이스에서 역동적인 게임을 즐길 수 있습니다. 현재 메너리즘에 빠진 FPS의 새로운 지평을 열어주었다고 감히 말할수 있습니다.  앞으로 둠이터널을 참고한 역동적이고 전략적인 전술의 FPS를 기대하게 해주었습니다.

This is my game of the year so far. It's a fantastic fast paced shooter with crazy high replay value. I have over 100 hours in the game and I am still enjoying every second of it. Some of the new mechanics and enemies take some getting used to, but once you are familiar with the game it's really, really fun. There is more story than previous Doom games, but I like it and some of the levels/story are really fascinating. This is one game which I cannot wait for the DLC! I really want more Doom!
Played it so many hours. It was great and a whole new experience compared from doom 2016

The user score is too low, possibly due to the mess that involved Denuvo anti-cheat for a week or two. That's no longer a problem, and the score needs to go up now. DOOM Eternal presents a beefy campaign for a modern shooter and raises the violence levels to over-the-top extremes. Multiplayer is unique and interesting. On a high-end PC, the game looks beautiful and obviously sounds orgasmic. The game's sound effects are awesome and make everything feel more satisfying. The soundtrack is metal af and nearly perfect. The single-player is a rare treat, offering about 30 hours of gameplay in one shot provided you search for all the collectibles. There are so many different demons, and the game ramps up the difficulty naturally, with the only unfair spikes happening if you take on the Slayer Gate challenges as you come across them. Enemies have weakpoints that you can exploit with certain weapons, all of which are fun and satisfying to use. Use equipment like grenades and flamethrowers to sustain yourself with armor and health pickups, and use the chainsaw to replenish your ammo. Ammo runs out quicker than it did in DOOM 2016, but the chainsaw is easier to use this time, adding to the mayhem. Harder difficulties result in more intense pulse-pounding action, and I do recommend setting the difficulty to Ultra-Violence to start. Doomguy moves fluidly by jumping and dashing, and he can hit enemies up close with the powerful, crowd-controlling Blood Punch. There are so many layers to the combat it's insane, and the demons you encounter will all have different optimal ways of dispatch. The progression system is nice and fun to partake in, though some may be turned off by the requirement of a Besthesda.net account. Multiplayer is fine but it isn't the game's selling point. While graphical fidelity in the game took a big hit when Devuno-anti-cheat was added, you can still occasionally see low-res textures if you stop to gaze at a wall up close. There's also plenty of lore in the game to get lost in, but some of the codex entries are laborious to read when I just want to get back to the action. Besides that, I do highly recommend this game. It's a whirling dervish of exhilaration for anyone who loves the idea of popping demon's eyes out of their sockets and thinks realism is for squares.

Thoroughly enjoyed playing this to 100% completion. Reviewed as single player only for now. Pure joy to play, more Doom 2016 with enough change to refresh. I grew up playing almost every Doom game (ports to consoles missed like PS port) and definately played every PC version as well as many WAD's and total conversions. This is still Doom, only slightly different, but still good. Just play it and have fun. It was ecstasy. A combat puzzle that only continued to scale in difficulty and levels. A gorgeous display of 3D puzzle solving with a theme that stuck to it's guns and flouted the genres of which it was borne while evolving into something with a story that was unnecessary and so extravagantly 70's metal. the tracksthe smoothness of the gameplaythe level designs( granted you can see the seams where the closer to post production levels were placed in and their difference in design from earlier stages levels)FXcreature designsthe AIthe over the top bossfightsthe over the top bonus roomsthe fact they honored Markiplier's father in the game it was amazing from start to finish and yes, yes, the if you die it deletes your save is 100% necessary.

This game is the best video game iv'e ever played.It brings the intense gameplay from 2016 and cranks it to 11.The game also doesn't let you use the super shotgun the entire game and makes you switch weapons which is a big problem in most games that id was able to fix.The movement and platforming is so much fun and the secrets are so cool to collect and will please any hardcore doom fan.They really made this game into a masterpiece by keeping the cartoony feel of the 1993 doom and mixed it with the intense gameplay of doom 2016 and made it more intense and fun.Every one who says it's bad because of the story or the new gameplay has no idea what doom is about or is the reviewer of cuphead who couldn't get past the tutorial.Doom was never about the story it was about fun and if you like the lore in doom id wrote pages of lore you can collect and read.I don't want id to think they made a bad game because of all these normies.Id if you read this keep it up and don't ruin doom by listening to these reviews.

When it comes to common arguments against Doom Eternal, it’s always about low ammo capacity and forced ways to deal with demons. Sure, id could’ve just made Doom '16 2 and be done with it. But they went the hard way. Let’s quickly examine it. In Doom ’16 there’re no limits on ammo, so creativity shouldn’t be limited, right? Well, the thing is you would end up just using Super weapons, with occasional weapon switching and chainsawing. But you probably gonna get Rich get Richer rune and forget about chainsaw and other weapons whatsoever. Game doesn’t encourage you to use other tactics, so why would you? In DE with ammo limit you’re punished for using only one weapon exclusively. But you’re encouraged to mix them (and their respective mods) in combat. Once you start doing it, ammo stops becoming an issue. Seriously. But then what about weak points? Aren’t they contradicting the intention to experiment? Here’s a thing - it’s only recommended way to deal with demons. Sure, you can always throw a grenade into Cacodemon’s mouth. But you can also kill it with charged Ballista shot OR use Ballista + Rocket + SuperShotgun combo OR even keep it alive so you can flee from dangerous situation with meathook. It also applies to other demons as well. Once you understand all of it, only then you’ll start enjoying Doom Eternal. And also find out that it’s better that Doom ’16. Oh, and story is whatever, and Battlemode’s netcode is rubbish.

This creates the potential for a power fantasy like no other, as whilst the hordes of demons feel threatening, with time you can develop into the most  OP killing machine that ever existed. Doom Eternal is a fantastic, fast paced, great shooter. When they added the anti-cheat system DRM into the game I was very upset since it was kernel level based and you needed it installed even for single player. However, I 100% appreciate the devs listening to us and removing that from the game. I highly recommend Doom.

The game-play is the best part, it's really well polished and thought out, so fun in fact I find myself going through the maps in the campaign over and over just for the thrill of the fast paced and diverse combat system evolved from the previous title. If you want a challenging game that forces you to think creatively and react fast, while also providing you amazing visuals, sound design and music, this is the game for you. My only complaints are with the story and some decisions with the art direction. The story seems totally disconnected from where it was left off in the previous title, the places and characters we interact with indicate that there's a lot of missing steps to this plot, almost like we skipped many chapters to get to this point and no context is provided further than a general recap of the major events between the previous game and this one. When it comes to the design choices for the graphics, I don't like the approach of sacrificing immersion for the sake of levity and clarity, like items floating in mid air and the generally soft, toy looking designs of some demons and locations. This gets worse when compared to the previous title, which had a more grounded approach to it's visuals and environments that locked you in a believable science fiction. In contrast to that, DOOM Eternal seems like it doesn't want to be taken seriously. Overall this game is absolutely it's worth in time and money just for the attention to detail when it comes to the combat and learning curve. It's a game I would recommend to my veteran FPS friends as well as somebody who never played a video game before, since I could never come close to express how much fun I've been having with it.
Good old school DOOM. I played with my younger nephews all weekend. It gave them a lot of joy.

Let's just start by saying that this is a fantastic, exhilarating, and brutal FPS. As someone who had not gotten into DOOM before this, I was a little concerned with what I would think, but I loved it. I'll break it down into a few categories: Gameplay, Story, and Aesthetic.Gameplay: This game is so incredibly fluid. The controls make it easy to bounce around the battlefield and destroy demons every step of the way. It's easy to change between weapons, use equipment, and chain together attacks to wipe out the demon hordes. The bosses are challenging, the secrets are fun to find, and slayer gates provide a unique challenge with a promise of reward upon the completion of them all. The only downside that I found is how intense it can be. It's a game that I enjoyed playing for a couple of hours, taking a break, and coming back to, as opposed to grinding it all out in one take. That's just personal preference of a casual gamer though, your experience may differ. 9/10Story: As I said, this was my first DOOM experience so I didn't know if I would be engaged, but I loved it. The amount of lore hidden around the world was amazing, and truly brought the player into the world of the Slayer. I know some people disliked the use of cut scenes in this game, but I thought they were a pleasant respite from the action and helped to flesh out the story, especially if you didn't feel like reading all of your Codex entries mid-game. The Fortress of Doom also made the character feel more real than I was expecting. 10/10Aesthetic: Beautiful, brutal, grisly fun all around. Being able to see the damage done to individual demons is incredibly cool, and adds a pseudo-health bar that is so unique. the environments are massive and well thought out. I truly enjoyed looking at this game as I played it and took time to take in the scenery. Plus the music is so intense and perfect for the feel of the game. 10/10Overall, this is a fantastic game, well worth the money, and has huge replay value as you try to collect everything, play with the cheat codes, and master the game. 9.5/10

Doom returns after the success of the 2016 reboot and proves it is still possible for a sequel to learn the right lessons from its predecessor and evolve into a new chapter that is greater than the sum of its parts. There is a decent story that the game tries to tell, with some excellent voice acting and impressive visual set pieces.  However it definitely takes a little bit of a backseat to the action – which I think is a fair compromise for how incredibly well the gameplay is executed. Right out of the Hellgate, Doom Eternal wastes almost no time arming you with new mobility and equipment options unique to the sequel in order to acclimate you to it’s break-neck pace combat ecosystem.  Within the opening hours of the game you gain the ability to dash twice in quick succession, swing off horizontal poles for extra air mobility, set your enemies ablaze to produce armor drops, and launch hands free frozen or classic frag grenades.  There are more tools you pick up later on in the game, but this moveset is gained relatively early and becomes absolutely essential to carving your way through each mission in a shower of blood and a face-melting soundtrack. Though the amount of abilities and keybinds you are required to use on a moment to moment basis may feel intimidating at first - the rhythm of combat is something that becomes second nature to the player thanks to the stellar pacing of Doom Eternal.  You never spend too much time staring at a puzzle trying to figure out a solution, or wasting time backtracking because you are unsure of where the game wants you to go.  And as the missions progress, so does the variety of threatening demons in each new encounter.  As enemies get more and more aggressive, you learn that your best chance at survival is to use the arenas to their fullest.  When combat is in full swing, the amount of decisions-per-second the game requires from you is probably one of its most attractive elements.  Choosing when to launch a grenade to either obliterate pursuing foes, or create an opening ahead of you to get to that staggered enemy for a health replenishing glory kill.  Do you use your frozen grenades to create space to focus your effects on a bigger foe, or pick the upgrade that increases damage to frozen enemies to shred through a group with a few well placed rockets?  Remembering where that clutter of lesser demons is so you can double-back with your flame belch to easily restock some armor.  Do you equip the ability to give you reduced cooldowns on grenades, or the ability to refund dash charges on glory kills for a quick run in/run out heal amidst the chaos of a Marauder smacking you around the room.  All of these decisions are being made constantly through some of the larger fights, and coming out the other side victorious is pure adrenaline. Doom Eternal is best when playing at whatever difficulty pushes back the most, such that you are almost always about to die – but don’t.  When attempting the first mission on ‘Hurt me Plenty,” the game felt more like I was passively viewing the level play out rather than fighting my way through it.  Bumping up to Ultra Violence made it so that every fight I entered was not guaranteed victory.  The excitement of playing Doom is at its highest when you are constantly fighting for every inch you gain throughout a lengthy combat encounter. Managing cooldowns, chainsaw fuel for ammo refills, and frantically trying to create a glory kill opportunity when the game beeps in your ear as soon as you are at death's door is absolutely thrilling.  Every single time I came out of these battles bloody and beaten – and every single time it felt like I became a better player. Playing Doom Eternal was easily one of the best first person shooter experiences I’ve had in years.  It made every other shooter feel like it was running in slow motion.  If you are a fan of the fast paced twitch-shooters of old, you are guaranteed to have one Hell of a time here. Final score:  9/10

It took me a little while to warm up to this game. Early on, it irked me that forces you to focus a lot on arbitrary, non sensical mechanics: for example, chainsawing enemies to get ammo. Demons infighting is unnecessarily frequent. And I missed tearing enemies apart with my barehands.But once i met with my first jumping puzzle, I started to warm up to the game. Its a sophisticated experience that challenges you in so many ways. It's not the simple pointing and shooting of Call of Duty, or the mindless catharsis of Doom 2016. It's a really brainy, challenging experience.Soon my warmth became red hot. As another reviewer aptly said, you feel like an unstoppable force of nature. But what's truly a pleasant surprise is the story. When it comes together about 75% of the way through the game (after seeming disjointed and confusing), it's actually something incredible, and serves to answer an important religious paradox in a very edgy and powerful way.Doom 2016 was mindless catharsis. Doom Eternal is so much more.

Could easily be GOTY if there was no Cyberpunk 2077 and Ghost of Tsushima

بهترین شوتر اول شخص تاریخ، از این بازی بهتر تو این سبک وجود نداره و نخواهد داشت مگر ایدسافتور باز هم دست به ساخت نسخه دیگر از این مجموعه و یا یک بازی دیگه بزنه تا لقب بهترین رو از آن خودش کنهاین بازی کاری میکنه تا پس تجربه اون تمامی دیگر بازی های شوتر اول شخص شبیه به یک شوخی به نظر بیان، گانپلی بی نقص و فوق العاده لذت بخش، استفاده از قابلیت های گوناگون برای رویارویی با هیولا ها،گرافیگ زیبا،طراحی محیط و سلاح ها و هیولاها،طراحی مراحل خارق العاده و همچنین سیستم ارتقا هوشمندانه در بازی، شخصی سازی متناسب بازی نوع بازی، گیم پلی سریع و پر از چالش(شوتر هاردکور)، داستان هیچ گونه نقش مهمی رو در بازی ایفا نمیکنه در واقع سری دووم اصلا بهش نیازی نداره چون روح بازی در گیم پلی اون نهفته است اما داستان بازی رو میشه به طور غیر مستقیم و خارج از چارچوب روایت رایج در اکثریت بازی ها متوجه شدبهینه سازی خارق العاده بازی که باعث میشه حتی کنسولی به ضعیفی اکس باکس وان پایه هم بازی رو ۶۰ فریم ثابت اجرا کنه و هیچ خبری از باگ ها یا مشکلات فنی بر روی هیچ پلتفرمی وجود ندارهاین بازی در مجموع یک شوتر اول شخص سرعتی همراه با حداقل ۲۰ و حداکثر ۳۰  ساعت گیم پلی خالص و اکشن نابه که تنوع بی حد و مرزی رو در خود جای داده و خشونت بسیار بالای بازی لذت تجربه اون رو بیشتر میکنه و اگر از طرفداران بی چون و چرای شوتر اول شخص کلاسیک هستید باید بگم دووم ایترنال بهترین بازی در این سبکه که میتونید تجربه کنید

The combat in this game is faster, more sophisticated, and just plain better than it was in DOOM (2016). The level design is more varied as you will travel to many locations over the course of the campaign. The sound effects are better and the music continues to get me really-super-pumped. Codex entries you find throughout this game describe a backstory of epic-ness.  But I have three minor grievances: first, the artistic tone was less grim and morbid than DOOM (2016); second, I didn't enjoy all the wall climbing and bar swinging; and third, I think there should have been more power-ups like Quad Damages and Berserks scattered around the levels.
Solid game for the most part, gets little bit repetitive, but still better than 2016 doom. Graphics could be little bit better for 2020 game honestly.

I love it, it gives you a constant feeling of frenzy, even if you're playing in normal mode, the game makes you feel like an unstoppable beast, and even though the parkour areas are not something I want in the game I love it. But not only the gameplay deserves a prize, any mistake the game may have, it compensates with its music, not to mention the collectibles, it's simply beautiful,

Отличная игра. Прошел с удовольствием. На основную карьеру ушло около 25 часов, проходил на сложности ‘ультра жестокость’.Все лучшее что было в части 2016-го года + куча новых врагов и механик. Aksiyon çeşitlilği ve platform öğeleriyle bir önceki oyunun üzerine koymuş. Kulaklıkla ve zor seviyede bir saatten sonra ara vermek gerekiyor.
Best Doom game after Doom 3, Doom 2016 was too basic for my taste, but Eternal is really good. All my favorite demons are back.

From every aspect of this game, it grabs you by the balls and does not let go until you've desimated every enemy exisitng in the game. It's a beautiful mixture of explosive mayhem and elegant coordination resulting in a game that stands out. The primary focus of the game lies of course in the campaign. When it comes to gameplay, it refines the already great combat from Doom (2016) with some added features. You still run and gun with immense traversal features at your disposal.Many weapons from the previous game return, like the combat shotgun and the insanely powerful ballista, but a hand of new ones introduces themselves. Amongst the arsenal lies the plasma rifle and the Unmaykr, a holy weapon using bfg ammo to annihilate any species coming in its way, which can only be accessed by completing the Slayer Gates. But not only that, onto the super shotgun is now introduced a grappling hook, allowing for fast movement by attaching yourself to enemies, which makes the already fast gameplay even faster.Adding to all this is new enemy types as well, which allows for more intense encounters. Many classic enemies from previous Doom games make a return, like the basic soldier, the flying Pain Elemental and the daunting Arch-Vile, while new ones also debut, like the shield creating Carcass, fast paced Dread Knight and snake sounding Whiplash. All enemies from Doom (2016) make a return (with even a mini version of the Cyberdemon and the Spider Mastermind), except for the Summoner. Boss encounters introduces even more enemies. The Doomhunter is a power house, consisting of cybeorg technology and a lot of health to make your day worse, which later becomes a common enemy through the game. The one stage bossfights test your skills to the action, resulting in intense one on one fights. However, the enemy that stands out the most is the Marauder. Representing your counterpart, the Marauder moves fast, deals heavy damage and can block any attack you launch at him. It is only when his eyes flash green and he goes in for an attack that he is vulnerable to your strength. His design shuts down the player's ego, resulting in an enemy in need of total focus to defeat, almost remeniscing a martial arts fight between two masters. He works different to all other common enemies in the game, working as a building stone to defining you as a master at the game, almost how main characters in movies meet an enemy that punches them to the ground. Through pain and sheer perserverance, you learn to fight him like all other enemies, and he becomes an incredible part of the roster.All of these factors result in a combat experience much faster, more aggressive and more brutal. The game also intesnifies its difficulty. Simple punches of enemies is not going to do the trick (unless you use a blood punch), so focus lies on the arsenal. Since new gameplay options are introduced, the level design has to compliment the speed, and here the game definitely delivers. The only gripe with the design (which aslo lies in most FPS games) is that you sometimes get stcuk on an enemy, and in a game like this you do not want to stand still and lose a lot of health. Outside of that, the developers did an amazing job. The art direction is supreme, with every level and place feeling huge and marvelous, inciting magic to every location the game takes you to, which also is helped by the insane graphics elevating these destinations to beyond epic boundaries. The soundtrack has a return from composer Mick Gordon, rocking out even more than the last game, thanks to incorporating more groovy guitar riffs, heavy techno filters and introducing a heavy metal choir(!) to help the grand scope of the game's aesthetic. Mick Gordon has knocked ot out of the park one's again. As to story, the game has a big adventure, but much of the information lies in codex entries scattered around the levels, and what is shown is either hard to follow (unless you've read the codexes) or uniteresting. While the story has some bright spots, it could've used some more cooking in the oven, since the game focuses som much on the plot.Outside of the singleplayer campaign is also a multiplayer, introducing battlemode: A game mode where one person plays as the Slayer, while two other people control one demon each, creating a 2 VS 1 experience. The multiplayer is entertaining and refershing, reflecting the intense gameplay of the singleplayer, and surprisingly balanced, but it's missing a vast erray of optional game modes to keep the fanbase engaged in the gameplay. If Battlemode was introduced along side classic game modes, like team deathmatch adn capture the flag, the multiplayer would be better off and even more emphazised by the players, but I can still see a community building around the multiplayer.All in all, you definitely get your bang for your buck with Doom Eternal. This is a secure purchase to anyone who is a fan of the first person shooter genre. Rip and tear until it is done!

I did not play the first doom very much only 2 hours. Doom eternal on the other hand i played and beat it. The only problem i have with this game is the length/replability of it. Once i beat it(17.4 hours) i did not feel the need to play it anymore. I bought this game for half off and for that price it is 100% worth it

By far the best FPS I've played and improves on DOOM 2016 in pretty much every way. The gunplay was satisfying, the music was banger, and it's just full of content. Only main gripe is a few rough difficulty spikes here and there

The story is not relevant but it is understandable since it is not the focus of the game, and even so, it fulfills the function of making you feel like a badass in the role of the Doomslayer.Do not be fooled by the first hours of play, once you progress through the levels, you get more weapons, and improvements that make the game a playable delight. No weapon is too many, each enemy has a weakness that requires a different weapon, which motivates you to use all weapons and improve them, which is an incentive for exploration to look for improvements, tokens and suits, which by the way, the levels They are very well done, so those slowdowns do not feel forced at all, and they are a pleasure thanks to the clever platform design and a few puzzles that, while easy, are still entertaining. The ammunition is more scarce than in the previous one which forces you to use the chainsaw intelligently. I would have liked to see more boss fights, but the truth is that the ones that exist are very well done, in addition to the fact that the construction of each level and the appearance of new demons makes the game not feel repetitive at all, even despite that there are not so many bosses.The game also has secondary levels and challenges that offer playable rewards and high replayability, and by itself the campaign is fun enough to make you want to replay it on another difficulty, in fact I liked the game so much that at the time I played on PS4 and now that I switched to PC I bought it because the game is worth it.If you like frenetic games that force you to use all your resources and think fast, this game is worth every peso even at its original price, and if you catch it on sale, do not think twice, buy it.

I was expecting a DOOM (2016) sequel, but I found a gem, a game that takes everything good that did on the first part and makes it evolve to a completely new level but keeping all the personality of the previous ones. The Mick Gordon's BSO still striking hard on my head everytime I take the DoomSlayer to a new carnage. Absolutely recommended.carnage. Absolutely recommended.

A helluva good time.  Addicting gameplay that requires some (not a whole lot) strategy.  Ammo is at a premium so you'll be switching guns a lot, certain demons require specific combinations to make it effective etc.  Just a flat out fun game to play.  Game throws a lot of mechanics at you (i never played the 2016 version) but before you know it you'll be zipping around destroying things.  Not a tactical cover shooting game and will take a bit of practice before you're on autopilot but then it starts to click and it becomes a violent ballet.  Oh and that soundtrack, just the cherry on top.

I'm fully convinced this is the best FPS ever made. It's uncompromising and radiates confidence in its design. It makes every other single player FPS game look primitive in comparison (including its 2016 predecessor), kind of like what Devil May Cry 3 did to action games. Just incredible depth and flow. Players who are slow to adapt and have scrub mindset tendencies neet not apply, it will eat you alive.

This is everything a sequel should be. Almost every aspect of the game has been expanded. The combat is more intense and demands your full attention, this is a good thing. Movement and traversal are now more dynamic with the addition of double dashes, the meathook, and monkey bars. The new ways of movement make the platforming especially easy and forgiving since you do not die when you fall. I love how the boring method of combat by using only using one gun, like in DOOM 2016, is obsolete. The game encourages you to play in unique and and creative ways because of how different each enemy plays. Weapon switch combos are a thing glory because the game rewards the player for managing their ammo economy well. This is an experience best played on mouse and keyboard because of how fast you have to react to chaotic situations. The is also noticeably more brighter than 2016. I think this is a good change because you can more clearly see enemies, health drops, or ammo. It would be unfair if arenas were took dark and you got killed because you could not see a particular enemy. My favorite demon to fight is the marauder because you cannot engage him like other demons. Weapon switch combos are mandatory against him and a skilled player who knows the game well can cheese the marauder a matter of seconds. Like all the other demons, the marauder is smart, he won't just charge at you blindly and swing his axe around like a mad man. He wish dash around and punish the player for getting too close. BATTLEMODE is also really fun because it bring the Slayer experience to multiplayer. This unique 2v1 game mode promotes cooperation between the demon players while they try to out smart and trap the Slayer. No demon player can brute force against a Slayer. I love it when a game discourages the easy and obvious route to success. I wish more game developers adopted this concept into their games. There is also a fantastic modding scene who create new and interesting ways to play. A horde mode mod and custom master levels were create to appease the most skillful of players. For those complaining about the cut scenes, just hold R, you can skip them.
Graphics - 9 of 10, Music - 10 of 10, Story - 6 of 10, variety of enemies - 9.5 of 10, fun factor - 9.5 of 10.

This game is very dynamic, and in my opinion this is the main advantage of the game. After completing Doom Eternal, I decided to replay Doom 2016, and after playing it a little, I found that it was difficult for me to play it - it looks slow after Eternal, and the weapon somehow feels worse ... However, in the new Duma there are several things that I have a complaint about. First, there are endless hints. As soon as you meet a new serious opponent, the game tells you how to kill him. WHAT??? WHAT FOR??? Shouldn't the player figure out the best way to kill the monster? But it's okay ... THE BOSS IS THE SAME! The game tells you how to defeat the BOSS! There is no excuse - the game keeps you like an idiot. And the second complaint is filing. If the last part was like science fiction, then this one looks like a fairy tale. We find the weapon floating in the air (in the previous part, we took it from the dead soldiers), everywhere there are some fire chains, like in Mario, and you can continue indefinitely. It looks somehow inappropriate for me, strange ... But nagging can be found in almost any game, and what I have listed is not very significant, in comparison with the coolest dynamic gameplay

I had this same problem when I started the game where I was constantly running out of ammo, but once I realized I'm supposed to be using my chainsaw in every encounter to replenish my limited ammo, I started **** loving this game. Granted, I also really like games like Overwatch and Titanfall 2, which play in a similar way. The graphics and the music are also top notch. It feels like a "next gen" game to me.

Es prácticamente perfecto, la versión de PC tiene aparte mucho mimo y simbolismo por parte de los desarrolladores.Gráficamente es algo superior a su antecesor, no cuenta con raytracing o DLSS pero aún así luce muy bien.A nivel de soundtrack es magistral, prácticamente todos los temas son excelentes y muy memprables.A nivel jugabilidad es lo mejor que ha habido en años, no solo es disfrutable a mas no poder,transmite ese sentimiento de que tienes el control y que eres prácticamente imparable.A nivel de rendimiento es simplemente un trabajo impecable, no solo está increíblemente optimizado, también te permite ajustar cualquier parámetro hasta el más mínimo detalle mediante la consola del juego.A nivel narrativo no es muy destacable, pero se agradece que termine cerrando incógnitas que se originaron desde DOOM 3, aparte de agregar mucho al lore y dar una faceta más humana al Doom Slayer.El multijugador es peor que en la entrega anterior, no es malo pero es un paso atrás.Lo más destacable es que el juego sigue recibiendo contenido, tanto gratuito cómo expansiones de paga, es de agradecer que las mejoras no se reserven únicamente a quienes pagan una cantidad extra para adquirir la expansión, que también vale mucho la pena.

One of my favorite games of all time. After completing Eternal Doom 2016 feels slow and easy. I finished the game + DLC on Nightmare diff but for the first playthrough I recommend going for Ultra-Violence which is challenging but forgiving, very balanced. Performance was great, even on my 6 y rig, visuals are amazing, sound design is just the best. Doom Guy is like a super hero in this game and you can see that right away in the opening cinematic. Environments are rich and unique. Modders have already made a lot of fun mods like horde mode. Developers support the game and it's obvious they are passionate about Doom. GOTY for me.

I'm going to preface this by saying, I've played the OG Dooms. They were one of the first games I ever had the experience of playing. So when 2016 dropped, followed by Eternal, I was ecstatic. On release day, I installed, beat & 100% the Campaign in one weekend; because that's how much I love the Doom franchise. As for Battlemode, I honestly never played or plan to play it. To me, Doom is about the Campaign, not the Multiplayer; even 2016's. Campaign is amazing, and while the now more challenging or arcadey aspects will turn some away; it's just as good as 2016. If not, better.
Very good! Love the Gameplay, the Story and the visuals. 10/10 would recommend

I have never had this much fun with a shooter. The story is beautiful nonsense that serves as a brainless vehicle behind the bombastic levels and I just love it for that. The gameplay has had more toys and mobility options thrown in that can make it feel a little overwhelming. Yet, once you have mastered the flamethrower, double jump, bar swing and weapon mods it becomes a delicious dance of buckshot and demon blood. Ultimately, this game is all about having fun and it just absolutely nails it. The issue that some may find is that it takes nothing seriously, so if you try to find some deeper meaning from the story or any form of nuance beyond the arcadey action, you'll come away dissappointed. Yet, for anyone going into this expecting the refined run-and-gun action of a pureblood Doom game, that is precisely what you will find.

Doom bu sefer çıtayı baya yükseğe koydu oynadığım en başarılı fps shooter oyunu oyun size her türlü imkanı ve çeşitliliği sunuyor ve siz bu çeşitlilik pazarından hepsini istediğiniz gibi özgürce kullanabiliyorsunuz ayrıca aksiyon sürekli diri ve canlı araya güzel parkurlar ve minik puzzellarda eklemişler oyuna farklılık katmış ve gayet keyifli olmuş oyunu oynayacak arkadaşlara tavsiyem normalde oynasınlar bir altı çok kolay geliyor bir üstü'de çok zor hatta normal zorluk bile sizi baya zorluyor onun dışında bölüm ve düşmanların dizaynı güzel vuruş hissiyatı vs bunların oyunun tavan yaptığı noktalar oyunun eksilerine gelirsem bazı güçlü silahların mermisi nı bulmak zor o yüzden keyfini çıkara çıkara hunrarca kullanamıyorsunuz önemli yerlere saklıyorsunuz bu biraz can sıkıcı durum ayrıca oyunda bize gönderdiği bosslardan 2 tanesini oyunun sonralarına doğru normal savaşlarda göndermesi baya bir sinir bozucu özellikle bir tanesi varki tam kanser bir tip baya can sıkıyor sürekli karşılaşmak bir süre sona baya bir sinir bozuyor hikaye nasıl derseniz bu oyunu hikaye için oynamadım ara sahnelerin coğunu dinlemedim bile çünkü doom hikayesi ile ön plana çıkan bir oyun değil ama ben hikaye ye de önem veriyorum derseniz önceki oyunu da oynayıp bu oyunda bulduğunuz notları okursanız hikaye ye hakim olursunuz bütün bu yazından sonra son söyleyeceğim doom kesinlikle oynamanız gereken bir oyun indirime vs düşerse kaçırmayın.

Disclaimer: I have played this game on PC and I highly recommend to use a Keyboard/Mouse over a controller to get the most out of this game. A extremely polished, optimized game that gives you an adrenaline rush like no other. This game is an improvement over its predecessor in every way. They made the combat more strategic and you have to utilize all your guns to get through the enemies. As good a game as 2016 was, I can't see myself going back to it after playing this. This is classic old school gaming at its finest: action packed, intense and unforgiving. Remember when you could get your a** kicked in games for not preparing? When you could die in a 15 minute boss fight after dealing off 95% of its health? When you got the full game and no added microtransactions? Yeah, that's Doom Eternal. I am a fan of this ID team and I'm looking forward to see how they plan to top this masterpiece!
graphics are amazing. runs faster than me when I see a cockroach at 3 am. rip and tear is peak quality.

column1: COVID-19 is temporary but DOOM is Eternal!

Review: This is truly a Renaissance for classic arena shooters, beefed up and roided to modernize it, and the Id team does the original a service once again. I needn't even mention Mick Gordon's part in creating this game, because the soundtrack outmatches 2016's in almost every way. The gameplay relies a lot more on movement and is a lot less forgiving if you're a stationary target. The collectibles system is also improved upon since 2016, giving you cheats and a lot more things to have fun with. Bosses are a lot more fun that just "strafe and shoot".All in all, would recommend if you're a fan of older arena style shooters, this game's developers truly respect the originals.

Awesome game. They kept most of the mechanics of Doom 2016, but refined them, and now it depends even more of our strategy as gamers. You have to be careful about your ammo and use all of our resources as smart as possible. Also the dificulty of the game has been enhanced and the platforms parts has been placed in the right zones. Simply perfect.

And the end was a little weaker than the end of DOOM 2016. For me is DOOM Eternal best shooter game of 2020.

Doom Eternal - 2020 - Play Time: 17 hours A blood soaked action packed adrenaline rushed sequel to Doom (2016) and it delivers and all aspects. Combat feels more intense and punishing if you stop moving. A constant game of chaining together kills, switching weapons to hit specific weak points on demons, and using your chunk machine chainsaw to replenish ammo. The ability for this game to give you a power rush but at the same time make you feel helpless is a outstanding piece of work. Hats off to the team behind this game and all the effort they poured into it.My single compliant with the game lies with the story. Yes, why nick pick when the game is such a hit? Because if you have a story, it has to be fluid. Regardless of how polished and excellent everything else is. The game fails to explain how we got from Doom 2016 to Doom Eternal. At first I thought maybe I perhaps missed it in one of the lore books (After collecting them all and reading them), So I went to the internet. Nothing. No explanation as to the time skip, how we managed to snag a badass ship fortress? Some say it will be addressed in  a future DLC but I think that is vile practice for game development. Positives:+Boss Fights+Tough yet fun combat+Mods for Weapons Negatives:-Lack of story between games

The game is very interesting in gameplay, it now has lore, beautiful cutscenes, amazing music by Mick Gordon, and what I liked about it the most is that it has unexpected twists in difficulty, that sometimes blow your mind, especially when you have no idea how to beat the next stage of the game, but after some time you figure it out. Urt is very interesting to complete challenges and find secrets, dome of which are very well hidden.

Great fun, lets face it - we're not here for the story. It's fairly hollow and bland. But i'm not buying DOOM for a deep narrative, im buying it for the fantastic FPS and gutsplosions that make you sweat into the early hours. Fantastic and addictive.

Gameplay is the reason to play this game. It feels smooth and fun as though it were an arcade game. The story is almost non existent besides killing demons. A must play if you are a fan of 1st person shooters

Level design, soundtrack, gunplay, replayability - everything is just outstanding. 2016 was nowhere near as good as Eternal. New Doom even has a hub! For a full experience play it on Nightmare (especially if you're on PC) - sure it'll be tough until you learn controls, but in the end you won't regret investing some time!

Everyone is talking about DOOM 2016Let me tell you that game is trash.All you have to do in that game is......shoot.No weakpoints, nothing!Oh and it is full of glitchesI once gut stuck in the FLOOR and I diedThen I saw a demon get stuck in the wallI did not even like the music thereThat game is dead.It makes you feel like YOU are the prey in that game, not the demonsIn DOOM Eternal you kill demons without even realizing it!We are talking about DOOM Eternal here, not DOOM 2016

I was really considering giving this game a 9 because of my personal preferences, however, I decided not to. This game is, I kid you not, probably the best game I've ever played, apart from Halo 3 or Dark Souls. First of all, the game play. The game play is ABSOLUTELY the best part of this game. In the 2016 DooM, the plasma rifle and the rocket launcher felt sort of... Just unlikable to me. Not in DooM Eternal, though! In DooM Eternal every single gun, every single weapon feels amazing to use. The Combat Shotgun at the start of the game is a lot weaker than the one in 2016, where you could shoot an imp in the foot and he would stagger, in this game you're required to get actual good shots on the demons, usually it's just a chest shot and a foot shot for a stagger, but that's 2 shots, out of like 15 shots at the start of the game. I'll skip most of the other weapons and just say that they are WAY weaker than their versions in DooM 2016, however I believe that's a good thing, as it makes you rely on your chainsaw a lot more, which is back again with some of the most satisfying and best kill animations in the game. There are of course, other weapons. The first other weapon you'll get is the grenade, which, unlike in DooM 2016, is far more required. The other weapon is the freeze grenade, this just freezes demon and I honestly just like it a lot. One of the last weapons you get is the Crucible, I love this thing. I love how rare the... Ammo? For it is, and how powerful, quick and strong it is. You've probably noticed a theme in this review of gameplay, which is that the ammo is a lot more scarce and guns are worse in terms of damage, which I think is a good thing. This isn't like DooM 2016, where the game gives you a power fantasy, in DooM Eternal, you earn the power fantasy. DooM Eternal is a lot more difficult, requiring better aim, precision and reflexes and it requires you to switch weapons in order to survive, and I've noticed that A LOT of people hate that, and I can see their point, but I personally love it. This isn't an easy game, it's very difficult, if you don't like that, then don't get it. Next, the enemies in the game. They're just amazing, but I mainly want to talk about the Marauder, because he has caused a lot of controversy, but I will TRY to explain why I think he's one of, if not the best demon in DooM Eternal. First, lets talk about his move set, it seems easy to learn, but it's super hard to master. He has a close range shotgun, a middle range attack that flashes green for a bit, and a long range axe swing. One thing that a lot of people don't notice, is that he doesn't just use his flashing attack at mid range, he uses it after he becomes an Olympic runner and runs up to you. He can do that at any range, mid range is simply the most likely. He is the enemy that effectively turns the game into a horror game when you turn around and see him. Also, something a lot of people don't seem to do, is attack after you do a partial stagger after his flashing attack, see, if you successfully hit him with something like a shotgun, he goes back for a second, this lets you use a variety of attacks, a sticky bomb, grenade launcher, but I like to use the Ballista. So, to deal double damage to him, hit him with a super shotgun, then quickly follow with a Ballista. Next, the story.Just don't. I'll admit this game tries way harder than DooM 2016 with the story, but it sort of fails. But while it did fail, why are you playing DooM for the story? This is a man who says "Rip and tear your guts! You are huge! That means you have huge guts! RIP AND TEAR!" If you don't like the story, hold down R. Next, the graphics.This game has stunning graphics, and it runs very well, too. Although it is kind of annoying that the texture filtering is apparently so detrimental to the game, I mean, I've never had it above like the second highest setting, and this is on a RTX 2060 on 2560x1440. To summarize, graphics are very good. Finally, I have to address many of the games complaints. 1st, the guns. This game does NOT force you to use any guns, you have a choice, use the effective weapon, or the one that's ineffective. This is something called difficulty and challenge. If you don't want that, and want to use the shotgun for every single enemy, even the Doom Hunters, good luck. This isn't an easy game, for gods sake, stop thinking it is, if you want it to be, turn the difficulty down! 2nd, the platforming. Oh boy... Why do people hate it?! It's great, there's honestly not much of it, especially not in the later levels, and even though there is quite a few of them at the start, it's fun!  3rd, the puzzles. I'll agree with this claim, I don't really like them. They're easy, however they are quick, easy and honestly more of a nuisance. To conclude, this game is not easy, especially on harder difficulties. This game is hard, the end. Also, I'm angry punches are useless. BTW the music is so amazing!
One of the most dinamic game which will be very high appreciated by hardcore shooter lover like me.

OK, before all the naysayers come out of the woodwork.. I have one thing to say. Stop complaining about "waa, waa, waa, mommy paid for the video game and the graphics arent good" because these have to be some of the best graphics I've ever seen in a video game. Go back to the original doom and compare it to this and you will see that this game's graphics have time and hard work behind them and a HUGE team. The game is a 10 because its just great, end of story. I see people complaining about games because of x,y,and z. Well if yall didnt complain so much you would see that you're complaining is actually causing wars between gaming companies and whats regulating the pricing quotas of all games. This is a big box game, and that's what you are getting, the game is a stellar experience. I've heard some say that it's not scary, I want my money back.. It's not scary because you are a big boy now and grow the **** up it's not the same time as you played the original. It's an experience in of itself. So grow up, buckle your boot straps and settle in for an amazing adventure. XoXDeXoX

I really enjoyed doom 2016  and I was extremely excited for doom eternal. It did not disappoint. It was fun from starting the first level to the final boss fight. If you just wanted to have mindless fun. This isn't for you. It requires to change your strategy if the way you are playing isn't work. It forces to become better.  The ammo management is a very good design choice in my opinion. It changes it up from doom 2016 where you almost never needed to think about ammo, That's the main thing going for this game. You need to fully think about your approach to it. You need to be open to facing difficulty. The marauder is good example. He was difficult my first time fighting him. But once I realized I can't just go in and expecting to pump several double barrel shotgun shoots in his face I got through it.  Instead of pumping a few shots in the mancubus with the double barrel like the doom 2016. It's smart to first freeze him, use the sticky bombs to disable his flame thrower and then pump several shots into him. It's way more fun to traverse around the arena. Such as the yellow pipes you can use it to move around and then use the meat hook to grapple your way to an imp and then proceed to use the chainsaw. I also generally believe it the level design is way better than doom 2016. Overall an extremely fun entry into the series. I would totally recommend.

The game runs extremely smooth with none frame drops or lag. I found myself not really thinking when playing though many people complain you have to constantly think. After playing the campaign completely there was almost no bugs except the full-auto shotgun mod crashing the game. It gives a challenge when you have to get ammo, health and armor pretty frequently. Battlemode works well but it should get better matchmaking.

Best Doom game ever! absolute improvement over Doom 2016, graphics are beatiful, gameplay is so smooth it will make you go oooooo,you have to think how to approach every enemy so you don't get cornered, you have to know how to use every weapon, every ability and upgrades. The UI looks awesome too a mix of classic and modern. I got the game just when it came out and beat it on nightmare (if you want it to feel like a Doom game, play it on nightmare).
Doom is a great fun explosive experience. Some of the level design is a tad questionable but when it rocks, IT ROCKS HARD.

Best shooter ever. The parkour system and the collectibles are very good. The graphics and optimization are awesome. Just one thing is bad and thi one is the game is too long. I am very bored last 3 hours. But other things are very good.

Overall, Doom Eternal is very satisfying to play. There are a few blemishes, such as moving slabs when you're platforming and purple goo that is just there to cripple your movement but, on the whole, moving around in the heat of battle can be very rhythmic and heart pumping. One thing the game definitely improves over Doom 2016 is the aesthetic. Doom 2016 wasn't terrible, by any means, but a lot of the environments leaned on the generic side, especially the Hell levels. Doom Eternal, by contrast, cranks up the insanity factor which makes it seem closer to the Classic Dooms that were made to be abstract and goofy. The plot probably won't win any writing awards, but it serves the purpose well enough and it was interesting to hear what the Doom Slayer actually sounds like. VEGA is always a delight to listen to, and you can always skip most of the cutscenes if you really want to just get into the action. The little nods and winks to Classic Dooms, including being able to play Dooms 1 and 2 on the Slayer's retro PC, were also very nice touches. Overall, a surprisingly nice upgrade over Doom 2016, even if it doesn't always hit every mark perfectly.

DOOM eternal is a brave sequel that improves the gameplay core a lot, although it is aesthetically worse and indulges in some okay mechanics like the platform puzzles . While it isn't bad, it feels like it slows the motion or cuts the flow. I expected the game to be longer too, the ending was quite disappointing. On top of all, i got performance issues and technical problems many times.BattleMode is good and has potential, even if there's no more than one mode to be played .Update: after the technical problemas are over, i feel less biased to give it a score, and i think a 7 was too harsh.This game's gameplay is way better than 2016's. Even if i'm partial to 2016's visuals aesthetically, Eternal is basically 2016 for thinking men. If you go and decide to explore deeply the mechanics and the nooks and crannies of the game, you will realize how much of a improvement it is. After you do that, the true Doom Eternal shows its face. Best part of the whole game: Slayer gates. Just an amazing action experience. I still expected a bit more, like more master levels, for example

Favorite Thing: Great, fast-paced combat and an interesting enough story to keep me going.Least Favorite Thing: The Marauders, by far. "Let's take our fast paced game and slow it down by making an enemy where you have to stand still in just the right place". Brilliant. Playtime: ~ 15hDate Completed: 2020-04-09Enjoyment: 8/10Recommendation: If you like shooters, it's better than most. If you don't like shooters, it's still worth a try.
Best Doom game to date by far. I've played and beaten almost all of them. Its a fact.
This game is pretty good. Doom (2016) may be good but this game is even better.
If you liked Doom, Doom Eternal is an improvement on the formula, really enjoying this game as a sequel.

Good old fast-paced shooter,with a.... story line?It confused me at first too,but it's actually not bad.Combat makes you think a bit more unlike the previous game,like how you use your resourcesMore violent than Doom 2016 , but the thing is , we don't have a lots of  berserk quad damage and things like that like in the first one,we can't be "OP"Which makes it more fun on nightmare difficulty

I can recomend this game to dinamic shooter fans,ive completed this game at the Ultra-Violence difficilttyand the game will not give you a break in fights with demons.In my opinion this is the best FPS game that i ever played and i can give a few cons: the narrative not always explains you about in-game events for example:Who is DoomGuy?Who is Kahn Maykr?Who is Betrayer?But i can read it all about them in the codex(collecteble items),the second cons that i can add is one stupid enemy named Marauder,if i are playing on nightmare difficultty this **** will apper in your nighmares but i will not spoil why i think this **** is not well balanced.
After beating the game on the Ultra-violence difficulty, I would recommend the game. It has great gameplay, a good story. It is really fun playing this game.

Es increíble el como está saga dejo un estándar en los FPS y su regreso en su Reboot de 2016 trajo tanto de lo que extrañabamos de ella, DOOM Eternal toma el combate y la visceralidad de su entrega pasada para retocarla y agregar nuevas mecánicas, algunas como el plataformimg y el diseño de niveles está bastante decente pero aún así carece de pulimiento y no agradan nada a la formula, mientras el combate, loop de juego y si incluso historia han mejorado más que nunca totalmente uno de los mdevlas

Gameplay and Music save this game. Definitely worth picking up though, dont get me wrong. The story was supposed to be the focal point but, while present, it still somehow manages to take a back seat. It's led a cast of forgettable characters that show up, expound, and disappear. Other than one moment in particular, you don't learn much about the canon. The platforming is fine enough to break up the combat, but gets too Mario 64 for its own good sometimes. The visual style of the game is way too arcade-y, and completely lost the grittiness of Doom 2016. The combat mechanics are good and make each encounter its own puzzle to figure out. But they gutted their multiplayer completely just to introduce a new mode, which currently is the only multiplayer mode available. No reason to cut out death match, this is Doom. Replayability is a bit low because of this. The content in the Fortress of Doom also is only accessible through there, giving you very little reason to 100% the game.  The whole Fortress of Doom is awful tbh. The Marauder also could have been implemented better. A very challenging boss encounter, but every encounter after that he slows combat to a crawl. Mick Gordon kills it though, this is 100% soundtrack of the year
DOOM Eternal manages to pull off 2 things.

column1: 1. Being the kind of game that schools are describing to parents.
2. Being the most video gamey game out there.

Good game. Play on ultra violence or nightmare for the full experience. 8/10 because some areas are more annoying than fun AND because they force you to make a Bethesda account even when playing offline. Classic Bethesda.

Review: Way too "arcady" in comparison to 2016, Throws way too many things at you to juggle at once, over-the-top "bad-ass power-fantasy" story, NEVERTHELESS - It is still damn addicting entertaining game with a serviceable full of fan-service Easter eggs filled story. It probably is not as good 2016, but at the same time it probably is more fun than 2016.
It's extraordinarily optimized, and the difficulty has been intensified compared the first instalment. The only downsides are the constant jumping and the cartoonish graphics.
amaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaazing

First let me say that Doom Eternal is a great game. But it's also not perfect. Doom Eternal is less a first person shooter and more of a twitch combat platformer. The game feels fun to play but it's not a shooter and while it "feels" like a DOOM game it doesn't play like one. The guns all feel good and have cool modifications. However the game was over tweaked. The enemies you fight all have a "weakness" to a specific gun or gun modification. However some modifications were unintentionally hampered or made irrelevant by certain game play designs. The biggest one being ammo starvation. Doom Eternal's biggest problem is that it says it's a shooter but starves you of ammunition requiring you to do things other then shooting. They did this to create incentives to using the chainsaw. In Doom 2016 I saved the chainsaw gas for very large troublesome enemies so I conserved ammunition for the hordes of hell. In Doom Eternal the devs have create the perverse incentive to use the chainsaw because it's the only way to reliably get ammunition for your guns. Glory kills on weak enemies no longer reward ammunition but only health which on the higher difficulties is also a necessity. This makes the game much faster paced but also changes the game to be less of a first person shooter. So far quite a few of my friends have expressed regret at buying the game or have returned it. I enjoy it but I can definitely see where they're coming from. My biggest regret is how hyped I became for the regular shotgun rotating auto mod that makes it a chain gun with shotgun shells. This seems amazing however with ammo scarcity it renders the mod useless as you burn through your ammo in a few seconds. The same can be said for other mods like the plasma rifles beam mod. It requires you to hold it onto an enemy in order to blow them up. The problem is it slows you down and will likely get you killed. This is what we mean by over tweaking or as other reviewers have put it over engineering. And finally the plot. This game is a continuation of Doom 2016 but the inherent problem is it skips some much needed plot. How did we the Doom Slayer get to where we are in Doom Eternal from the end of Doom 2016? Otherwise the games god some heaven/hell plot with the concept of balance and corruption. The biggest thing the game has going for it is the big plot twist regarding the slayer (for spoilers sake I won't go into detail) however the cost for this plot is a level that's "entirely on the rails" that doesn't really engage you. Doom Eternal is definitely a good game, possibly even great. But it's not quite a "Doom" game.

The overall gameplay was fun. The flow of combat, level design and difficulty was perfect for a doom game. If you liked the previous game, you will enjoy this one just as well. The only complaint i can dig up if i really nitpick is... you can sometimes get buried under a horde of demons and get stuck unable to move. But as Dark Souls players would say "git gud" and it won't happen too often. The soundtrack once again, amazing. I've never been more awake playing a video game. Story wise... well that's where it kinda falls apart.Doomguy 2016 was a badass on a quest for revenge after his heart and soul were shattered.Doomguy 2020 is a mindless psychopath killing **** just because.something tells me the original writer didn't take part in making this game.Doom was never about story, but i always prefer games with stories because they allow me to see the world through the character's eyes. Feel what they feel. Use their motivation as my own.So if you're going to do a story, you better **** do it right.I started this game with the motivation of "i was betrayed, time to kill **** and ended it with "unga bunga, me smash, you go boom boom". The only motivation i had for finishing this game was the compulsion to do a 100% run.A little disappointed that the fan theories and previously set Lore was all just... blood punched out of existence and all that remains is this new doomguy that i really can't relate with nor do i want to.
confusing, i wouldn't able to figure out the story. previous was straighter

I can only really complain about... 3 aspects of the game. Everything else, brilliant, even as I was being stupid about a "puzzle". 1st aspect of the game, I didn't really enjoy the 5 purple goo portions. Everywhere else you're free to run about as fast as you'd like. It just felt like an arbitrary addition to the game, but as it was only a handful of sections, it's okay. Just... It didn't feel right. 2nd aspect, the Kahn Maykr fight was... not as epic as it should've felt. The arena's getting flooded with fire and enemies are shooting at you, and that's fine, but the music falls short. It's intense, but it's action horror intense rather than the bloodpumping music that plays during combat encounters. I guess it applies to the final boss as well, but it fitted more there. 3rd aspect... Marauders... Hot damn, those **** are unnecessarily tough. Getting too close and you get a face full of shotgun. Getting too far away and you get a face full of axe. Shooting them leads to your shots ricocheting off their shield, and they have a spectral dog that has a wonky hit animation that somehow manages to bite me in the ass 9/10 times. They have what feels like 2 seconds of opportunity where you can get some damage in, but doing not enough damage means it's back to dodging and weaving. Getting a Glory Kill on these bastardised demons FEELS great, though, and those Glory Kills make you feel like you're in the mind of the Slayer himself. For some reason people are complaining about short ammo capacity. You get a Chainsaw before you burn through your starting 16 shotgun shells, and it's on recharge, meaning it's always there when you need it to fill your ammo reserves. If you somehow manage to run out of ammo before getting the Chainsaw and not being able to progress because of it... Please tell me how you managed that.

This game is awesome. Lots of fun! I enjoyed everything about this game until...... Urdak happened. Urdak is the second to last level of the game. I seriously was in awe of how much fun this game was, I was enjoying it so much until this level happened. Urdak brought my fun to a screeching stop. It went from this fast paced fps with occasional platforming, to a gimmicky platforming game with some fighting and it also brought in new enemies that added to my frustrations. There was a specific jump section that killed me multiple times, not because I wasn't good enough but because it was horribly designed. Finally when I thought I was done with the level, it had the lamest boss fight to add to the crappy level. Seriously this level took all my joy for the game away, it made me just want to be done with game, and it ruined the final level for me The final level was actually really cool but I was so mad at that point. Urdak cost this game 2 points. This game was easily a 10/10 but that level ruined the final act of the game. Still having said all that hate, I still enjoyed 90% of this game. Definitely worth a playthrough.

The game was fantastic, however I felt that compared to Doom (2016) there were less glory kills while the berserker power up is active. The campaign was incredible, the Fortress of Doom was a great place to view your collection. Ammo runs out too quickly until you get to the third stage of the sentinel crystal upgrades, recharging chainsaw ammo was a cool feature. The Battlemode was a bit underwhelming, however it was a huge step up from Doom (2016)'s multiplayer.

Game was decent, well made game for sure. Great action FPS. Various weapons and many customization. However, very unfriendly game UI. Also u have to die because you have no bullet! And you died until your precious life were completely gone! If this happened to you, you had to quit it and then started from checkpoint. Which you never know if you didn't play Doom before. Great game for Doom/FPS lover. But painful game to casual player. Tortured myself to finish it. Game is 4 out of 5. Personal enjoyment is 0 out of 5. Total is 4.

Going 0/10 you can not go adding potential system breaking DRM/Anti-Cheat kerrnel level software to a game two months after release. Also why the **** do we need anti cheat software for single player. Competitive multiplayer i could understand.Two months after the game's release, a surprise mandatory update has been released that requires you to install Denuvo anti-cheat to play, even if you are only going to play single-player. This software runs at a hardware level and exposes your system to security risks.If you are running a Linux OS it will brick your game, if you running a Mac with a virtual windows OS it will brick your game. It has an adverse affect performance for many PCs.You will need to link you steam account to Bethesda launcher account which is a steaming pile of fetid garbage. As many others have said the game overall feels far less fluid and fun then the 2016 release, for a shooter you sure do a lot of melee. It feels bloated with gimmicks.Bishy's review is pretty spot on for game play.
Game itself was originally a 6-7.

column1: They pulled a bait and switch however and with yesterdays update added Denuvo Anti-Cheat which requires a kernel mode driver that causes system instability and massive slowdowns. It also runs during singleplayer.

Review: Aside from the graphics from 10 years ago the kernel based anti cheat that basically now allows them to take over and track everything you do on your pc is such a invasion of privacy. Bethesda has to be the worst company when it comes to making sound decisions.....
Cool, I love some BLASTING action! crazy levels and monsters, but this is insane!

Doom EternalGreat and greatly overratedDoom Eternal features 2 modes, an online competitive mode where a demon slayer is heavily unfairly matched with infinitely spawning player controlled demons that just isn’t really fun unless you’re on the demon side, so imam just throw that mode away and focus on the reason everyone is buying doom eternal.. its hefty 17 hour long demon filled campaign, and this campaign is really great… here you play as a demon slayer, taking on zombies and demons on earth as well as mars, going through a fairly linear campaign, but one filled with traversal and platforming, which is a very welcomed change.. however I feel this new addition takes a back seat to the straight up demon slaying, which on paper sounds fine, but ultimately it leads to an incohesive feeling world that feels like a bunch of random video game elements stapled together.. and this is Doom Eternals biggest issue…. Nothing feels purposeful, it feels mindless and repetitive from start to finish, none of the levels are memorable, the combat is constant, never giving you a chance to breathe or explore, it’s a headache… playing through doom eternal is an enjoyable headache.. but still a headache…combat that time around is much more enjoyable though. Enemies having their weaknesses, making almost every battle feel like a puzzle despite feeling mindless at the same time, rarely leading to frustrating encounters.. but don’t get me wrong.. those encounters do exist.. though rare.. theres one over powered enemy specifically that kills all and any fun youll be having with this game in an instant… more specifically in one area of the  game where youre trapped with him and a snake enemy, and no ammo or health really around… which brings me to another gripe I have with doom eternal, its health and ammo situation… ammo health and armor really feel nonexistent in doom eternals world, instead the game relies on you using your abilities to obtain armour and health, you can catch enemies on fire and freeze them, you have chainsaw enemies for ammo… but I just feel like id much rather have ammo drops after killing enemies than forced to find a small one I can chainsaw..wait for that chainsaw to refuel and do it again… the chainsaw system in general is a nonsensical mess… you can store up to 3 chainsaw attacks, however there is no enemy you can kill with 2 fuels… so whats the point… theres 1 and theres 3… and then you have enemies later on that cant be attacked with the chainsaw at all because theyre too big… these enemies should be reserved for 3.. and the middle large enemies killed with 2.. it just leads to fuel hording, and the payoff is never worth it.. but that can be said for this games weapons as well, youre given amazing weapons towards the end of the game, but rarely any fuel to use them, which begs me to ask.. why even give them to me in the first place.. especially the sword… this item didn’t come into play and was basically unusable until the final boss… but if this was that weapons only purpose, I suppose that’s okay… but I feel if that is the case you should’ve just waited longer to give it to me… All in all I do feel Doom Eternal is a great game, its fun zombie slaying to heavy metal, theres a crazy amount of weapons, and different ways to upgrade these weapons, customize them to your gameplay… but just don’t believe the hype… go into doom eternal expecting a great game and not an amazing game or a masterpiece and you surely wont be disappointed…But if you go in expecting game of the year, youre going to get smacked with level design and gameplay that feels plucked out of the old god of war games with guns stapled to itI give Doom Eternalan 8/10

Denuvo anti-cheat. I loved the game, I won't install Denuvo anti-cheat and I can't play single player as a result. This installs without notice onto your machine with kernel level access, it can update at any time without notice, perform changes without notice, and intercept/collect data without notice. It's' a major security breach waiting to happen, and you're placing your trust in Denuvo to not "snoop" on your computer. No thanks

After the first update, the game requires Denuvo Anti Cheat installed right by your system kernel, even if you want to play the campaign. If you uninstall the anti cheat, Bethesda launcher will attempt to install ir every time you run the game. The hilarious part, is that Doom 2016's MP was rampant with cheaters and neither Bethesda or Id did care about it.

Great game, but honestly I liked 2016 more.While the combat is better, harder and more complex, the level design is worse.Honestly I didn't mind the jumping sections, but because of them the level design is far more linear and half of the secrets are so easy to find.In 2016 you had 13 levels and in 12 of them were challenges. In Eternal there are also 13 levels, but only 9 have challenges. The levels here are longer, which is both good and bad thing. On one hand you have more content, but on the other I felt it should have been 2 levels shorter, because it started to get really repetitive.The bosses are great, except Marauder. Screw him.I didn't play multiplayer cause i don't play multiplayer games, but its kinda shame that there isn't snapmap mode. 8,5/10

The game is pretty good but also dissapointing but still not that bad. It has issues and everything has already been said like ammo capacity, weak points, some enemies and boss fights. Also the platforming isnt as bad as other people say its just unnecessary and boring but it take like 1 minute and its the easiest platforming ever so you dont even know its there.

Compared to the previos Doom game I think this is a big step up. The levels all feel unique and are very well designed with exploration being really rewarding. There is a lot of mechanics to master here, and it takes time, but when you learn the flow of combat it is really rewarding. The performance is also flawlessly running at 60 fps in 4k with maxed out settings. The main thing that drags down the experience is that there are quite a few fights that are brutally unforgiving even on the easiest difficulty, clearly they had some inexperienced designers working on this project. I also would have wanted a bit more story through cutscenes and the like instead of through wall-of-text-logs that I can't be bothered to read.

It's a fantastic game with a very addictive gameplay loop and a powerful soundtrack to go with it. I would say that it's a 200% improvement over DOOM 2016's gameplay loop. It has set the standard for future DOOM titles. If I had to give this game a definitive score right away, it would be a 10/10 based on the gameplay and Mick Gordon's excellent soundtrack. The main campaign's story is okay. There are some big reveals, unnecessary retcons from 2016, and unexplained time-skips. And frustratingly, there is no explanation whatsoever to bridge the gaps either. So we can only hope Id Software feels compelled to share with us how the Doom Slayer got to where he is at the start of this game. With that said, let me elaborate on the things I didn't like about this game. Let's start with the visual direction of DOOM Eternal, which I don't like. It's not on the same level as DOOM 2016, which had a refreshingly gritty and cinematic feel to it. Every level in 2016 had its own unique lighting in different areas of the level. It felt handcrafted and organic. In comparison, DOOM Eternal feels very inorganic and bland with the monotone global illumination setting for the entire map, across all levels. Some of the interior lighting looks good, but it doesn't measure up to DOOM 2016. And it doesn't matter if you play it on ULTRA NIGHTMARE graphical settings because the global illumination methods used in this game make everything look bright and saturated. Fortunately, it can be mitigated by downloading the 'Doom Eternal DeLighter' mod from Nexusmods. However, the lighting itself isn't as beautiful as DOOM 2016's, which means the result is still disappointing, if slightly less. The weird 8-bit platforming in this game is excessive and immersion breaking. The Cultist Base level has some of the most nonsensical 8-bit platforming I've seen to date. It feels like something 10-year-old children would enjoy. It's the same with gore kills as well. They feel more cartoonish than brutal. I heard Hugo Martin decided to go this route so that his children can play the game. Fair enough, I suppose. It's just not for me. "Attack only when their eyes glow green" enemies and bosses in this game are a cheap gimmick passed off as "well-designed enemies requiring your immediate attention." No, they're cheap gimmicks and nothing more. It's not about the difficulty, it's about the enemy design. If the Marauder is a "well-designed" enemy, why can't we use the Marauder's shield ability in the Multiplayer mode? Because it is stupidly imbalanced, and Id Software couldn't justify its use in multiplayer. My final rating for this game is 7.5/10. I didn't like it as much as I thought I would. DOOM 2016 was a more satisfying experience for me. DOOM Eternal's gameplay and Mick Gordon's new soundtrack are fantastic, but for every two steps forward they've also taken a step back.

Great game all around with various fun mechanics which you can choose to enhance during the game and with every time I fail I feel like I learned something. Completing these challenge gates also feel really amazing making the game really rewarding.
