Игра дико затянутая и надоедающая в конце настолько, что хочется уже побыстрее просто пробежать все эти тестные и однообразные арены до очередной хреновой вставки.Постоянная нехватка патронов и дебильнейшая механика их добывания с помощью бензопилы. Мобы с идиотическими механиками их убийств(надеюсь в реальном аду нет этого урода с зелёным глазом). Неинтересные боссы с дурацкими и сложными способами их убийств. И всё это справлено каким то дичайшим сюжетом, в котором даже сам властитель ада сломает голову и тоннами бредового текста - спасибо, что сделали из шутера, который по заветам Кармака должен быть лучше порнухи, унылый, однообразный, многочасовой отстой!

The game runs incredible well and looks the part. Unfortunately I thought the 2016 Doom was better, I wasn't a fan of the constant ammo shortage and movement focus. While I get what they are going for id rather just shoot demons and shut my brain off for a few sessions. Using the chainsaw and glory kills just gets annoying after a while. The soundtrack on the other hand was just awesome, the heavy metal electric guitar riffs pump you up and you get into a kind of trance like state while running around the map.

This isn't a sequel to DOOM 2016. If it wasn't called DOOM, then it wouldn't get a bad review. They should of called it Single Player MOBA Boomer Shooter: Wait for Cool-downs and farm trash mobs. I'm serious: the most important part of this game is farming weak monsters for health, ammo and armour. They infused the razor sharp core DOOM game-play, of: dodge, shoot and murder, with pointless accounting. Every single mechanic that was added to this game that wasn't already there in DOOM 2016 is basically cool-down dependent tedium that just gets in the way. This is like DOOM 2016 if the DOOM slayer had to periodically take a break from killing a mancubus to do his taxes, take a piss, flame then chainsaw imp for ammo and armor, punch a random zombie for health, and then go back and do a bit more damage to the mancubus before running out of ammo. And then having to repeating the tedium all over again. The DOOM slayer can't just feed the ugly bastard a steady stream a missiles until it pops, like the in the good old days. No. First, shoot the fist guns, on each hand, because those are the first 2 "weak spots", then you can finish it off. Do it any other way and you run out of ammo, because all other parts of the body, other than the arbitrary weak spot, take almost no damage before the weak spot "check-boxes" are ticked off. This applies to all "big" monsters. DOOM 2016 gave you a problem, a box of tools, and then let you decide how to best murder everything. DOOM Eternal gives you a problem, a rusted, barely functional, set of tools, and a very rigid and convoluted procedure to follow. Try and use the tools any other way than for the intended "problem" (weak spot) and you realise your weapons are actually dollar-store water guns that shoot piss and glowing dog turds. There had to be better ways of raising the skill ceiling of the game without the boring MOBA cool-downs, and redundant rock-paper-scissors.

OMG WTF!? Doom Reboot was fun enough in the gameplay department. Doom 3/BFG had a solid atmosphere. The simplistic nature of all the previous DooMs' was why they are fun. Eternal has got no fun factor or atmosphere. Melee kill a demon/creature and it explodes like cartoon pinata. I want blood, I want guts, not cutey colored lights ffs. Eternal basically came across as Quake on x2 speed. Ammo was low so ammo soft locking was problem. It was a chore to play, had no atmosphere, zero feeling of being a bad ass like 2016 Reboot.  Plus the DooM Guy aka regular joe is now some epic Master Chief character the DooM Slayer. Oh no CoD type story cutscenes BS. Thanfully 2016 kept that crap to minumn and told the lore in optional text. Yeah it looks ok and runs at solid 60 FPS.  Came across as nothing special. This reminds me like mobile game setup, whoa.

I do not consider justified this score, the game is terribly difficult, very bad restored the difficulty.Whoever accents of torturing himself its a good game to add. Also, the game is very crowded, full of unnecessary things, even weaker than doom 2016.

I really wanted to like this game. I only played it for about 90 minutes and returned it so maybe it gets better later on. There were a significant number of jumping puzzles and with a double jump and double dash it got stupid fast. Having to figure out how to double jump to a platform that drops into lava in one second and then in that 1 second find the next spot to jump too oh too late you hit the lava. Do all that jumping **** again. I played up until I got to a level where literally I did like 30 minutes of jumping puzzles. I wanted to quit but couldn't because i wasn't sure if it was going to save what checkpoint I was at and force me to restart the stupid jumping puzzle heavy level. I cannot emphasize how much I **** hated the jumping and dashing puzzels. On top of that instead of bringing in new colors and environments it's "hell on earth" so instead of being new and exciting it's the same dumb browns and reds because they brought hell to earth. Such a dumb design decision. Weapons feel under powered and are not satisfying and you carry a hilariously small amount of ammo for each one. I paid like $96 for the game with the year one stuff and honestly I'd probably never play this game again the jumping and dashing puzzles annoyed me so much.

I can't say I enjoyed it, I loved Doom 2016, bui this one seems to be more about puzzle, jumping and finding a way to progress further, with which I had no problem in previous Doom. I died more because of falling down than in combat.

You have to learn how this Game wants you to play it, but when you into those Mechanics, it is really a great Game.Also you're getting some old school Level Design and many Details.The Engine is running great. Edit:I sadly have to lower my Rating from 9 to 7.The DLCs are bad, they feel like a 90s third Party Expansion Pack that doesn't understand what makes the Game Fun.The Encounters are lacking Balance.Also the Blood Maykr and the Cursed Prowler, they are just annoying, taking the Speed out of the Game.

This isnt Doom. Period.And no, this isnt about the DRM drama.I wasnt a big fan of the last Doom either, but at least it was playable and still felt like a shooter. I played the other Doom games thousands of hours, even competitively.But this game is completely built around 3 mechanics that are not very shooter-like: The Chainsaw, Glory Kills and Platforming/finding secrets.It is so annoying and stupid that it destroys the whole game as a shooter. You literally have to chainsaw and glorykill your way through hordes of monsters and the whole game. You cant even use your weapons properly because they run out of ammo all the time. And so you always have to use the chainsaw and be bored of the not very diverse killing animations very quickly. Even after my first 5 kills I was already getting bored of this mechanic. Then you get a few bullets for maybe one or 2 kills, and then you gotta chainsaw again. And so on. Again and again. Ridiculously boring.And then of course Glory Kills. You gotta do them to stay alive because you get health back when you kill a monster, or you sometimes have to kill them with a glorykill to kill them quicker (because everyone knows that a fist to the face is much more powerful than a few bullets in said face). They are as boring as the chainsaw. But you gotta do them. Just like chainsaw kills. Youre forced to.Makes sense, doesnt it? No?Well then youre like me, and your game must at least make a little sense. Killing a monster with your weapons and not getting ammo from it... fine. But then killing it with the chainsaw and ammo literally (!!!) pops out of it like from a pinata?Yeeeeaaaahhh... no thanks.Lets get to the other gameplay then. Weapons can be upgraded. That sounds good and is actually fun. But as I said, you cant enjoy it for long because you run out of ammo all the time.And then theres the sounds of the weapons. All Doom games (except the last one, where it was similar like here) and even other shooters have the weapons dominate the game sound. Naturally weapons like those would be very loud, and thus sound very powerful. In some games I got goosebumps from only the weapon sounds alone. But here? They sound like toy guns. Their sounds are ridiculous and extremely low. Which brings me to the other sounds... or rather music:Extremely annoying comes to mind. I mean there are a few good tracks, but they dont last long. Most of the time you hear some weird ass scratching and screeching that is neither ambiance nor music. Its just annoying as hell! No pun intended. Platforming. Right. When youre not busy glorykilling and chainsawing away, while letting one or two bullets fly in between, you have to jump from one platform to the next and look for secrets. As simple as it is boring and annoying. Because secrets give you points that you then spend for upgrades. And btw, those upgrades are also ridiculous, because your character is overly artificially weak at the start because hes missing them. You literally feel much weaker than in the last games. For a long time. For example you maximum health is very low at the beginning and and can only carry extremely little ammo (16 shotgun shells and 60 bullets, for example). Finding those secrets sometimes gets really annoying when you spot a way to a secret (or another part of the map), but then discover that its not the real intended way and to make sure you dont use it, its blocked by a.... you guessed it, invisible wall. Happens quite often if you like to explore (which you have to if you want to find the secrets). Thats just pathetic for a modern game. The controls also feel very weird. Possibly because Bethesda decided to add something called "mouse sensitivity scaling". At first I thought its something like mouse acceleration, but when you turn it to 0.1 (the lowest), then you wont turn at all anymore. Must really be some form of sensitivity scaling, which really doesnt make any sense, because anything else than 1:1 on a shooter like that (or any game) is just stupid. But they dont make it in such an easy to understand scaling (1:1), they use decimals that dont make sense. You also have some citadel floating in space where you store your found secrets (easter eggs) and buy upgrades for your character.Thats all it does. Yet you can still get lost in it.Nothing impressed me there, because Ive been playing the old Doom games on and off on more modern engines, and see and hear everything they showcase there anytime I want without having to find it in some level. Ive been very disappointed by Bethesda games in the last few years. But this one pretty much seals it for me: I wont ever buy one of their games again, unless, for some reason, I am 100% sure that its a good game. And looking at their track record, I highly doubt that will ever happen again. Because for some reason enough people condone this raping of good old IPs and soulless gameplay. Not only in games, but also in series and movies.

Doom Eternal is criminally fun. This fast-paced FPS gives you so many new interesting weapons and gadgets that it can almost feel overwhelming. Even though Doom Eternal gives you so many new bells and whistles it still felt challenging at times as enemies took a lot of damage to kill(I did play on ultra-violence difficulty so that could be why), but you still feel like your doing a lot of damage because peace's of the demons flesh will fall off them which makes you feel incredibly powerful without making the game easy. This game has an interesting story that I didn't care too much about. What really kept me coming back was the gameplay. This game improves on Doom 2016 in so many ways. If you liked Doom 2016 you'll absolutely love Doom Eternal.

If the 2016 Doom was a retelling of the original Doom, then this one would be a retelling of Doom 2, since the former took place on Mars and the latter took place on Earth. I struggled with coming up with a score for this one, because there are things I really love about it and things I really hate. What I love -- it looks great and sounds great, and it's fun to just blast the hell out of everything. What I hate -- There are too many spots in this game where you have to rely on a serious of fancy jumps, and if you miss, you might have to go back and do all the other ones again because apparently the game developers thought that gamers were saying, "You know what I really hate?  Being able to save my game whenever I want to!"  Which also gets frustrating when you get to a point where a seemingly endless wave of enemies keeps coming at you.  A challenge is one thing, but there were a few spots where I was stuck for more than was enjoyable because I was running around, killing everything, trying not to get hit, for what seemed like an eternity, only to get killed and have to go back to the beginning because again, no save option.  I know the 2016 didn't let you save either, but I don't remember ever getting stuck in the same spot for too long.  I actually gave up on some of the side challenges on this one because I got frustrated after awhile and just wanted to move on. As I do with most games, I start out with what I perceive as the "medium" setting.  I think if I decide to play through this one again, I might try the easiest one. As with the previous game, there isn't much of a storyline.  Not saying that's a bad thing, just personal preferences.  Maybe  a little more of a storyline than the originals, but not as much of one as Doom 3.

Your ammo depletes fast and you have to switch weapons constantly to survive. Even though it's a dynamic shooter, the game constantly encourages you to move from place to place in order to stay alive and kill all these demons. I'd say the game did not fulfill my expectations. The whole new platform-like movement system is just too absurd for a shooter game and that's why I'm giving it only 6. The previous game was better since it focused on one thing that counts in such games: SHOOTING.

Contrary to initial impressions, DOOM Eternal is not an action game; it is a puzzle game. Where a casual observer might watch high-level gameplay and only see the flurry of bullets and cacaphony of targets whizzing by the screen, the player sees a totally different picture. Instead of just seeing targets, they see priorities. Instead of just dodging, they're thinking about the order of their actions, which resources to manage, how to most effectively keep them up, when to engage, when to run, and who to kill first. Every encounter is like a new puzzle to solve. Every arena consists of two categories of enemies; fodder, and heavies. Fodder enemies, typically imps, soldiers, and gargyoles, are hardly threats. They have small health pools, make little effort to dodge your attacks, and generally go down in a few small-arms shots. However, they serve a different purpose; they are easy prey to use your various resource-management abilities on. Use a glory kill on one to get health back, use a chainsaw to get ammo, or use the flame belch to get armor. Because these enemies are quick to kill, respawn indefinitely, and pose little threat, they exist not as targets, but as resource nodes to fall back on after running your guns dry, or getting low on health and armor. No; in a given arena, the real threat are the heavies. The heavies and super heavies are the real center of an arena. Unlike fodder, they have much larger health pools, more mobility, and generally much more dangerous attacks. The doomslayer's priority on entering any arena is killing the heavies as fast as possible. Doing so is not always so cut and dry; each heavy usually has a unique weakness or strategy to exploit, with which the doomslayer must respond to accordingly: cacodemons can be made to swallow a sticky bomb with precise timing, staggering them instantly; the hell knight has a particular weakness to the chaingun, making him falter more than any other weapon; and the most contentious enemy of all, the marauder, must be fought one-on-one in a very particular manner, countering his attacks and staying at a specific range. Taking all of this into account while fighting the heavies, as well as considering your ammo, health, and armor, and where the nearest fodder enemies are should you need to temporarily retreat and restock, makes up the bulk of the game's combat loop. Mess up once on nightmare, and you're a dead doomslayer. That's not to say you don't need a good base in FPS skill to play this game well; actually hitting your targets is just as important as knowing which targets to shoot. That skill floor might put off some less experienced fps players. But if you think you can handle it, the challenge DOOM Eternal presents is well worth it.

Ripping and tearing through demons in DOOM Eternal is a great time! The mix of platforming and combat is extremely well done, and I enjoy it a lot! The soundtrack gets you perfectly into the mood for wrenching off the heads of demons and punching through walls, and the overall sound design does a great job overall.

If you like feeling like a complete and udder badass making demons cry at the mere mention of your name, then get this game. However, one thing i must add is even though the game offers a very good challenge on its hardest difficulty, once you beat it you are basically done with the game. Its a one and done type of game however offers a very good experience.
EPIC GAME!

column1: Very fast paced and aggressive combat. It is also very tactical. I highly recommend

Review: Even if you've finished Doom 2016, Doom Eternal forces you to learn everything again, and make use of every tool in your disposal. You have to make use of your chainsaw, glory kill, and flame belch; DO NOT stay still, and switch weapons effectively.It might be a bit of hardcore at the beginning, but once you get the flow of the game, it's all become seamless. Hands down, this is the most fun FPS I've played... ever!

If you like fast paced shooters that give you incredible feelings of flow, then look no further than Doom Eternal!If you're not used to shooters, it can seem a little crazy at times but it is so worth getting used too! Def one of my top games of the last year!

Gone is the chaotic randomized onslaught of the previous Doom title. This games drills you hard in asset management, weapon and mod switching, and harvesting lesser demons for the resource you need at the moment. It may seem tedious or hard to learn at first, but once you get it, the game becomes easy flowing and immensely rewarding. Instead of the mindless shoot-them-all of the old days, you get a game of tactical, prioritized, laser focused elimination. This long time gamer is happy to see that three decades since their first FPS, id can still deliver an experience that feels fresh. The key to not becoming an old dog is looking forward to new tricks.
What did you do id software after this game I can not imagine myself playing DOOM 2016. This game is so good thanks for it.

10/10 DOOM Eternal takes everything that made DOOM (2016) great and enhances every aspect of it. I have been playing through the DLC's on nightmare and it is absolutely brutal. The difficulty is intense and fast paced and your controls and mechanics all synergize so perfectly to keep you alive and slaying no matter what obstacle you are facing. The base game is fantastic with a lot of secrets and parkour puzzles as well as the normal demon dismembering chaos. For gods sake you get ammo back by using a chainsaw on your enemies.. how can you get more badass than that? The soundtrack is one of the best I have ever heard from any piece of entertainment whether it be a video game/movie/tv show ect. I can not recommend enough, I am almost done with the first DLC and I cant wait to finish the second!

Doom Eternal is all around good. It has great enemy design, weapons, pacing, music and level design. It a game that embraces creativity. You find what weapons and combos work best for you. It a really fun action shooter.

Quick Rating: 10/10 Full Thoughts:Doom Eternal is the best feeling and designed first person shooter that I have probably ever played. The combat has immense depth to it while maintaining the simplicity of move and shoot. The combat of the game has taken everything about what made Doom 2016 a fantastic game and ramped it up to 11. No longer do you simply sprint around the battlefield and arbitrarily shoot demons until they die but not each weapon has a unique purpose in efficiently dealing with a specific demon. Id has turned the fast paced action and turned it into a unique puzzle that you most likely wont find in another game. The game has so much depth and fantastic replayability. The multiplayer isnt fantastic but is a fun unique arena shooter experience in its own right. I have completed the base game with defeating all 6 slayer gates and completed both DLC's. I have gotten nothing but euphoria from this game and each challenge is difficult and thrilling. What Holds the Game Back:This is not a casual game at all. If you are looking for something that you can sit back and not really pay attention to this game is not for you. Additionally, the game is very unforgiving on its difficulty you will not complete this game without putting a good amount of focus and effort into. You have to learn the combat systems and learn how to move, shoot, and glorykill very efficiently. Closing Remarks:A perfect score does not mean a perfect game. My scoring of a 10/10 reflects that this game is the shining gold standard of its genre. In the future I will compare almost every shooter I play to Doom Eternal. This game sets the bar high for what can be achieved in first person shooters in our day and age and I'm very excited for what Id will cook up now that they are finished with the story of the slayer.

Review: I hear a lot of people call Doom Eternal inflexible, and I don't think that's very fair or accurate, how flexible it is really depends on your pride and your ability to utilize the options that are laid out before you. The first time I played through Doom Eternal, I picked Ultra Violence because I thought "yeah I've played Doom before and that's the best Doom difficulty". I also turned off tutorials because from a YouTube review I heard they were frequent and annoying, and I had played so many id software games in the past I was confident in my ability to just pick it up and play it. I eventually turned the tutorials back on when I got my ass kicked by the Arachnotron for the 5th time without realizing the turret was a weak point. I didn't wanna miss out on any info like that again, and while I'd say my experience with the game was decently fun after that, I still felt like I was missing something, and like the game wasn't clicking with me. I liked the over the top story and bombastic level design that was much more dynamic and varied than Doom 2016, but in terms of combat I always felt like I was a few steps out of pace with Doom Eternal on my first playthrough. I think this is mostly due to the fact that the Ultra Violence difficulty is rather unforgiving, and that's not a bad thing, it's just rather demoralizing for beginners at the game who need to learn the mechanics. It's hard to learn those mechanics when you're constantly on edge and constantly at risk of dying due to the fact one wrong move can entirely throw you off, and considering Ultra Violence is most people's go to Doom difficulty I can see how so many people tried it and were instantly turned off, thinking there was something wrong with the game. Personally, my biggest problem was I found myself using a lot of the same abilities and weapons to do everything. Everytime I saw a weak point I'd use the heavy cannon scope and only the heavy cannon scope to take it out, never using the sticky bombs, heat blast, ballista, etc. I wouldn't use a lot of the new abilities like the blood punch, ice bombs, grenades, etc. It was too overwhelming to think about in the middle of the incredibly heated battles. The things is Doom Eternal is flexible enough to let you play it this way, you can beat it but it's not very fun to do so. But still, I managed to struggle through the game on my first playthrough, constantly on edge and never learning anything, by the time I beat it, I was glad I had but I didn't feel very accomplished. In fact I felt kind of demoralized. I leaned later that my greatest mistake was never lowering the difficulty and giving myself more room to breathe. When I finally played the game again a year later, I finally chose Hurt Me Plenty on the difficulty settings because my pride in playing that difficulty had definitely been shattered by that point and I just didn't give a ♥♥♥♥ anymore, wasn't like anyone could see me. The thing is Hurt Me Plenty in classic Doom was pitiful, there were way less enemies making levels feel rather empty which leads to it generally being shunned across all Doom game's by the community, but what a lot of people don't know is Hurt Me Plenty in Doom Eternal is just a normal difficulty in any other game, it's the exact same enemy count and placements, just with less damage output and a little bit less punishment for not reacting fast enough. When I finally chose HMP, I finally had that room to breathe and it allowed me to get more creative with my playstyle, and just like that the game finally clicked with me. I started using Doomguy's entire arsenal, and learned how to utilize Doom Eternal's mechanics in satisfying ways that made me feel smart for figuring them out, it fully immersed me in it's combat puzzle. When I came back to the Ultra Violence difficulty, despite playing on an easier difficulty earlier, I had learned enough from that more easygoing mode that I was finally good at the game, and I managed to beat it in one go in Extra Lives mode, and while it was no Ultra Nightmare playthrough, it's one of the most satisfying experiences I've had in a video game. So my recommendation to new players is turn that difficulty down, use those cheat codes, do anything that makes the experience more fun and easygoing and your playstyle will begin to show itself naturally, don't force yourself to go in hard due to pride, this is a very different game than any FPS out there and you just gotta have fun with it. When you do that and fully utilize the options it gives you to tweak the game to your experience, it's not only not inflexible, it's one of the most flexible and fun experiences you can have with an FPS game. id Software knocked it out of the park. As I type this I am currently playing through my first Nightmare playthrough and I can officially say I'm addicted now.

Well, after 100 hours of playtime and beating everything on Ultra-Nightmare, I can with confidence say that this is the best FPS I have ever played. The combat loop they started working on in 2016 has now been expanded upon and fully mastered, with every weapon and mod having some sort of use. Weak points, flame belch, ice bomb, grenades, blood punch, all the weapons and mods; it all combines into a chaotic whirlwind of enjoyment, especially when you actually get good at the game. That's not to mention the wide variety of demons, each with their own quirks that spice up the gameplay in their own way, and each having specific things to target in order to take them out faster, which further encourages getting even more in-depth with the game's systems. Even the platforming adds to the experience: teaching you how to better use movement during combat while at the same time giving you a nice break between arenas. This is a big change from 2016, where you simply walked between areas, taking an elevator here and there, and it's a change I greatly welcome.

Jsem rád, že jsem hrál hru na Bethesda Launcheru, protože se zde nepíše playtime. Do této hry jsem se tak trochu zamiloval, pořídil jsem si sběratelskou edici, podložku pod myš, kachničky do vany, klíčenky, sběratelské figurky, nechávám si vytvořit sochu ze 3D tisku, mám herní tričko, keramické podtácky a hru dohranou na Ultra Nightmare, dohrané DLC a jediné co nemám a co mě dokáže nakrknout je Jirkův Argentas Paladi, za které je Sentinel podium, které mám glitchnuté. Objevil jsem nové mody - takže jsem si konečně mohl zahrát se skiny ze starších eventů, které jsem promeškal. Podobné nadšení jsem prožíval se Zombie Army 4 Dead War. This game will demand effort from you, but even an FPS noob can get into the Fun Zone and feel the rush of ripping and tearing.

This is my favorite game! The gameplay is fast paced and have a lot of emphasis on movement. All enemies and weapons are very well designed and fits into the combat loop nicely. You need to have good situational awareness and plan your attack within a few seconds of entering an arena, and good ammo management is very important or else you will be running out of ammo a lot. One really big improvement from DOOM-2016 is falling off an edge no longer instantly kills you, it just removes a bit of your health so it makes the parkour much more enjoyable.

There is absolutely nothing like this game. Absolutely a 10/10 and a candidate for game of the year. The gameplay is absolutely flawless, and it makes you feel incredible as you move through perfectly made maps at superhuman speeds with powerful and unique weapons. Nothing can describe the satisfaction you get when you chainsaw a demonic soldier in half, rip out a Cacodemons eyeball and watch it explode, or grab an imp by the eye sockets and tear it in half with your bare hands. You can play this game for hours and only scratch the surface of the amount of glory kills and unique gore you can see. And you do it all while feeling completely in control of the fight as the Doom Slayer, an unbelievably powerful demigod with incredibly efficient demon-killing abilities. If you haven’t bought this game or played it, do it now. I promise you it is 100% worth it.

So as someone who absolutely loves Shooters and especially Competitive ones that challenge you to be fully focused and improve in what you are doing... this Game is just for you!Are you tired and sick of having to rely on teammates in Competitive Shooters to get the most out of your fun?Then play this game, you will have the same Level of Challenge but you rely on nobody but yourself. As for the Music of this Game, one could say you buy an album and the Game comes as a Bonus! Story could be argued about, but it is all a matter of preference, to me it is a sweet addition to a Game that does not even need a Story. What can i say, just buy this Game, you will not regret it! My Personal Game of the Century, i have never enjoyed a Game this much!

Worthy sequel to Doom 2016. Improves on just about everything that made the first game great, but the added complexity causes some issues. There is a bit of a disconnect between the speed of the game and how many options you have at any given point, especially as the game progresses. You have so many tools at your disposal, and so many resources to manage that it can slow you down. This can hurt the flow of the game play, but it's still a blast to play if you can get in the groove. None of these issues are major problems, as the core of the game, the moment to moment gun play and the level exploration, are superb. Overall a fantastic game, one of the best FPS games to come out in a long time, highly recommended.

Truly the renaissance of a franchise. DOOM 2016 was the beginning, but DOOM Eternal sealed the success of the franchise with fast paced gameplay, quick reflex learning, great graphics... As a FPS gamer I had to relearn how to move, shoot and control the arena. Also the difficulty gives you a solid challenge for veteran gamers (aside from part 1... My god...). Overall Must have for FPS gamers out there !!
I wasn't a fan of the previous Doom game but this one is surprised me how fun it was.

As I'm reaching 300 hrs played after a year with the game, I think I can comfortably say this is my favorite game of all time. Everything is this game is so finely tuned to give you the best FPS experience you've ever had. The movement is this game is phenomenal and advanced movement tech makes you really feel like an unstoppable being for pure DOOM. Game also has a great community with some awesome content creators.
Okay this game is a masterpiece! Level variety on point, graphics are amazing, game runs smooth and gameplay is almost perfect.
I love this game. Just one to gush about this. Shooting demons in the game is soo fun. The ping sound of popping weak points is soo satisfying :)
Yes i recommend this game its fun and it makes you feel like a god and its hard.
A really fast action shooter game and is really fun overall. Movement is really fast and fun.

These addons for DOOM are HARD AF! Definitely play the first campaign on harder levels before even attempting this! If you are up for a challenge, though... this right here is LEGIT. It's very fast paced and will get you holding your breath at tense moments and your heart rate up. I can't even play this game unless I am well rested! Definitely worth it across the board.

One of the best game I have ever played. The combat is skill based and satisfying, and the flow of the combat is incredibly good. DOOM Eternal is a refreshing break from all the modern fps games that are all just more of the same. The music is fantastic and easily the best of any game I've ever played. I would recommend DOOM Eternal to anyone who plays video games, and even some people that don't.
The thing i love most about this game is everything. The best installation of DOOM since DOOM II.

This game reprogrammed my brain to the point where I can no longer play any shooter that expects me to stand still for more than five seconds. There is so much verticality, so much polish, so much fun with the game in the GAME. This game is a masterpiece, end of discussion.

I am really impressed by how good this game is. It is worth of all the praised its received, and they have a killer formula to move forward with. The battles are intense and exciting; I was constantly on the edge of my seat. Even better than Doom 2016, which I thought was great at the time.

The best shooter I've played. Ever. While Doom (2016) made you feel unstoppable, Eternal made you work for it. Mastering Eternal is an experience like no other. The level design is fantastic, the gunplay is even better, and the new challenges you get make it all the more satisfying when you beat the final boss. The difficulty is much higher in this game, as you have much less ammo, enemies hit you like a truck, and there are a lot of new enemies to keep track of. If you're new to Doom/Shooters in general, I recommend setting the difficulty on Hurt Me Plenty. (I beat it on Nightmare on my first playthrough cuz I'm just that good) The Movement is a gift from god. You got double jump instantly, dashes, climbing, swinging on monke bars, the Meat-Hook, ect. It feels so good to zip through the map while blasting demons to dust. The only thing I can criticize is that the final boss's first phase is kinda annoying, and that's about it. The game reviews who said this game wasn't as good as 2016 just didn't care enough to try and get better. This is one of the best games I've ever played, and will continue playing in the future. There is so much to this game that makes it great that I haven't even talked about. Just get the game 11/10
Damn good game. I'll be playing through it again. The soundtrack is perfect. Fast paced and non-stop action.
John Wick but it's demons that killed his bunny. Cutting the heads off evil cultist priests.
What can I say about this crazy game lol. Never played a game soo fasted paced.

This game is like, as the title says, eternal. whenever I feel stressed I come right back to this game to work the stress off. 10/10 recommend.

This game definitely gives the Doom series a flair of its own - the light resource management combined with the relatively demanding gameplay distinguish Doom Eternal from other shooters in the market. The gameplay is crisp, and the engine is very well optimized. ID really is trying to set a new bar for smooth FPS gameplay and it shows.
The combat loop is so good and when you master the quick swapping it is so rewarding but if you do not like quick swapping there is other alternatives also.
Best FPS to come out in recent years. The story/lore is quite good too, and completely optional if you'd like to just kill demons. 10/10
Love this game. Great if you like Doom. Game 10/10 would and tear again and again.

The game is one of the most polished titles I have in my game library. It just works so well, incredibly optimized and has lots for you to customize (the HUD for me). Last year on my first play-through I was a bit disappointed, I had too much hype! Playing through again with an open mind it really is a fun game that plays amazing. I paid full price when it came out but now the game already goes to 50% discount often and that is completely worth the price to play if you are on the fence. The story is wack in a good way, just enjoy all the pretty colors and intense action!

They turned a mindless shooter into something that requires brain power. Every weapon has a purpose and every enemy has a weakness. No clue how they are going to top this one. But they already topped Doom 2016, so you never know... This is some of Ids best work.
Imagine a big man jacked man in green armor suit jumping around like a monkey slaughtering demons. 100/100.

I'll definitely be buying the dlc for it in order to keep on slaying demons!

The music constantly keeps you in tune with every shot you fire. If you haven't played this game yet then something is definitely wrong with you.

Challenging but fun game, tests reflexes and tests your skill. Fun to play, but not too easy, you can toy around with weapons, codes, Armour, almost everything, it feels fresh. So many challenges and fun things to do in this game, I really like it a lot. The story is amazing, the multiplayer is pretty good and the overall game play is just astonishing.

One of the best FPS ever created. High skill ceiling. High replayability. Next step in the genre. Checkout @UnderTheMayo on youtube, amongst others, for becoming a badass demon slayer. Doom Eternal improves the combat system that was setup in Doom 2016 to a new level. Additions like Flame Belch, SSG Meathook, the Dash, Ice Bomb and other additions make this game a step up from Doom 2016. However the game itself is more challenging because it requires more skill from the player, which could be a good thing or a bad thing depending on the player. Doom Eternal forces you to consider managing your resources for things like ammo, because weapon ammo capacity has been reduced from 2016. I personally think this is a good thing and I welcome the changes and the increase of difficulty. It requires me and other players to think about how they play the game. It helps keep the player engaged with the combat loop. I find the gameplay addicting and fun. I recommend old Doom players alike to try out this newest game in the franchise and new players to try out Doom 2016 first and then play Eternal.

NOW THIS IS FAST PACED ACTION! The movement system feels finished and the weapons act in a complimentary manner that encourages combo attacks and accuracy. This game will FORCE you to play well through disincentivizeing using singular weapons and rewarding swapping weapons and using the right tool for the job. Use of every gadget available is also encouraged, giving much needed health, armor, and ammo. The lore is there, but its not neccessary to understand it to play the game.
Almost beat it and I can say its an amazing, challenging, and badass experience. Buy it!
Dude this game is a master class. I love it soo much. Popping heads with scope is soo good.

Review: This game is absurdly good. I only played on Nightmare mode (the most challenging) and it was frustrating at first but when you learn the rhythm of combat and unlock the full arsenal this a a true masterclass in First-Person-Shooters. Never have I felt like such a God in game while also having my heart race. Cannot recommend this enough. Play on easy difficulties for some mindless fun or harder difficulties to challenge yourself and experience the game the way it is meant to be played. The platforming is a welcome addition and the Devs clearly use it to show off their incredible level design and the beautiful graphics. Rip and tear baby!
DOOM Eternal is a good game. In fact, a great game, absolutely incredible! Wow!

Un crime absolu qu'il n'a pas gagné en prix réels. C'est la première fois depuis Super Mario 64 qu'un jeu me semble parfait Le gameplay est difficile car c'est l'enfer sur Terre. Pourtant, bien qu'il s'agisse d'un Exultia d'une tâche dans laquelle de nombreux développeurs ont échoué, le combat des cultistes de Doom (Hunter Base) Eternal est toujours un Super Gore Nest amusant. L'histoire est étonnamment complexe (ARC) dans son noyau (Mars) sans jamais s'éloigner de vos désirs (Sentinel) Prime pour tuer les démons L'atmosphère dans des endroits comme Taras Nabad ou Nekravol est époustouflante, en grande partie grâce aux excellentes compositions de Mick Gordon . avec des chansons comme Meathook, The Betrayer, Cultist Base, Super Gore Nest, The Only Thing They Fear Is You, Gladiator, Urdak et plus t devrait être un péché (final) pour qu'un jeu soit aussi parfait.
Doom is one of the best games to let my pain out and actually makes me feel like my dad's belt isn't that bad
DOOM Eternal is perhaps the best game. The best first person shooter game. Rip and tear.

Incredibly fun and huge replay value when it comes to figuring out new moves, combos, and other mechanics. Enjoyed the movement mechanics and the huge trial and error moments I faced during the game. You can't just go in making dumb decisions, you have to mentally plan it out and know what you're doing and execute it well. Very enjoyable!
I would recommend doom eternal but in my opinion it isnt hectic enough. Jokes aside one of the greatest's FPS of all time.
The biggest improvement on the single player fps since the original doom. This game is great.
Definitely good for taking your anger out on. If you have a little prick who bullies everyone and you can't do anything about it, just pretend he's a hell knight and squish him.

In terms of game play loops, this is the best single person shooter I have ever played. There's just something about riding a flaming meat hook toward a demon to brush their teeth with a double-barrel shotgun that makes me come back for more. If you like shooters at all, this game is a must.

Arguably the best game mechanics of all time. 10/10. Very rarely a few bugs pop up which is annoying on UN. Other than that Hugo is dad.

The gameplay is fast, requires you to be aggressive and to use all the tools the game gives you to survive. I was afraid that all the new weapons and gadgets would make the game too easy when compared to Doom 2016 but that is not the case. This game is obscene amounts of fun.

Прошел всю игру, но вот относительно ожиданий и относительно Doom (2016) больше все-таки разочарован. Да, графика шикарная, да, хорошая оптимизация/fps, но:1. Страшно переборщили с впихиванием похоже всех механик, которые только придумали - в итоге вместо шутера получается какая-то real-time стреляющая стратега с постоянным задействованием кучи не стреляющих/отвлекающих механик - добывание боеприпасов бензопилой, здоровья рукопашной, брони огнем, и т.п. + все это надо постоянно помнить и использовать (может кроме брони)2. Очень аркадное изображения всего - цветастые боеприпасы, мигающие разноцветными огнями монстры - вообщем какой-то супер марио, а не брутальный Doom3. Перебор с платформер-механиками - просто как кузнечик прыгаешь пол игры. Опять просто супер-марио, а не Doom.4. Бои - месиво, на экране каша - очень много монстров со всех сторон, в итоге все время бегаешь как сумасшедший. Не сконцентрироваться нормально на каком-то поединке хотя бы даже с группой монстров, все равно сзади кто-нибудь по мелкому или крупному мочит - уровни специально так сделаны как мультиплейерные.5. Еще раз - для шутера - переборщили со всем, что мешает наслаждаться боем - лутом боеприпасов, и здоровья (отвлекающим от боя), платформер прыжками, аркадным оформлением, кашей на экране от количества монстров и т.п.В итоге дополнение Ancient Gods покупать не буду.

Holy **** ****. What a good ******* game. DOOM Eternal has the best gameplay of any game I've played. This game deserves so much more than an 8.7 score. Eternal is without a doubt in my mind, the best fps ever made. There is so much depth to the combat its utterly unbelievable. Play this goddamn game.
Anything I could say here has already been said about this game. Just try it.
It's amazing, best 60 dollars I ever spent on a game. The soundtrack is amazing, The combat and mechanics can be combined to do some cool while making you look like a god.

Doom Eternal es como un viaje emocionante del que nunca querrás irte.¿Por qué los jugadores pasan cientos de horas en un FPS de campaña para un jugador de 15 a 20 horas? Bueno, es divertido y nunca se vuelve rancio. Hay muchos juegos buenos que después de terminar la campaña principal, no hay mucho a lo que volver ... seguro que puedes jugar ese juego en un año para que se sienta fresco nuevamente, pero a menudo puede desencadenar eso. sentirse aburrido que puede hacer que deje de fumar y busque otra cosa que hacer. Doom Eternal nunca te hace sentir aburrido o desinteresado,

This is a truly awesome game. I wasn't even that invested in DOOM when I first pre-ordered it (mainly just wanted the revenant doot skin), but playing this game made me a believer. The gunplay, the fast pace action, the platforming, the soundtrack, how the gore and violence actually has a method and use behind them (finisher = health + blood punch, chainsaw = more ammo, flamethrower = more armor) and the soundtrack behind it all constantly fueling and invigorating the player through their ripping and tearing. And even after the main story, you still have the amazingly unique multiplayer and DLC to dig into.
Pure enjoyment! No politics! NO ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥! Just slay some fing demons :D LOVE IT!

Prvo, ova igra ne nudi mnogo istraživanja, poput ostalih velikih igara otvorenog svijeta. Sve su to linearne razine sa skrivenim tajnama. Postoji priča, ali mislim da Doom Slayer ne zna koja je priča ili da je zapravo čak i briga. Ova igra samo nudi neprekidnu akciju koja vas drži angažiranim u svakom trenutku. Većinu igre zadržava na tom slatkom mjestu zabave, uz male pauze kako se ne biste umarali. Vaše prvo igranje na Hurt Me Plenty bit će teško ako ste novi u Doomu. Umro sam nekoliko puta i gotovo odustao dok nisam pročitao jedan od savjeta na zaslonu za učitavanje "Nastavi se kretati". Shvatio sam da sam krivo igrao igru ​​... ovo nije pucačina u patke i pokrivače. Jednom kad sam to shvatio, zabavljao sam se trčeći, skačući i gađajući sve što se kretalo. Tada sam probao Nightmare nakon što sam prošao kampanju o ultra nasilju i počeo se zabavljati više nego ikad prije. Uspio sam se koristiti puškom za pušku super sačmarice kako bih se njihao, minirao svakog demona svim svojim oružjem (dodijelite svoje oružje vrućim tipkama za brzu zamjenu) i izlazio iz intenzivne borbe u areni osjećajući se uzbuđen zbog navale koju vam ova igra pruža. Demoni su nevjerojatni: naučit ćete sve njihove snage, slabosti itd. I počet ćete se uzbuđivati ​​kad se pojave najjači od njih. Oni će vas angažirati, a vi ćete ih željeti sve više i više.
Its like DOOM, but with MOAAAARRRRR.Haha shotgun go *buhgungg-click clack boom*

column1: Then this game is or you.

Review: How is this so addictive? Could it be the music, killing demons, a combination of both? I don't know but it is a great stress reliever and the highest difficulty while dying over and over again to endlessly combat spawn of hell... And then getting it right at last. Ufffff, the dopamine hit! Try this game. You won't regret it. Highly recommend.

There are times when this game seems to difficult, but then I remember that I chose a higher difficulty, so it's exactly what I asked for.. a challenge. Likewise, when I want less challenge and more easy-going demon killing, reduced difficulty settings doesn't make me feel like a baby.It's a Doom game, you should know what it's all about.. you don't need to concern yourself with story or lore if you don't want to, which is nice.I love this game as a way to vent stress, even though there are time when it may become stressful, but it's almost cathartic in how methodically we can dispatch demons so well in this game.
An amazing game, very fun and addictive. If u play 1 mission u wil lwant more and more and more. its really goood i loved the game so much!!!

Toby Fox (el creador de Undertale) hizo un trabajo increíble al desarrollar una historia tan INTERESANTE y PROFUNDA, así como el juego en sí. Me hace preguntarme: ¿qué hará a continuación? Sea lo que sea, una secuela, un spin-off o un juego completamente diferente, lo comprobaré.

إنه اندفاع الأدرينالين بلا توقف. كما أن لديها نظام تقدم ممتع حقًا في جميع أنحاء القصة. اللعبة الأساسية ممتعة للغاية ويمكن إعادة لعبها. من المحتمل أن يكون توازن الأسلحة والرونية والبلورات المختلفة هو الجزء المفضل لدي في هذه اللعبة. هناك العديد من المجموعات المختلفة التي يمكنك استخدامها بحيث تشعر وكأنها تجربة مختلفة تمامًا عندما تريد إضفاء البهجة على الأشياء قليلاً.

(Written as a player that has completed hurt me plenty and playing nightmare) An amazing action packed thriller that makes you think how to do better when you die. In the beginning you will die. If this game makes its predecessor feel like child's play, then you know they've done something right. Doom Eternal combines combat, mobility, and defense in a way that not only improves on the previous, but creates a totally unique and 'easy to get into, but hard to master' gameplay loop. At no point is the slayer not given every tool he needs to rip and tear. If you're a Doom fan, then do yourself a favour and stop reading this review and start crushing some demon scum to pulp.

This is my favourite fps shooter. The soundtracks puts me in a blood-lust state. Learning to quick swap weapons and use all of my weapons in battle is so satisfying, no game has made me feel this powerful.

Everything about this game has been not only a learning curve for me but also reminded me of why I love video games as I have felt that the industry has been dying for the past 10+ years with all honesty. The sound design is just beyond words every weapon, enemy sounds to the insane soundtrack written by Mick Gordon just sounds so sharp and crisp. The weight of the game is really brought forward through the heaviness in the music and the carnage coinciding with the fast paced gameplay. The mechanics are perfected all around for every situation you can think of, there's always room for the player to adapt, improve and mentally think through every part of the combat. Doom 2016 felt as though it relied a little too heavily on nostalgia while not providing much new innovation, while Doom Eternal here does have some nostalgia it really elevates the genre forward with it's complete overhaul of new additions and changes to the mechanics where the difficulty is really rewarding.

DOOM 4 didn't grab me at first, but this one.  Oh boy.  Even buying the full package for $30, what a godawful experience.  Where's Deathmatch!?  Where's that trademark DOOM music we came to love?  Why do the weapons not feel like they do anything?  The Super Shotgun, hardly a relic from the past, has become a weak, wimpy throaway.  I don't want a hook attached to the damned thing, where's the bullet spread, like in DOOM 2!? This game is an insult to PC Gamers, especially: Visuals:  4/5Sound Design:  2/5Controls:  1/5Fun Factor 1/5

Maybe he is a God. Maybe he represents human kind's rage - their will to persevere, to overcome that which would threaten our survival. He is uncompromising, a relentless being of violence that knows no mention of the hesitation shown by our many leaders and politicians during our time of judgement. Can he overcome them? Alone? If he can't - we, as a species, ALL species, will not survive. The only thing they fear - is him. We watched as the horde overwhelmed the very best and most advanced machinery and weapons technology that we could muster against the opposition. It was useless, they moved too quickly, they cared not for themselves, only sought out the blood of humanity. They were willing to sacrifice their own to get to the heart of our world. We slaughtered thousands and millions more followed, but then he came - he cut through them like a sickle through a field - his fury surpassing their own. He is faster - more relentless. I believe him now to be more than just a man - he is...DOOM.

Best single player FPS I've ever played. This game is incredibly involved, and that will likely be a huge obstacle for first time Doom Eternal players, and it might even enrage them; it did for me. I highly recommend at least keeping visual tutorials on. I personally turned off the tutorials that pull you to the demo room, but many of you might be tempted to turn off all tutorials. Turning off all of the tutorials will likely make every one of your big arena battles absolutely miserable because they throw every enemy, that you're supposed to understand how to fight at that point, at you in a single fight. It is really fun and exciting when you know the enemies weaknesses, because you are firing on all cylinders and using all your tools in the right way. All in all, great visuals, great gameplay, interesting story, 10/10 game in my book.
This is best single player fps that I ever played, and I played a lot.Combat mechanics, lore, music, performance, visuals, level design, its masterpiece 10/10

Fun and family friendly, unless your family worships Satan. I must admit, the extra controls compared to 2016 were a pain to get used to, especially as i am a grade 11 dumb ass with 3 brain cells, but when you get used to it, its a whole new level of fun and saying i love it is an understatement. I learned how to play a speedy game like this from Shadow warrior 2, and that only just helped when it came to teaching the player the type of aggression needed. I will be honest, i did start on easy unlike everyone else, but to be honest, i would recommend it because if you are mentally slow like me, take awhile to learn new play styles, or just want stress relief through shotgun exorcism, it's fine to go easy. Nobody's judging you. As a final note, strangely i got a weird vibe from the boss design that made me think of a lot of styles from past video games, like pre-2013 i think. it was fun to have a game where i didn't have to sneak around or avoid a nuclear rocket powered bullet sponge with a sword the size of Texas. Really helps to feel like a game rather than just dark souls with a shotgun or a political statement.100/5

Playing on the second highest difficulty and game is loads of fun. Great aim trainer, awesome melee kills that I will never get bored of, and a plethora of different weapon types. Doom has always felt more of a "Gamey Game" to me, and Doom Eternal is a huge step up from Doom 2016 in that sense by returning too its roots. While Doom 2016 looked very good and captured its environment perfectly it felt like that's all there was to it, an ambient shooting game with horror aspects, but Doom Eternal fixes that by making the game feel more arcade-y as it used to be.
It's just 20+ hours of absolutely perfected FPS. Don't go in looking for deep character development or an intricate crafting system - all of that would just take away from being a superb FPS.

I remember playing DOOM 2016 when I was younger. Coming back to the DOOM series 5 years later, by playing DOOM Eternal it feels so nostalgic to me, ripping and tearing through demons, I highly recommend this game.

I played this game and had Quake III Arena flashbacks. You can appreciate what id have done here by merging the classic Doom gameplay with it's hundreds of onscreen demons and mixing it with Quake III-esque maps. Then they've tweaked and balanced the weapons and gameplay systems so that each wave will result in a huge number of satisfying chain kills in an extremely fast-paced and violent fashion. The end result? Something absolutely amazing. Visually this game will smash your GPU and produce some amazing visuals. There's a thumping metal soundtrack (if you like that sort of thing), and an incredibly playable and balanced game which lets you play-how-you-like with the huge number of perks you can add to your suit and weapons. It's a great game. No doubt about it.

Compared to DOOM 2016, the combat has definitely been improved and the weapons feel nicer to use. Also, the visuals are absolutely stunning at times. The glory kills are more brutal than 2016, with the addition of a blade as part of the Doomslayer's arsenal and "improved" blood effects. I don't really enjoy that change, but I think the gameplay more than makes up for it. The soundtrack is similar to 2016 but feels a little more diverse and punch-y. Overall this feels like a refined sequel to DOOM 2016. If you like high-intensity skill-based gameplay,

I've only completed the game on the easiest difficulty because I do find it quite challenging. Doom Eternal does such a good job of making everything spectacular. The gunplay? Amazing. The arenas? Always varying and great. The pace? Amazing. Incentive to explore every part of the level? With ammo drops, health/armor pickups, codex entries, collectibles and cheat codes, absolutely. Every level is so incredibly detailed, the scenery beyond the structures you walk around is stunning. Platforming isn't perfect, but I think it provides a little break between big arenas, and helps the flow of the game (this is a pretty controversial thing tho, some people are okay with it, and some people hate it). You can really formulate your own playstyle with the weapon variety and weapon mods that are accessible to you. I found myself switching between 3 different playstyles throughout my playthrough.
Nonstop action. Nonstop intense combat. Nonstop pogging. Nonstop improving. Nonstop slaying. Rip and tear until it is done.

As a child born in late 90s, I've played old iD games (Doom 1993, Doom 2, Quake 2 and Quake 3 Arena). This game is something that made my memories come back. It's fun, gory, fast-paced old school FPS game. Unlike DOOM 2016 it's not that dark atmospheric in-door game, it's more arcady (which I really like). This doesn't mean that I didn't like 2016.Pros: Everything - soundtrack, gameplay, gunplay, jumping sections, YEEThooking, BFG 9k and 10k, resource management via chainsaw, flame belch, glory kills (if you're an ignorant person who doesn't want to adapt to the game and follow it's resource management - don't play it)Cons: The demons killed your bunny, demons die very quickly.

DOOM eternal is seriously a very good sequel (it's hard to find a good sequel these days that surpasses the original ) , it feels like a modern DOOM experience and nails everything that i loved about the originals, Hugh martin as a director really understood what Doom needed in this game and innovated in many ways. The lore is so satisfying and Mick gordon's soundtrack plays with your emotions, the graphics and animations are gorgeous and this sequel really builds upon 2016's DOOM. If you're a fan of any kind of shooter, definitely check this game out.

Doom Eternal es exactamente lo que debe ser: una loca orgía de sangre y violencia, donde los combates son una descarga de adrenalina continua. Pero no es simplemente un mata-mata, sino que cada enemigo tiene sus puntos débiles y estrategias, cada arma sus virtudes y utilidades, de modo que una vez que entras en su flow, es como una especie de extraña coreografía de vísceras y muerte. La historia continua la del Doom 2016 y amplía su universo y trasfondo, dándole una extraña coherencia que es tan over-the-top como todo el resto del juego. Aquí eres el Doom Slayer, lo de los puzzles y tal quedan para otros, aquí no venimos a ser humanos y tener que tener en cuenta cosas como el estress postraumático o las consecuencias de la guerra, esto es pura ira desatada. Y los momentos más tranquilos, sirven para explorar y saltar, coleccionando los numerosos objetos que hay para encontrar en cada mapa. A nivel gráfico el juego es una pasada. No solo en ejecución, que también, sino principalmente a nivel de diseño, con unos enemigos muy carismáticos y bien diferenciados y unas localizaciones y escenarios mucho más variadas de lo que esperaba. La música es una descarga de adrenalina similar a la jugabilidad, haciendo que nos metamos en ese duro universo de violencia y energía y mantegamos el foco en cada enemigo, cada esquiva y movimiento. Los efectos sonoros están bastante bien, igual que el doblaje de las voces. Y, al menos en mi caso, apenas me encontré un par de salidas a escritorio en todo el juego, ningún otro bug. El resultado es, sin duda, que Doom Eternal da lo que promete. Rip and tear! Un 8,5.

En fait, l'un de mes jeux préférés auxquels j'ai jamais joué et il peut encore être amélioré avec de **** changements. Il a certains des combats FPS les plus amusants jamais créés dans un jeu vidéo, il a non seulement une mécanique phénoménale, mais une conception ennemie complexe et une IA pour vraiment tester ces compétences. La direction prise avec l'histoire est bonne, mais peut être améliorée en définissant davantage Doomguy comme un personnage et en rappelant aux gens pourquoi il est un maître chef fou qui veut tuer tous les démons, certains flashbacks font des événements de Doom 1,2 et 64 aideraient et donnerait également plus de répliques à l'acteur sous-estimé de Doomguy pour montrer à quel point il est capricieux. La valeur de rejouabilité de ce jeu n'est pas portée par le contenu post-jeu simplement par la force de la formule principale, je continue de jouer à tous les niveaux de ce jeu et c'est du dlc encore et encore et cela n'est pas encore ennuyeux. Le jeu est non seulement visuellement incroyable, mais aussi incroyablement bien optimisé pour un jeu de génération actuel (la taille du fichier est d'environ 20 Go de moins que le jeu précédent). La bande originale de ce jeu est vraiment emblématique, qu'il s'agisse de pistes de combat ou de morceaux d'ambiance, il n'y a pas un seul mauvais morceau de musique dans ce jeu, et cela vaut également pour la musique dlc. Je me surprends à écouter les morceaux du DLC en dehors du jeu plus que les morceaux originaux.

Doom Eternal is crack cocaine. I cannot recall the last time I ever waited for the night a game came out and waited until I could open it after preloading the game. I then played the game to near completion in one sitting until I nearly passed out from physical exhaustion as the sun crept through my window. After sleeping that night I woke up and immediately turned the game on and finished it; I couldn't get enough of it. I cannot recommend Doom Eternal highly enough; this is one of my favorite first person shooters of all time.

DOOM Eternal had a lot to live up to after DOOM (2016) and it beats it out in almost every way. All gameplay mechanics were taken up a notch from it's predecessor. I wasn't a big fan of the reboot and the idea of a difficult HARDCORE shooter doesn't really excite me as much as most PC gamers. I honestly have no clue what the story was about and have no real interest in reading up on it. With so little in it for me, I'm surprised by how much I loved this game.I feel like the difficulty isn't really difficulty in the punishing sense but urges you to use your entire arsenal at all times, forcing you to constantly switch around weapons and tactics on the fly to exploit every weakness possible. This keeps the game fresh and exciting throughout the campaign. That with the unparalleled sense of mobility, you constantly find yourself in a groove to the heavy metal music while your senses are overloaded. The visual design is colorful and easy to navigate with split second reflexes despite the fact that it's gory demons. The sound design is a hilarious mix of cartoonish sound effects that give to it's charm.In a world of repetitive shooters which all feel like the refinement of the last, this one does something that feels completely different.I won't remember much of the game or the story, but I know that for it's respectable run time, I had constant fun, was challenged but not frustrated, and would recommend this to anyone who is up for something old that feels new.

In the first age, in the first battle, when the shadows first lengthened, one stood. Burned by the embers of Armageddon, his soul blistered by the fires of Hell and tainted beyond ascension, he chose the path of perpetual torment. In his ravenous hatred he found no peace; and with boiling blood he scoured the Umbral Plains seeking vengeance against the dark lords who had wronged him. He wore the crown of the Night Sentinels, and those that tasted the bite of his sword named him... the Doom Slayer.

Ich versuche nach mehr als einem Jahrzehnt Pause wieder zum Spielen zurückzukehren. dachte, ich würde das Schicksal aufgreifen, weil du weißt, dass das ursprüngliche Schicksal ziemlich großartig war, oder? Dieses Spiel hat meine Erwartungen weit übertroffen. Ich mag das Gleichgewicht, das es schafft, Kettensägen-Kills für Munition zu jonglieren, um Kills für die Gesundheit zu erzielen, und Flammen-Burps für Rüstungen. Die absolute Notwendigkeit, das richtige Werkzeug für die Waffenarbeit zu verwenden. Ich mag die Tatsache, dass Blutschläge bestimmte Feinde sofort töten. Ich mag sogar die Tatsache, dass Sie keine speziellen Tastaturkürzel für das Fragment und die Eisbombe haben, was ein zusätzliches Level erfordert, wenn Sie einen großen Kerl zum Teufel spammen wollen. Denken Sie daran, ich bin in jenen Tagen ziemlich grün, in denen jemand, der mit FPS-Spielen ziemlich klassisch ist, das System möglicherweise nicht mag. Für mich ist dies ziemlich erfrischend im Vergleich zu einem durchschnittlichen.

This is best game I've played in a while. The combat is fluid with every gun being fun to use and actually viable. Obviously the super shotgun (double barrel) steals the show but it always has. The levels are so thought out and cleverly detailed with hidden collectables to find throughout the game. Most collectables are figures or codex entries but you can also find items to upgrade your guns, suit and abilities.The glory kills make the game a blast to play! Depending on where you look at an enemy when stunned, you will do a different glory kill (think finishers in mortal combat but faster). Unlike Doom 2016, Doom Eternal has enough variety in glory kills to make them still fun 40+ hours in! The whole gameplay loop of shooting enemies, glory killing them for health, lighting them on fire for shields and chainsawing enemies for ammo creates such a unique and fun cycle that never gets old. It's so satisfying to light a bunch of enemies on fire just to blow them up with a singe rocket and getting a billion armour/health drops. I heard some people complain that Doom Eternal has a story but most of them clearly didn't play the game. The story is literally people telling the Doom Slayer he can't defeat the demons and then he goes to defeat them anyway because f*#k demons. The codex entries are there for those who do want to delve into some Doom lore. It's not essential although it contains a very interesting twist on the whole Heaven and Hell thing. The multiplayer is fun but I haven't spent much time on it as I buy a doom game for the singleplayer. Worth full price

I've been playing Doom: Eternal regularly since launch and still love it. It will be one of those games I keep coming back to time and time again for the rest of my life and it's easily up there as one of my favorite games of all time.

Pros:- The soundtrack is phenomenal- The movement and combat is fluid, more so than any other recent game that I can think of- The art design is just spot onCons:- The story isn't the best, it's not bad, but it doesn't achieve the same level of quality as the other parts that make up the game
